English: Now King David was old, advanced in years; and they put covers on him, but he could not get warm.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit đĭ kră sơnăm đĭ kơjung boih, mă khan đe pơhrŭk ăn hơbĕn ao kơ sư lơ hơdôm blah ră mă-lei sư oei ưh kơ tơnŏ.

English: Therefore his servants said to him, “Let a young woman, a virgin, be sought for our lord the king, and let her stand before the king, and let her care for him; and let her lie in your bosom, that our lord the king may be warm.”
Bahnar: Na lu đĭch đam sư khan kơ sư: “Lê̆ nhôn chă ăn kơ ih mă yŏng pơtao nhôn, minh 'nu adruh 'nao iung, wă kơ sư awih awăn păng wei-lăng ih. Sư gô 'bĭch 'bơ̆t cheng ih, wă kơ ih, yŏng pơtao nhôn tơnŏ.

English: So they sought for a lovely young woman throughout all the territory of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu sư chă minh 'nu adruh 'lơ̆ng guăng đơ̆ng lăm dêh char Isơrael, lu sư chă 'bôh minh 'nu adruh anăn sư Abisak, bơngai Sunami păng chông ba sư năm tơ pơtao.

English: The young woman was very lovely; and she cared for the king, and served him; but the king did not know her.
Bahnar: Adruh noh 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ dêh, sư wei-lăng păng awih awăn kơ pơtao, mă-lei pơtao ưh kơ jê̆ sư ôh.

English: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, “I will be king”; and he prepared for himself chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
Bahnar: Adonija kon yă Hagit, pôk atŏk sư kơdih khan: “Inh gô pơm pơtao” Sư chă hơmet kơ sư gre aseh lơlap păng chă bơngai hao gre aseh đei pơđăm-jĭt 'nu kơdâu adrol kơ sư.

English: (And his father had not rebuked him at any time by saying, “Why have you done so?” He was also very good-looking. His mother had borne him after Absalom.)
Bahnar: 'Bă sư ưh kơ đei wă pơm kơ sư sơ'ngon ôh, hăm nơ̆r jet: “Liơ e pơm thoi noh?” Adonija jơ̆ minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ dêh, mĕ sư tơpŭ kơ sư đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Apsalôm.

English: Then he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the priest, and they followed and helped Adonijah.
Bahnar: Sư pơđâu băl hăm Jôap kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia păng hăm 'bok soi Abiathar. Lu sư kiơ̆ Adonija păng tơgŭm sư.

English: But Zadok the priest, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and the mighty men who belonged to David were not with Adonijah.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok soi Sadôk, Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada, Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, Simei, Rei păng lu linh Đawit mă nuih kơtang ưh kơ kiơ̆ ôh Adonija.

English: And Adonijah sacrificed sheep and oxen and fattened cattle by the stone of Zoheleth, which is by En Rogel; he also invited all his brothers, the king’s sons, and all the men of Judah, the king’s servants.
Bahnar: Adonija pơyơ̆r triu, rơmo păng kon rơmo bek, pơm tơmam soi 'bơ̆t tơmo Sohôlet, jê̆ Ên Rôgel. Sư krao wơ̆n đĭ-đăng 'nhŏng oh sư, lu kon drŏ-nglo pơtao, păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r mă bơ̆jang kơ pơtao.

English: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the mighty men, or Solomon his brother.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ krao wơ̆n ôh Nathan 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, dah Bênaia, dah lu linh nuih kơtang păng kư̆m ưh kơ krao wơ̆n mơ̆n Sôlômôn oh sư.

English: So Nathan spoke to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, “Have you not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith has become king, and David our lord does not know it?
Bahnar: Na Nathan khan kơ Batsêba mĕ Sôlômôn. “Ih ưh kơ băt ôh hă Adonija kon drŏ-nglo yă Hagit pơm pơtao, mă Đawit pơtao bơ̆n kư̆m ưh kơ băt mơ̆n tơdrong noh hă?

English: Come, please, let me now give you advice, that you may save your own life and the life of your son Solomon.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na dang ei năm tơ âu bĕ, inh tơbăt kơ ih trong wă kơ ih pơklaih tơdrong arih ih kơdih păng pơklaih tơdrong arih kon drŏ-nglo ih Sôlômôn.

English: Go immediately to King David and say to him, ‘Did you not, my lord, O king, swear to your maidservant, saying, “Assuredly your son Solomon shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne“? Why then has Adonijah become king?’
Bahnar: Ih năm hloi bĕ tơ pơtao Đawit păng khan kơ sư: Ơ pơtao, yŏng inh! Ih hăm pơkă pơkăm hăm đam drŏ-kăn ih khan: Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo inh, ih gô pơtrơp pơm pơtao tơplih inh, sư oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao dah kiơ? Liơ dang ei tă tơ Adonija pơm pơtao?

English: Then, while you are still talking there with the king, I also will come in after you and confirm your words.”
Bahnar: Kơplah ih oei tơ noh pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao, inh gô mơ̆t kiơ̆ ih păng wă pơsĭt dôm nơ̆r ih.”

English: So Bathsheba went into the chamber to the king. (Now the king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was serving the king.)
Bahnar: Na, yă Batsêba năm tơ lăm anih pơtao. Pơtao đĭ kră dêh boih. Đei Abisak drŏ-kăn bơngai Sunamit awih awăn kơ pơtao

English: And Bathsheba bowed and did homage to the king. Then the king said, “What is your wish?”
Bahnar: yă Batsêba năm drap kơkuh kơ pơtao Na pơtao jet: “Ih wă tơdrong kiơ?”

English: Then she said to him, “My lord, you swore by the LORD your God to your maidservant, saying, ‘Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne.’
Bahnar: Yă Batsêba tơl: “Ơ pơtao, ih đei pơkă pơkăm boih hăm inh đam ih, hăm anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih: ‘Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo inh gô pơm pơtao tơplih inh, sư gô hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao inh.’

English: So now, look! Adonijah has become king; and now, my lord the king, you do not know about it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ pơtao yŏng inh, dang ei Adonija pơm pơtao mă ih ưh kơ băt ôh tơdrong noh

English: He has sacrificed oxen and fattened cattle and sheep in abundance, and has invited all the sons of the king, Abiathar the priest, and Joab the commander of the army; but Solomon your servant he has not invited.
Bahnar: Sư pơyơ̆r boih tơmam soi hăm rơmo tơno, rơmo dăm bek păng triu lơ dêh păng sư kư̆m đei krao wơ̆n đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo pơtao, 'bok soi Abiathar păng Jôap yŏng linh, mă-lei đam ih Sôlômôn noh sư ưh kơ wơ̆n ôh.

English: And as for you, my lord, O king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who will sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
Bahnar: Ơ pơtao yŏng inh, dang ei măt bơngai Isơrael oei lăng tơ ih ngăl wă răp gô ih roi ăn kơ lu sư băt bơngai bu wă hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao tơplih ih.

English: Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king rests with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon will be counted as offenders.”
Bahnar: Dah ưh lăm minh năr ei kơnh ih yŏng pơtao inh lôch oei hơdai 'bok yă, lei đe gô jô̆ kơ nhi Sôlômôn pơm yoch”

English: And just then, while she was still talking with the king, Nathan the prophet also came in.
Bahnar: Kơplah yă Batsêba oei pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao, Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mơ̆t.

English: So they told the king, saying, “Here is Nathan the prophet.” And when he came in before the king, he bowed down before the king with his face to the ground.
Bahnar: Đe roi kơ pơtao: “Đei Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol truh.” Nathan năm truh 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao kŭp kơ̆l drap kơkuh.

English: And Nathan said, “My lord, O king, have you said, ‘Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne’?
Bahnar: Nathan khan: “Ơ pơtao ih hăm đei khan kơ Adônja gô hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp ih?

English: For he has gone down today, and has sacrificed oxen and fattened cattle and sheep in abundance, and has invited all the king’s sons, and the commanders of the army, and Abiathar the priest; and look! They are eating and drinking before him; and they say, ‘Long live King Adonijah!’
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu sư jur năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi rôp rơmo tơno, kon rơmo dăm bek păng triu lơ dêh, na sư kư̆m đei krao wơ̆n đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo pơtao, Jôap yŏng linh, 'bok soi Abiathar; lu sư oei et sa 'bơ̆t anăp Adonija păng jreo ôr 'bơ̆r re khan: ‘Adonija pơtao arih sot!’

English: But he has not invited me—me your servant—nor Zadok the priest, nor Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, nor your servant Solomon.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ krao wơ̆n inh đam ih, dah 'bok soi Sadok, Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada, păng Sôlômôn đam ih ôh.

English: Has this thing been done by my lord the king, and you have not told your servant who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?”
Bahnar: Ơ pơtao, tơdrong 'nâu hăm trŏ kơ đơ̆ng ih ăn? Păng ih kư̆m ưh kơ ăn kơ lu đĭch đam ih băt bơngai wă pơm pơtao pơtrơp ih, hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ ih?”

English: Then King David answered and said, “Call Bathsheba to me.” So she came into the king’s presence and stood before the king.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit khan: “Krao Batsêba năm tơ âu;” na đe krao yă Batsêba mơ̆t, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao

English: And the king took an oath and said, “As the LORD lives, who has redeemed my life from every distress
Bahnar: Pơtao pơkă pơkăm khan: “Hơpơi Kră Yang mă oei arih, Tơ'ngla pơklaih inh đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat truh.

English: just as I swore to you by the LORD God of Israel, saying, ‘Assuredly Solomon your son shall be king after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place,’ so I certainly will do this day.”
Bahnar: Thoi inh đei pơkă pơkăm boih hăm ih hăm anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tơpă: Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo ih gô pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp inh, sư gô hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ tơplih inh, năr 'nâu boih inh gô pơm pơkeh tơdrong noh.”

English: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and paid homage to the king, and said, “Let my lord King David live forever!”
Bahnar: Yă Batsêba kŭp kơ̆l drap tơ teh kơkuh kơ pơtao Đawit păng khan: “Hơpơi yŏng inh pơtao Đawit arih sot!”

English: And King David said, “Call to me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada.” So they came before the king.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit khan: “Krao 'bok soi Sadok, krao Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol păng krao Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada năm tơ âu;” thoi noh na lu sư năm tơ anăp pơtao.

English: The king also said to them, “Take with you the servants of your lord, and have Solomon my son ride on my own mule, and take him down to Gihon.
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ lu sư: “Chông ba lu đĭch đam inh mă yŏng tơ'ngla iĕm, hơdai hăm iĕm na iĕm hiŏng atŏk Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo inh kơpal aseh dăm inh, ba sư truh tơ pơlei Gihôn

English: There let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him king over Israel; and blow the horn, and say, ‘Long live King Solomon!’
Bahnar: Tơ noh bre 'bok soi Sadok hăm Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu pôk sư pơm pơtao Isơrael, lu iĕm hlôm tơgiĕp na jreo re khan: Pơtao Sôlômôn arih sot!

English: Then you shall come up after him, and he shall come and sit on my throne, and he shall be king in my place. For I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and Judah.”
Bahnar: Iĕm năm kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng sư tŏk truh tơ anih pơtao, sư gô hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp inh. Inh pơjao ăn kơ sư pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael păng lu bơngai Juđa.”

English: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king and said, “Amen! May the LORD God of my lord the king say so too.
Bahnar: Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada tơl pơtao, “A-men! Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih yŏng inh, kư̆m khan thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: As the LORD has been with my lord the king, even so may He be with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord King David.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm ih mă yŏng inh thoi yơ, apinh Kră Yang kư̆m oei hơdai Sôlômôn thoi noh mơ̆n, păng pơm ăn tang-dŏ pơtao sư tih hloh kơ tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit yŏng inh dơ̆ng.”

English: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites, and the Pelethites went down and had Solomon ride on King David’s mule, and took him to Gihon.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'bok soi Sadok, Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada păng lu bơngai Kêrêthit, lu bơngai Phêlêthit jur năm hiŏng atŏk Sôlômôn tơ kơpal kơdŭ aseh dăm pơtao Đawit, klaih kơ noh năm ba sư tơ pơlei Gihôn.

English: Then Zadok the priest took a horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. And they blew the horn, and all the people said, “Long live King Solomon!”
Bahnar: Tơ noh 'bok soi Sadok iŏk hơke mong đak pơgang 'bâu phu đơ̆ng lăm bơsŭn anih akŭm tuh kơpal kơ̆l Sôlômôn. Đe hlôm tơgiĕp păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla ôr jreo pơma khan: “Sôlômôn pơtao arih sot!”

English: And all the people went up after him; and the people played the flutes and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth seemed to split with their sound.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng, hlôm 'lal chhôk hơnôk dêh tơpă, teh mah pơpơ̆ kyĭng kyơ̆ng đơ̆ng jơwa nơ̆r lu sư ôr jreo.

English: Now Adonijah and all the guests who were with him heard it as they finished eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the horn, he said, “Why is the city in such a noisy uproar?”
Bahnar: Adonija păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă sư wơ̆n sŏng sa đang boih, lu sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ôr jreo. Jôap kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm keng, na jet: “Đei nơ̆r jơwa ôr jreo lăm pơlei 'nei đei tơdrong kiơ kih?”

English: While he was still speaking, there came Jonathan, the son of Abiathar the priest. And Adonijah said to him, “Come in, for you are a prominent man, and bring good news.”
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei pơma, blư kơ Jônathan kon 'bok soi Abiathar truh, na Adonija khan: “Mơ̆t tơ âu bĕ, ih boih minh 'nu bơngai đe pơyom sĭt, rŏ lăng ih ba tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng.”

English: Then Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, “No! Our lord King David has made Solomon king.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jônathan tơl: “Ưh ôh, pơtao Đawit yŏng bơ̆n pôk ăn kơ Sôlômôn pơm pơtao boih.

English: The king has sent with him Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the Cherethites, and the Pelethites; and they have made him ride on the king’s mule.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit đei wơh 'bok soi Sadok, Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada, lu bơngai Kêrêthit păng lu bơngai Phelêthit kiơ̆ Sôlômôn, đơ̆ng noh lu sư hiŏng atŏk Sôlômôn tơ kơpal aseh dăm pơtao.

English: So Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king at Gihon; and they have gone up from there rejoicing, so that the city is in an uproar. This is the noise that you have heard.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi Sadok, Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu tơ kơ̆l pôk sư pơm pơtao tơ pơlei Gihôn; đơ̆ng noh lu sư tŏk năm hăm tơdrong chhôk hal, păng đei jơwa nơ̆r pơma ơ-ơ̆r ơ-ăr jơ̆p tơ lăm pơlei tih mă iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng boih noh.

English: Also Solomon sits on the throne of the kingdom.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao.

English: And moreover the king’s servants have gone to bless our lord King David, saying, ‘May God make the name of Solomon better than your name, and may He make his throne greater than your throne.’ Then the king bowed himself on the bed.
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam pơtao năm sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ pơtao Đawit yŏng bơ̆n, lu sư khan: ‘Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih ăn kơ anăn Sôlômôn ư-ang tih hloh kơ anăn ih, ăn kơ tang-dŏ pơtao sư tih hloh kơ tang-dŏ pơtao.’ Đawit kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh 'bơ̆t giơng sư 'bĭch

English: Also the king said thus, ‘Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who has given one to sit on my throne this day, while my eyes see it!’ ”
Bahnar: păng khan: ‘Kơkuh bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, năr 'nâu Ih đei ăn kơ măt inh đei 'bôh boih kon drŏ-nglo inh hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao inh.’ ”

English: So all the guests who were with Adonijah were afraid, and arose, and each one went his way.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă năm et sa hơdai hăm Adonija hli tơrơ, rim 'nu lu sư lĕch brŏk kơdih kơdih.

English: Now Adonijah was afraid of Solomon; so he arose, and went and took hold of the horns of the altar.
Bahnar: Adonija hli kơ Sôlômôn, iung kơdâu năm rôp kơjăp lu hơke mum chơnang soi.

English: And it was told Solomon, saying, “Indeed Adonijah is afraid of King Solomon; for look, he has taken hold of the horns of the altar, saying, ‘Let King Solomon swear to me today that he will not put his servant to death with the sword.’ ”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai năm tơbăt ăn kơ Sôlômôn: “Adonija hli kơ ih, to sư oei rôp kơjăp hơke chơnang soi păng khan: Rŏ kơ pơtao Sôlômôn pơkă pơkăm hăm inh mă đĭch đam sư khan sư ưh kơ đei pơlôch inh ôh hăm đao gưm.”

English: Then Solomon said, “If he proves himself a worthy man, not one hair of him shall fall to the earth; but if wickedness is found in him, he shall die.”
Bahnar: Sôlômôn tơl: “Tơdah sư arih sa pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt lei mă minh dăng sŏk đơ̆ng kơ̆l sư ưh kơ đei huŏng ôh tơ teh, mă-lei tơdah đe 'bôh sư pơm yoch sư gô lôch.”

English: So King Solomon sent them to bring him down from the altar. And he came and fell down before King Solomon; and Solomon said to him, “Go to your house.”
Bahnar: Na pơtao Sôlômôn wơh bơngai năm krao iŏk sư jur đơ̆ng chơnang soi. Adonija năm drap kơkuh kơ pơtao Sôlômôn; dơ̆ng noh pơtao Sôlômôn khan kơ sư: “Brŏk tơ hnam ih bĕ.”

English: Now the days of David drew near that he should die, and he charged Solomon his son, saying
Bahnar: Năr Đawit lôch wă jê̆ truh boih, na sư tơtă kơ Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo sư

English: “I go the way of all the earth; be strong, therefore, and prove yourself a man.
Bahnar: “Inh wă jê̆ năm boih tơ trong mă đĭ-đăng kon bơngai ala teh âu gô năm, ih athei pran kơtang bĕ păng pơdah ih jing minh 'nu bơngai yŏng nuih.

English: And keep the charge of the LORD your God: to walk in His ways, to keep His statutes, His commandments, His judgments, and His testimonies, as it is written in the Law of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do and wherever you turn
Bahnar: Păng athei wei răk dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơkă, wă kơ ih pơm kiơ̆, yak năm rok trong Sư, wei răk dôm tơdrong juăt Sư păng dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, păng dôm nơ̆r Sư bơtho, thoi đei chih boih lăm tơdrong juăt Môis, wă kơ dôm tơdrong ih jang kiơ, pơm kiơ, dah năm tơ yơ gô hiôk jơnap

English: that the LORD may fulfill His word which He spoke concerning me, saying, ‘If your sons take heed to their way, to walk before Me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul,’ He said, ‘you shall not lack a man on the throne of Israel.’
Bahnar: păng wă kơ Kră Yang gô pơsĭt nơ̆r Sư pơkă hăm inh khan: ‘Tơdah lu kon sâu ih kơchăng arih sa, tơdah lu sư wă yak năm 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Inh hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak, lei ih ưh kơ'bah ôh bơngai hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao Isơrael pơtrơp ih.’

English: “Moreover you know also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, and what he did to the two commanders of the armies of Israel, to Abner the son of Ner and Amasa the son of Jether, whom he killed. And he shed the blood of war in peacetime, and put the blood of war on his belt that was around his waist, and on his sandals that were on his feet.
Bahnar: Ih băt mơ̆n tơdrong kiơ Jôap kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia pơm boih kơ 'bă păng pơm boih kơ 'bar 'nu yŏng linh Isơrael, Apner kon drŏ-nglo Nêr păng Amasa kon drŏ-nglo Jêther, sư pơlôch bre noh kơplah rơngei hiôk-hian nhen thoi kơplah oei tơblah wang hrang tơ'bet, pham oei klep 'bơ̆t tơlei tơ̆n sư păng tơ chơkhŏ sư oei 'bot.

English: Therefore do according to your wisdom, and do not let his gray hair go down to the grave in peace.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, pơm bĕ kiơ̆ kơ ih gơh hơgei, mă-lei 'nĕ kơ lê̆ kơ̆l sŏk ko sư jur tơ dêh atâu hiôk-hian.

English: “But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be among those who eat at your table, for so they came to me when I fled from Absalom your brother.
Bahnar: Ih athei oei hiôk hơiă hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo Barsilai bơngai Gileat, ih athei pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu sư, ăn kơ lu sư sŏng sa hơdai hăm ih minh pôm gơ'bang, yua kơ sơ̆ lu sư kư̆m pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ inh, sơng iŏk inh kơplah inh kơdâu jăk đơ̆ng Apsalôm 'nhŏng ih.

English: “And see, you have with you Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite from Bahurim, who cursed me with a malicious curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim. But he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to him by the LORD, saying, ‘I will not put you to death with the sword.’
Bahnar: Kŭm đei, anăn sư Simei kon drŏ-nglo Gêra, bơngai Bênjamin đơ̆ng pơlei Bahurim, sư yua lu nơ̆r kơnê̆ blei hiap 'bă lăm năr mă 'bă truh tơ Mahanaim, mă-lei 'bơ̆t sư jur tơ'bơ̆p inh tơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, na inh yua hăm anăn Kră Yang pơkă pơkăm hăm sư: Inh ưh kơ pơlôch ih hăm đao gưm.

English: Now therefore, do not hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man and know what you ought to do to him; but bring his gray hair down to the grave with blood.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na dang ei ih 'nĕ kơ jô̆ sư noh ưh kơ đei yoch, yua kơ ih jơ̆ minh 'nu bơngai gơh hơgei, ih băt wă pơm kơ sư thoi yơ, ih athei pơm kơ kơ̆l sŏk ko sư 'bơm pham ngăl na jur tơ dêh atâu.”

English: So David rested with his fathers, and was buried in the City of David.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Đawit lôch, tep hiôk năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok yă sư, đe 'bŭ sư tơ pơlei Đawit.

English: The period that David reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years he reigned in Hebron, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
Bahnar: Chăl Đawit pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael đei puăn-jĭt sơnăm; sư pơgơ̆r tơ pơlei Hêbrôn tơpơh sơnăm, tơ pơlei Jêrusalem pêng-jĭt sơnăm.

English: Then Solomon sat on the throne of his father David; and his kingdom was firmly established.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit 'bă sư păng dêh char pơtao sư kơjăp 'lơ̆ng tơpă.

English: Now Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. So she said, “Do you come peaceably?” And he said, “Peaceably.”
Bahnar: Adonija kon drŏ-nglo yă Hagit năm tơ'bơ̆p yă Batsêba mĕ Sôlômôn. Yă Batsêba jet sư: “Ih năm tơ âu jơhngơ̆m hăm hiôk-hian ưh?” Sư tơl: “Jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk-hian.”

English: Moreover he said, “I have something to say to you.” And she said, “Say it.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Inh đei minh tơdrong wă pơma dơnuh hăm ih.” Yă Batsêba tơl: “Ih pơma bĕ.”

English: Then he said, “You know that the kingdom was mine, and all Israel had set their expectations on me, that I should reign. However, the kingdom has been turned over, and has become my brother’s; for it was his from the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư pơma: “Ih băt boih dêh char pơtao 'nâu trŏ kơ inh pơgơ̆r ră păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael chang wă kơ 'bôh inh pơgơ̆r ngăl, mă-lei dang ei dêh char âu jing oh inh pơgơ̆r, yua kơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn kơ sư.

English: Now I ask one petition of you; do not deny me.” And she said to him, “Say it.”
Bahnar: Dang ei inh đei minh tơdrong wă apinh ih, ih 'nĕ kơ sơngah.” Yă Batsêba tơl: “Ih pơma bĕ.”

English: Then he said, “Please speak to King Solomon, for he will not refuse you, that he may give me Abishag the Shunammite as wife.”
Bahnar: Adonija khan: “Apinh ih năm apinh pơtao Sôlômôn, sư ưh kơ sơngah ôh tơdah ih apinh sư, ăn kơ inh iŏk Abisak bơngai Sunamit noh pơm akăn.”

English: So Bathsheba said, “Very well, I will speak for you to the king.”
Bahnar: Yă Batsêba tơl: Ŏ ah, inh gô roi kơ pơtao tơdrong ih wă noh.

English: Bathsheba therefore went to King Solomon, to speak to him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her and bowed down to her, and sat down on his throne and had a throne set for the king’s mother; so she sat at his right hand.
Bahnar: Yă Batsêba năm tơ'bơ̆p pơtao Sôlômôn wă roi ăn kơ sư tơdrong Adonija wă noh, na pơtao Sôlômôn iung năm sơng păng kŭp kơ̆l kơkuh kơ mĕ sư, đơ̆ng noh sư hơ-oei tơ tang-dŏ pơtao sư păng athei đe iŏk ăn kơ mĕ sư tang-dŏ wă kơ hơ-oei, na mĕ sư hơ-oei gah 'ma kơ sư.

English: Then she said, “I desire one small petition of you; do not refuse me.” And the king said to her, “Ask it, my mother, for I will not refuse you.”
Bahnar: Yă Batsêba roi ăn kơ pơtao: “Inh đei minh tơdrong iĕ ioch wă apinh ih kon dăm, ih 'nĕ kơ sơngah.” Pơtao tơl: “Ơ mĕ, ih wă apinh kiơ? Inh ưh kơ sơngah ôh dôm tơdrong ih wă apinh.”

English: So she said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as wife.”
Bahnar: Na mĕ sư khan: “Apinh ih ăn kơ Adonija 'nhŏng ih iŏk Abisak bơngai Sunimit pơm akăn.”

English: And King Solomon answered and said to his mother, “Now why do you ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask for him the kingdom also—for he is my older brother—for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao Sôlômôn tơl mĕ sư: “Liơ ih apinh Abisak bơngai drŏ-kăn Sunamit ăn kơ Adonija pơm akăn? Liơ mĕ ưh kơ apinh iŏk đĭ dêh char 'nâu ăn kơ sư hloi, yua kơ sư 'nhŏng inh, liơ mĕ ưh kơ apinh ăn kơ sư 'bok soi Abiathar păng Jôap kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia hai.”

English: Then King Solomon swore by the LORD, saying, “May God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah has not spoken this word against his own life!
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn yua hăm anăn Kră Yang pơkăm khan: “Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm kơ inh phak inh mă trăp thoi Sư wă, tơdah Adonija ưh kơ lôch ôh yua kơ tơdrong sư apinh 'nâu.

English: Now therefore, as the LORD lives, who has confirmed me and set me on the throne of David my father, and who has established a house for me, as He promised, Adonijah shall be put to death today!”
Bahnar: Na dang ei kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang arih Tơ'ngla pơjing inh păng ăn kơ inh hơ-oei 'bơ̆t tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit 'bă inh, păng pơjing ăn kơ inh minh pôm hnam kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r sư đei pơkă boih, gô pơlôch Adonija năr 'nâu.”

English: So King Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he struck him down, and he died.
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao Sôlômôn wơh Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada năm koh pơlôch Adonija hloi.

English: And to Abiathar the priest the king said, “Go to Anathoth, to your own fields, for you are deserving of death; but I will not put you to death at this time, because you carried the ark of the Lord GOD before my father David, and because you were afflicted every time my father was afflicted.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn khan kơ 'bok soi Abiathar: “Ih athei brŏk tơ pơlei Anathôt, anih ih jang sa, ih trŏ kơ lôch ră, mă-lei năr âu inh ưh kơ pơlôch ih ôh, yua kơ ih tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp Đawit 'bă inh păng kư̆m wang pŭ tơdrong gleh pơmat hơdai hăm 'bă inh.”

English: So Solomon removed Abiathar from being priest to the LORD, that he might fulfill the word of the LORD which He spoke concerning the house of Eli at Shiloh.
Bahnar: Na Sôlômôn puh lê̆ Abiathar, ưh pă ăn sư pơm 'bok soi kơ Kră Yang dơ̆ng, noh wă pơsĭt nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơma khan lê̆ gah adrĕch Hêli tơ pơlei Silô.

English: Then news came to Joab, for Joab had defected to Adonijah, though he had not defected to Absalom. So Joab fled to the tabernacle of the LORD, and took hold of the horns of the altar.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nâu kơtơ̆ng truh tơ Jôap, yua kơ sư kiơ̆ khŭl Adonija, mă khan sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ khŭl Apsalôm ră, na sư kơdâu năm tơ bơsŭn anih hnam akŭm Kră Yang păng sư năm rôp hơke mum chơnang soi.

English: And King Solomon was told, “Joab has fled to the tabernacle of the LORD; there he is, by the altar.” Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go, strike him down.”
Bahnar: Đe năm roi kơ pơtao Sôlômôn khan: “Jôap kơdâu đơ̆ng âu boih năm tơ bơsŭn anih akŭm Kră Yang to dang ei sư oei rôp hơke 'bơ̆t mum chơnang soi.” Sôlômôn athei Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada khan: “Ih năm koh pơlôch sư bĕ.”

English: So Benaiah went to the tabernacle of the LORD, and said to him, “Thus says the king, ‘Come out!’ ” And he said, “No, but I will die here.” And Benaiah brought back word to the king, saying, “Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.”
Bahnar: Bênaia năm tơ bơsŭn anih akŭm Kră Yang, sư khan kơ Jôap: “Pơtao khan: Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng âu.” Jôap tơl: “Inh ưh kơ lĕch, inh gô lôch 'bơ̆t dâu.” Bênaia năm roi ăn kơ pơtao: “Inh khan boih kơ Jôap, sư khan sư ưh kơ lĕch.”

English: Then the king said to him, “Do as he has said, and strike him down and bury him, that you may take away from me and from the house of my father the innocent blood which Joab shed.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn khan: “Pơm bĕ thoi sư nơ̆r khan. Pơlôch sư păng 'bŭ sư, lei na inh păng hnam 'bă inh huay pă pŭ boih pham mă Jôap tuh tơdrong kơ đei.

English: So the LORD will return his blood on his head, because he struck down two men more righteous and better than he, and killed them with the sword—Abner the son of Ner, the commander of the army of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, the commander of the army of Judah—though my father David did not know it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm tơwih kơ Jôap đêl sư pơlôch tuh pham tuh plơ̆ tơ kơ̆l sư dơ̆ng, mă-lei Đawit 'bă inh, ưh kơ băt sư pơlôch 'bar 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hloh kơ sư, hăm đao gưm noh bre Apner kon drŏ-nglo Nêr, yŏng linh bơngai Isơrael păng Amasa kon drŏ-nglo Jêther, yŏng linh bơngai Juđa.

English: Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Joab and upon the head of his descendants forever. But upon David and his descendants, upon his house and his throne, there shall be peace forever from the LORD.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh pham bre noh gô tuh tơ kơpal kơ̆l Jôap păng tơ kơpal kơ̆l adrĕch adrung sư ling-lang; mă-lei Đawit păng adrĕch adrung sư, hnam dơnŏ, tang-dŏ pơtao sư Kră Yang gô ăn đei tơdrong hiôk-hian ling-lang.”

English: So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up and struck and killed him; and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Na Bênaia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada, tŏk năm pơlôch Jôap păng đe 'bŭ sư tơ teh sư lăm char glă.

English: The king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his place over the army, and the king put Zadok the priest in the place of Abiathar.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn pôk Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada pơm yŏng linh tơplih Jôap, pôk Sadok pơm 'bok soi tơplih Abiathar.

English: Then the king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, “Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and dwell there, and do not go out from there anywhere.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao Sôlômôn wơh đe năm krao Simei păng khan kơ sư: “Ih athei pơm hnam ih lăm pơlei Jêrusalem oei tơ noh 'nĕ chă lĕch năm tơ nai.

English: For it shall be, on the day you go out and cross the Brook Kidron, know for certain you shall surely die; your blood shall be on your own head.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ năr ayơ ih lĕch đơ̆ng noh tŏk hlôi kơ thong đak Sêdrôn ih gô lôch: Pham ih gô tuh plơ̆ tơ kơpal kơ̆l ih.”

English: And Shimei said to the king, “The saying is good. As my lord the king has said, so your servant will do.” So Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.
Bahnar: Simei tơl: “Nơ̆r ih pơkă 'noh 'lơ̆ng dêh, ih pơtao yŏng inh pơkă khan tơdrong kiơ, inh đĭch đam ih gô pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh.” Thoi noh Simei oei hloi tơ pơlei Jêrusalem đunh năr.

English: Now it happened at the end of three years, that two slaves of Shimei ran away to Achish the son of Maachah, king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, “Look, your slaves are in Gath!”
Bahnar: Lăp truh pêng sơnăm đei 'bar 'nu đĭch Simei kơdâu jăk tơ hnam Akis kon drŏ-nglo Maaka pơtao pơlei Gat. Đe năm roi tơbăt kơ Simei khan: “To, 'bar 'nu đĭch ih oei tơ pơlei Gat.”

English: So Shimei arose, saddled his donkey, and went to Achish at Gath to seek his slaves. And Shimei went and brought his slaves from Gath.
Bahnar: Simei iung hao aseh năm tơ pơlei Gat, truh tơ hnam Akis chă đĭch đam sư. Na chă 'bôh bơih sư chông ba 'bar 'nu đĭch đam sư 'noh brŏk.

English: And Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and had come back.
Bahnar: Đe năm roi ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn, Simei lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem sư năm tơ pơlei Gat păng sư brŏk bơih.

English: Then the king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, “Did I not make you swear by the LORD, and warn you, saying, ‘Know for certain that on the day you go out and travel anywhere, you shall surely die’? And you said to me, ‘The word I have heard is good.’
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn athei đe krao Simei păng khan: “Inh hăm đei athei ih pơkă hăm anăn Kră Yang păng inh pơkă păng khan kơ ih: ‘Ih athei băt tơdah năr ayơ ih lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem na năm tơ anih nai, ih gô lôch.’ Ih kư̆m đei pơkăm hăm inh: ‘Tơdrong ih pơkă 'noh 'lơ̆ng dêh, inh gô chu ih.’

English: Why then have you not kept the oath of the LORD and the commandment that I gave you?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh yua kơ kiơ ih ưh kơ wei răk nơ̆r ih pơkă hăm anăn Kră Yang păng nơ̆r inh đei pơkă bơih kơ ih?”

English: The king said moreover to Shimei, “You know, as your heart acknowledges, all the wickedness that you did to my father David; therefore the LORD will return your wickedness on your own head.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn khan dơ̆ng kơ Simei: “Ih băt bơih păng oei 'blŏk mơ̆n lăm jơhngơ̆m dôm tơdrong ih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Đawit, 'bă inh. Dang ei Kră Yang gô tơwih plơ̆ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ ih pơm noh tơ kơpal kơ̆l ih.

English: But King Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the LORD forever.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao Sôlômôn gô đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk păng tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit oei kơjăp ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.”

English: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he went out and struck him down, and he died. Thus the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'bok pơtao athei Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada năm pơlôch Simei; na Bênaia lĕch năm koh pơlôch hloi Simei. Dêh char pơtao oei kơjăp lăm tơpang ti Sôlômôn.

English: Now Solomon made a treaty with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and married Pharaoh’s daughter; then he brought her to the City of David until he had finished building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall all around Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm Pharaôn dêh Êyiptơ, iŏk kon adruh Pharaôn pơm akăn, chông ba sư brŏk oei tơ pơlei Đawit, oei tơ noh dĭng truh sư keh pơm hnam pơtao sư, pơm hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang păng man dur tăp dăr pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Meanwhile the people sacrificed at the high places, because there was no house built for the name of the LORD until those days.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei oei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi tơ anih groi kơjung 'mơ̆i, yua kơ kơplah noh pơtao tam mă pơm hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ anăn Kră Yang.

English: And Solomon loved the LORD, walking in the statutes of his father David, except that he sacrificed and burned incense at the high places.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn 'mêm yom kơ Kră Yang păng yak kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong juăt Đawit, 'bă sư, mă-lei sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi păng soh 'long 'bâu phu tơ anih groi kơjung.

English: Now the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there, for that was the great high place: Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on that altar.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn năm truh tơ pơlei Gibeôn wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi, yua kơ tơ anih soi kơpal groi kơjung mă kăl dêh. Tơ noh Sôlômôn pơyơ̆r minh-rơbâu tŏ tơmam soi 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: At Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said, “Ask! What shall I give you?”
Bahnar: Tơ pơlei Gibeôn Kră Yang tơ'bôh akâu sư kơ Sôlômôn lăm tơdrong apo kiơ̆ kơmăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Apinh bĕ tơdrong kiơ ih wă kơ Inh ăn kơ ih.”

English: And Solomon said: “You have shown great mercy to Your servant David my father, because he walked before You in truth, in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with You; You have continued this great kindness for him, and You have given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn tơl: “Ih đei tơ'bôh bơih tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tih kơ đĭch đam ih Đawit, 'bă inh, yua kơ sư đei đon lui păng jơhngơ̆m đon tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Ih: Ih oei tơ'bôh tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tih, na ăn kơ sư đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao sư truh năr 'nâu.

English: Now, O LORD my God, You have made Your servant king instead of my father David, but I am a little child; I do not know how to go out or come in.
Bahnar: Dang ei ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, Ih ăn bơih kơ inh đĭch đam Ih pơm pơtao pơtrơp đơ̆ng Đawit, 'bă inh; mă-lei inh bơngai oei 'lơ̆p, ưh kơ băt wă pơgơ̆r teh đak thoi yơ.

English: And Your servant is in the midst of Your people whom You have chosen, a great people, too numerous to be numbered or counted.
Bahnar: Inh đĭch đam Ih oei tŏk-bŏk kon pơlei pơla mă Ih rơih bơih, minh khŭl bơngai lơ kơdrâ̆m ưh kơ kĕ jô̆.

English: Therefore give to Your servant an understanding heart to judge Your people, that I may discern between good and evil. For who is able to judge this great people of Yours?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh apinh Ih ăn kơ inh mă đĭch đam Ih âu tơdrong gơh hơgei, wă kơ gơh sek tơlang tơdrong kon pơlei pơla ih, wă kơ inh băt kơnăl tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong kơnê̆; yua kơ bu gơh kĕ sek tơlang kơ lu kon pơlei pơla lơ dêh 'nâu?”

English: The speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.
Bahnar: Kră Yang lăp đon dêh kơ Sôlômôn apinh noh.

English: Then God said to him: “Because you have asked this thing, and have not asked long life for yourself, nor have asked riches for yourself, nor have asked the life of your enemies, but have asked for yourself understanding to discern justice
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư: “Yua kơ ih apinh tơdrong 'nâu, ưh kơ apinh kơ ih tơdrong arih sot, tơdrong mơdrŏng tih kư̆m ưh kơ apinh tơdrong kĕ jei blah pơrăm lu bơngai ayăt kơ ih, mă-lei ih apinh tơdrong hlôh wao gơh hơgei wă kơ gơh sek tơlang trŏ.

English: behold, I have done according to your words; see, I have given you a wise and understanding heart, so that there has not been anyone like you before you, nor shall any like you arise after you.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh ăn tơdrong ih apinh, ăn kơ ih hlôh wao gơh hơgei, dĭng mah lu bơngai adrol kơ ih ưh kơ đei bu hơtŏ kơ ih păng lu bơngai đơ̆ng rŏng kơ ih kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu dang ih.

English: And I have also given you what you have not asked: both riches and honor, so that there shall not be anyone like you among the kings all your days.
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng Inh gô ăn hloi kơ ih dôm tơdrong mă ih ưh kơ đei apinh, tơdrong mơdrŏng, tơdrong đe pơyom ư-ang, lăm đĭ chăl arih ih ưh kơ đei pơtao bu kĕ tam ih.

English: So if you walk in My ways, to keep My statutes and My commandments, as your father David walked, then I will lengthen your days.”
Bahnar: Tơdah ih yak năm kiơ̆ trong Inh păng wei răk tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă thoi Đawit, 'bă ih, lei Inh gô pơthim ăn kơ ih arih sot soi.”

English: Then Solomon awoke; and indeed it had been a dream. And he came to Jerusalem and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, offered up burnt offerings, offered peace offerings, and made a feast for all his servants.
Bahnar: Na Sôlômôn 'blơ̆ hơdơ̆r đơ̆ng tep mơn băt noh tơdrong apo. Sư iung brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi bơnê păng pơih et sa tih hơdai hăm lu đĭch đam păng lu yŏng bơ̆jang kơ sư.

English: Now two women who were harlots came to the king, and stood before him.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei 'bar 'nu drŏ-kăn đi năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao.

English: And one woman said, “O my lord, this woman and I dwell in the same house; and I gave birth while she was in the house.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu drŏ-kăn khan: Ơ 'bok pơtao! Nhi duch 'nâu oei hơdai minh pôm hnam, inh tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, sư kư̆m oei lăm noh mơ̆n.

English: Then it happened, the third day after I had given birth, that this woman also gave birth. And we were together; no one was with us in the house, except the two of us in the house.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh tơpŭ 'noh pêng năr sư kư̆m tơpŭ mơ̆n, 'bar 'nu nhi đĕch oei lăm hnam, ưh kơ đei bu nai ôh oei hơdai hăm nhi lăm hnam.

English: And this woman’s son died in the night, because she lay on him.
Bahnar: Kơplah oei tep kơmăng, sư kơtĭt 'bơm nge drŏ-nglo sư lôch hloi

English: So she arose in the middle of the night and took my son from my side, while your maidservant slept, and laid him in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.
Bahnar: Truh tơ tŏk-bŏk măng kơplah inh mă đĭch đam ih oei tep hlơ̆k, sư iung hiŏng iŏk kon nge drŏ-nglo inh oei brom 'bơ̆t kơtơh inh, đơ̆ng noh sư năm ming lê̆ nge drŏ-nglo sư mă lôch bơih noh 'bơ̆t kơtơh inh.

English: And when I rose in the morning to nurse my son, there he was, dead. But when I had examined him in the morning, indeed, he was not my son whom I had borne.”
Bahnar: Truh kiơ̆ pơgê hrôih, inh hơđơ̆r wă tơmŏm kon inh ră, mă-lei inh 'bôh sư lôch bơih, lăp truh 'năr lĕch hơdah inh lăng hơlen sư 'noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ kon inh pơjing ôh.

English: Then the other woman said, “No! But the living one is my son, and the dead one is your son.” And the first woman said, “No! But the dead one is your son, and the living one is my son.” Thus they spoke before the king.
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn minh 'noh tơl khan: “Ưh kơ trŏ kơ kon inh ôh, kon nge drŏ-nglo mă oei arih 'noh kon inh, nge drŏ-nglo mă lôch noh kon ih.” Mă-lei drŏ-kăn mă minh khan dơ̆ng: “Ưh kơ trŏ ôh nge drŏ-nglo mă lôch boih noh kon ih, nge drŏ-nglo oei arih 'nâu kon inh,” Bre sư pơjah băl tơdrong noh 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao.

English: And the king said, “The one says, ‘This is my son, who lives, and your son is the dead one’; and the other says, ‘No! But your son is the dead one, and my son is the living one.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao khan kơ bre sư: “Bơngai 'nâu khan: ‘Bơngai oei arih 'nâu kon inh, nge mă lôch bơih noh kon ih,’ bơngai noh khan: Ưh ôh, nge mă lôch bơih noh kon ih, bơngai mă oei arih noh kon inh!”

English: Then the king said, “Bring me a sword.” So they brought a sword before the king.
Bahnar: Pơtao khan dơ̆ng; “Lei iŏk ăn kơ inh đao tơ âu,” na đe iŏk ăn kơ sư đao.

English: And the king said, “Divide the living child in two, and give half to one, and half to the other.”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan: “Blah asong kon nge mă oei arih 'nâu, minh pah ăn kơ bơngai 'nâu, minh pah ăn kơ bơngai 'noh,”

English: Then the woman whose son was living spoke to the king, for she yearned with compassion for her son; and she said, “O my lord, give her the living child, and by no means kill him!” But the other said, “Let him be neither mine nor yours, but divide him.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei mĕ kon nge mă oei arih 'noh ưh kơeng, yua kơ sư 'mêm mơnat kơ kon sư dêh na sư khan kơ pơtao: “Ơ yŏng inh! Apinh ih ăn kơ bơngai 'noh kon nge mă oei arih 'nâu, ih 'nĕ kơ pơlôch sư.” Mă-lei mĕ bơngai nge lôch bơih 'noh khan: “Sư kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ kon inh, păng kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ kon ih blah song băl đĕch.”

English: So the king answered and said, “Give the first woman the living child, and by no means kill him; she is his mother.”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan dơ̆ng: “Iŏk ăn kơ bơngai 'nâu kon nge mă oei arih 'noh, iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơlôch sư, bơngai 'nâu bơih mĕ sư.”

English: And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had rendered; and they feared the king, for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him to administer justice.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael kơtơ̆ng tơdrong pơtao sek tơlang noh lu sư hli yom ư-ang kơ pơtao, yua kơ lu sư 'bôh pơtao đei tơdrong gơh hơgei đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ sek tơlang tơpăt.

English: So King Solomon was king over all Israel.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng dêh Isơrael.

English: And these were his officials: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai pơm tih jang hăm pơtao: Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Sadôk pơm 'bok soi.

English: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder
Bahnar: Êlihôrep păng Ahija kon drŏ-nglo Sisa pơm yŏng lu bơngai chih hla bơar; Jêhôsaphat kon drŏ-nglo Ahilut, bơngai chih răk dôm tơdrong truh.

English: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, over the army; Zadok and Abiathar, the priests
Bahnar: Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada pơm yŏng linh: Sađôk păng Abiathar pơm 'bok soi

English: Azariah the son of Nathan, over the officers; Zabud the son of Nathan, a priest and the king’s friend
Bahnar: Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Nathan pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r lu yŏng linh Sahut kon drŏ-nglo Nathan pơm 'bok kơiĕng păng buăl pơtao.

English: Ahishar, over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda, over the labor force.
Bahnar: Ahisar pơm yŏng wei-lăng hnam 'bok pơtao păng Ađôniram kon drŏ-nglo Apđa pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai bơnă jang gah tơmam.

English: And Solomon had twelve governors over all Israel, who provided food for the king and his household; each one made provision for one month of the year.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơm yŏng wei-lăng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, lu jang gah tơmam sa kơ pơtao minh khei minh 'nu lăm minh Sơnăm.

English: These are their names: Ben-Hur, in the mountains of Ephraim
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu sư: Ben Hur wei-lăng tơring groi Êphraim.

English: Ben-Deker, in Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth Shemesh, and Elon Beth Hanan
Bahnar: Ben Đêker wei-lăng pơlei Makas, pơlei Saalbim, pơlei Bêt Sêmes păng pơlei Êlôn Bet Hanan.

English: Ben-Hesed, in Arubboth; to him belonged Sochoh and all the land of Hepher
Bahnar: Bên Hêset wei-lăng tơring Arubôt; sư wei-lăng hloi pơlei Sôkô păng đĭ dêh Hêpher.

English: Ben-Abinadab, in all the regions of Dor; he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon as wife
Bahnar: Bên Abinađap wei-lăng đĭ-đăng lăm dêh char Naphot Dor; akăn sư Taphat, kon drŏ-kăn Sôlômôn.

English: Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach, Megiddo, and all Beth Shean, which is beside Zaretan below Jezreel, from Beth Shean to Abel Meholah, as far as the other side of Jokneam
Bahnar: Baana kon drŏ-nglo Ahilut wei-lăng lăm pơlei Taanach, pơlei Mêgiđô păng đĭ kơ pơlei Bêtsan jê̆ pơlei Sarêthan gah ala kơ pơlei Jêsreel păng iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Bêt Sêan truh kơ pơlei Abel Mêhôla, truh tơ pah to pơlei Jôkmêam.

English: Ben-Geber, in Ramoth Gilead; to him belonged the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, in Gilead; to him also belonged the region of Argob in Bashan—sixty large cities with walls and bronze gate-bars
Bahnar: Ben Gêber wei-lăng pơlei Ramôt Gileat, sư wei-lăng đĭ pơlei Jair kon drŏ-nglo Manase lăm char Gileat, sư kư̆m wei-lăng hloi pơlei Argôp lăm dêh char Basan, tơdrâu-jĭt tŏ pơlei tih đei dur man tăp dăr, 'măng dur chơkăl sư pơm păng kong.

English: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim
Bahnar: Ahinađap kon drŏ-nglo Iđô wei-lăng tơring Mahanaim.

English: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali; he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon as wife
Bahnar: Ahimaas wei-lăng tơring Naptali, oei kơ Basemat kon adruh pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: Baanah the son of Hushai, in Asher and Aloth
Bahnar: Baana kon drŏ-nglo Husai wei-lăng tơring Aser păng Bêalôt

English: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat kon drŏ-nglo Parua wei-lăng tơring Isakar.

English: Shimei the son of Elah, in Benjamin
Bahnar: Simei, kon drŏ-nglo Êla wei-lăng tơring char Bênjamin.

English: Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, in the country of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan. He was the only governor who was in the land.
Bahnar: Gêber kon drŏ-nglo Uri wei-lăng dêh char Gileat, 'nâu sơ̆ đêl dêh char Sihôn, khŭl bơngai Amôrit păng Ôk pơtao dêh char Basan. Minh 'nu sư đĕch pơgơ̆r đĭ lăm dêh char 'nâu.

English: Judah and Israel were as numerous as the sand by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and rejoicing.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei bơngai Juđa păng kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael lơlap lơlang thoi chuơh đak dơsĭ, lu sư sŏng sa păng chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: So Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, as far as the border of Egypt. They brought tribute and served Solomon all the days of his life.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla lăm dêh char sư, iŏk đơ̆ng đak Krong Ơphrat truh tơ dêh char Philistin păng truh tơ hơdral Êyiptơ. Rim kơ teh đak chu bơ̆jang păng ra ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn truh đĭ chăl arih sư.

English: Now Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty kors of fine flour, sixty kors of meal
Bahnar: Tơmam sŏng sa lăm hnam pơtao Sôlômôn kăl yua lăm rim năr; pêng-jĭt kĭ tơpŭng phe tơ'bâu 'lơ̆ng păng tơdrâu-jĭt kĭ tơpŭng phe tơ'bâu hmă

English: ten fatted oxen, twenty oxen from the pastures, and one hundred sheep, besides deer, gazelles, roebucks, and fatted fowl.
Bahnar: mơjĭt tŏ rơmo bek, mơjĭt tŏ rơmo đơ̆ng anih tơmăn 'nhĕt, minh-hrĕng tŏ triu păng ưh kơ jô̆ dôm sem bri, thoi jĭl juei, kơtŏng, iĕr bri, bip bri.

English: For he had dominion over all the region on this side of the River from Tiphsah even to Gaza, namely over all the kings on this side of the River; and he had peace on every side all around him.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r jơ̆p kơ dêh char gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak Krong Ơphrat, sư pơgơ̆r hloi lu pơtao dêh char noh, đơ̆ng pơlei Tipsa truh tơ pơlei Gasa păng sư oei hiôk hơiă hăm kon pơlei pơla jum dăr kơ sư.a

English: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, each man under his vine and his fig tree, from Dan as far as Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.
Bahnar: Lăm chăl pơtao Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r, bơngai Juđa păng bơngai Isơrael oei hiôk-hian, đơ̆ng pơlei Đan truh tơ pơlei Bêrsêba, rim 'nu kơ lu sư arih jang sa chơt hiôk ala tơnơm hơmu păng tơm hơra sư.

English: Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn đei puăn-jĭt rơbâu tŏ hơdrong aseh dui gre păng đei mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu lu linh chĕp gre aseh.

English: And these governors, each man in his month, provided food for King Solomon and for all who came to King Solomon’s table. There was no lack in their supply.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r tơring lu sư kiơ̆ kơ khei asong băl chă hơmet lê̆ tôm mah lăm rim khei tơmam sŏng sa ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn păng rim 'nu bơngai mă sŏng sa hơdai hăm pơtao, ưh kơ đei tơmam kiơ kơ'bah ôh.

English: They also brought barley and straw to the proper place, for the horses and steeds, each man according to his charge.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă hơmet 'ba tơ'bâu păng hơnong 'ba ăn kơ aseh hor gre păng aseh bơngai hao noh sa, kiơ̆ hloi đêl hơgăt bơih

English: And God gave Solomon wisdom and exceedingly great understanding, and largeness of heart like the sand on the seashore.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Sôlômôn hlôh băt tih dêh hăm đon hlôh wao dêh pă kĕ jô̆ nhen thoi chuơh cheng đak dơsĭ.

English: Thus Solomon’s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the men of the East and all the wisdom of Egypt.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn gơh hơgei hloh kơ tơdrong hơgei lu bơngai dêh char gah hơlĕch păng hloh kơ tơdrong gơh hơgei lu bơngai Êyiptơ.

English: For he was wiser than all men—than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol; and his fame was in all the surrounding nations.
Bahnar: Sư hơgei dêh hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai hơgei, kư̆m hơgei hloh kơ Êthan, bơngai Esra, hloh kơ Hêman, hloh kơ Kalkôl păng hloh kơ Đarđa lu kon drŏ-nglo Mahôl. Păng tơdrong ư-ang kơ sư kơtơ̆ng tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char tăp dăr.

English: He spoke three thousand proverbs, and his songs were one thousand and five.
Bahnar: Sư pơma pêng-rơbâu nơ̆r pơđơ̆k păng pơm minh-rơbâu pơđăm tơdrong hơri.

English: Also he spoke of trees, from the cedar tree of Lebanon even to the hyssop that springs out of the wall; he spoke also of animals, of birds, of creeping things, and of fish.
Bahnar: Sư pơma roi tôm lu tơnơm 'long đơ̆ng 'long hơngo tơ Liban truh tơ lu hla 'nhĕt bơmur chăt 'bơ̆t tơnăr, sư kư̆m đei pơma 'bơm trŏ gah sem brem lu sem păr 'bih kơep lep-ler păng lu ka lăm đak.

English: And men of all nations, from all the kings of the earth who had heard of his wisdom, came to hear the wisdom of Solomon.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rim kơ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai năm mơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei pơtao Sôlômôn păng đĭ-đăng lu pơtao lăm teh đak kư̆m đei kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong gơh hơgei sư.

English: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon, because he heard that they had anointed him king in place of his father, for Hiram had always loved David.
Bahnar: Kơplah Hiram pơtao Tirơ sư kơtơ̆ng Sôlômôn đe tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu pôk pơm pơtao pơtrơp đơ̆ng 'bă sư Đawit, na sư wơh hloi lu đĭch đam sư năm tơ Sôlômôn, yua kơ Hiram ling-lang pơm buăl juăt pơtao Đawit.

English: Then Solomon sent to Hiram, saying
Bahnar: Sôlômôn kư̆m tơwih nơ̆r kơ pơtao Hiram khan

English: You know how my father David could not build a house for the name of the LORD his God because of the wars which were fought against him on every side, until the LORD put his foes under the soles of his feet.
Bahnar: “Ih băt bơih yua kơ tơblah wang jơ̆p-jang tăp dăr, na Đawit 'bă inh sư tam mă gơh pơm Hnam Akŭm kơ anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư, dĭng truh tơ Kră Yang ăn kơ sư blah pơjuă lu ayăt tơ ala jơ̆ng sư.

English: But now the LORD my God has given me rest on every side; there is neither adversary nor evil occurrence.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, ăn boih kơ inh rơngei hiôk-hian tăp pang pă đei bu blah păng kư̆m pă đei tơdrong kiơ truh.

English: And behold, I propose to build a house for the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spoke to my father David, saying, “Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place, he shall build the house for My name.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh wă pơm Hnam Akŭm ăn kơ anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang khan kơ 'bă inh Đawit sơ̆: Inh gô ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo ih pơm pơtao pơtrơp đơ̆ng ih, sư gô pơm Hnam Akŭm kơ anăn Inh.

English: Now therefore, command that they cut down cedars for me from Lebanon; and my servants will be with your servants, and I will pay you wages for your servants according to whatever you say. For you know there is none among us who has skill to cut timber like the Sidonians.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na ih athei lu đĭch đam ih kăl tơgŭm inh 'long hơngo đơ̆ng char Liban, na inh kư̆m gô athei lu đĭch đam inh hai dai wang jang tơgŭm đĭch đam ih, inh gô apah lu đĭch đam ih gô mơ̆ng kơ đơ̆ng ih hơgăt, yua kơ ih kư̆m băt mơ̆n lu nhôn ưh kơ juăt kơ kăl 'long thoi lu kon pơlei Siđôn ôh.”

English: So it was, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly and said, Blessed be the LORD this day, for He has given David a wise son over this great people!
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Sôlômôn pơma thoi noh, na sư hiôk dêh sư khan: Kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang năr 'nâu Sư ăn kơ Đawit đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo gơh hơgei tôm tơdrong wă pơgơ̆r kon pơlei pơla tih dêh thoi âu.

English: Then Hiram sent to Solomon, saying: I have considered the message which you sent me, and I will do all you desire concerning the cedar and cypress logs.
Bahnar: Na Hiram sư wơh bơngai năm roi kơ Sôlômôn: “Inh kơtơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r ih wơh lu đĭch đam ih pơtruh kơ inh kiơ̆ thoi ih wă chă kăl 'long hơngo, hơngo hla iĕ.

English: My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon to the sea; I will float them in rafts by sea to the place you indicate to me, and will have them broken apart there; then you can take them away. And you shall fulfill my desire by giving food for my household.
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam inh gô dui hor 'long noh đơ̆ng char Liban ba tơ đak dơsĭ, na chô̆ pơm thoi thŏng-nan chơ ăn kơ ih truh tơ anih mă ih tơhlâu ăn kơ inh. Inh gô yuih lê̆ tơ noh ih gô iŏk đơ̆ng noh. Ih athei bơngơ̆t kiơ̆ thoi inh wă ăn kơ đĭ ŭnh hnam nhôn tơmam sa.”

English: Then Hiram gave Solomon cedar and cypress logs according to all his desire.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Hiram kăl ăn kơ Sôlômôn 'long hơngo păng 'long hơngo hla iĕ kiơ̆ thoi sư apinh wă.

English: And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand kors of wheat as food for his household, and twenty kors of pressed oil. Thus Solomon gave to Hiram year by year.
Bahnar: Gah Sôlômôn sư ăn kơ hnam Hiram 'bar-jĭt kơthŭng 'ba mi (kôr) wă pơm tơmam sŏng sa kơ đĭ ŭnh hnam pơtao Hiram păng kư̆m ăn 'bar-jĭt kơthŭng đak rơmă ôliwơ, rim sơnăm Sôlômôn ăn kơ pơtao Hiram thoi noh.

English: So the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as He had promised him; and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty together.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tuh ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn tơdrong gơh hơgei hlôh wao kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă hăm sư; Hiram măr sư Sôlômôn pơgơ̆p băl kơjăp 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: Then King Solomon raised up a labor force out of all Israel; and the labor force was thirty thousand men.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn krao đĭ lu bơngai Isơrael, năm jang pơdŭ 'long đei pêng-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai năm.

English: And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month in shifts: they were one month in Lebanon and two months at home; Adoniram was in charge of the labor force.
Bahnar: Pơtao wơh lu sư tơplih băl năm tơ char Liban, rim khei mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu bơngai. Lu sư oei tơ char Liban minh khei, păng 'bar khei oei tơ hnam, Ađôniram wei-lăng lu bơngai jang 'noh.

English: Solomon had seventy thousand who carried burdens, and eighty thousand who quarried stone in the mountains
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn đei tơpơh-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai tung tôi, păng tơhngam-rơbâu 'nu bơngai teh tơmo kơpal kông.

English: besides three thousand three hundred from the chiefs of Solomon’s deputies, who supervised the people who labored in the work.
Bahnar: Kŭm oei đei pêng-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng 'nu, mă pơtao Sôlômôn pơjao wei-lăng pơgơ̆r tơdrong jang man pơdơ̆ng păng tơwơh băl jang.

English: And the king commanded them to quarry large stones, costly stones, and hewn stones, to lay the foundation of the temple.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ pơtao Sôlômôn athei lu sư teh blah tơmo tih tơmo gĭt wă pơm jrăng hơnă Hnam Akŭm.

English: So Solomon’s builders, Hiram’s builders, and the Gebalites quarried them; and they prepared timber and stones to build the temple.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai thơ̆ jang kơ pơtao Sôlômôn păng pơtao Hiram, hăm lu bơngai Gêbal, lu sư teh tơmo păng kăl 'long wă pơm tơiung Hnam Akŭm.

English: And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, in the month of Ziv, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm puăn-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu bơngai Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ; sơnăm mă puăn lăm chăl Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael, kơplah khei Siu wă khan khei mă 'bar, sư pơtơm pơdơ̆ng tơiung pơm Hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: Now the house which King Solomon built for the LORD, its length was sixty cubits, its width twenty, and its height thirty cubits.
Bahnar: Hnam akŭm mă Sôlômôn pơm ăn kơ Kră Yang 'noh, tor sư pêng-jĭt hlok, wơ̆l sư mơjĭt păng kơjung sư mơjĭt-pơđăm hlok.

English: The vestibule in front of the sanctuary of the house was twenty cubits long across the width of the house, and the width of the vestibule extended ten cubits from the front of the house.
Bahnar: Kơdeng gah anăp hnam tor sư mơjĭt hlok hơtŏ hăm wơ̆l Hnam akŭm, wơ̆l sư să pơđăm hlok.

English: And he made for the house windows with beveled frames.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn sư kư̆m pơm 'măng-'mŏk Hnam akŭm pơkăp đei dơhlông găn.

English: Against the wall of the temple he built chambers all around, against the walls of the temple, all around the sanctuary and the inner sanctuary. Thus he made side chambers all around it.
Bahnar: Tơ rok tơnăr Hnam akŭm, sư pơm anih tăp dăr păng anih rơgoh, sư kư̆m pơm lơ anih tăp dăr.

English: The lowest chamber was five cubits wide, the middle was six cubits wide, and the third was seven cubits wide; for he made narrow ledges around the outside of the temple, so that the support beams would not be fastened into the walls of the temple.
Bahnar: Tăl ala să 'bar hlok minh puăt, tăl tŏk-bŏk să pêng hlok păng tăl mă pêng să pêng hlok minh puăt. Pơtao Sôlômôn man lu tơnăr mơ̆t tơ lăm wă kơ dan lu tơpung anih tăl na wă kơ huay kơ hơtŭt kơ tơnăr Hnam akŭm.

English: And the temple, when it was being built, was built with stone finished at the quarry, so that no hammer or chisel or any iron tool was heard in the temple while it was being built.
Bahnar: Năr wă pơdơ̆ng hnam đe yua tơmo đơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng đe teh 'măn lê̆ adrol bơih, kơplah lu sư pơdơ̆ng tơiung ưh pă đei kơtơ̆ng re mut teh, păng re lu tơmam đe pơm păng bơsei.

English: The doorway for the middle story was on the right side of the temple. They went up by stairs to the middle story, and from the middle to the third.
Bahnar: 'Măng mơ̆t tơ anih ala gah cheng Hnam akŭm gah gơal, đe yua kung dăr kơdŭt hơbâu jur tŏk tơ anih tăl tŏk-bŏk, na gơh tŏk tơ tăl mă pêng.

English: So he built the temple and finished it, and he paneled the temple with beams and boards of cedar.
Bahnar: Sư pơm Hnam akŭm păng pơkeh man noh. Sôlômôn sư roh tơpơng klơ̆p hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo bri.

English: And he built side chambers against the entire temple, each five cubits high; they were attached to the temple with cedar beams.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm lu anih rok tơnăr Hnam akŭm rim anih kơjung 'bar hlok minh puăt lu anih noh klep kơ Hnam akŭm hăm tơpung 'long hơngo.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Solomon, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ pơtao Sôlômôn

English: “Concerning this temple which you are building, if you walk in My statutes, execute My judgments, keep all My commandments, and walk in them, then I will perform My word with you, which I spoke to your father David.
Bahnar: “Gah Hnam akŭm mă ih oei pơm dang ei 'nâu, tơdah ih chu pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă păng chĕp răk dôm tơdrong juăt Inh bơtho khan, wei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă păng pơm kiơ̆, lei inh gô pơsĭt lu nơ̆r inh đei pơkă kơ 'bă ih Đawit lăm chăl arih ih.

English: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake My people Israel.”
Bahnar: Inh gô oei hơdai lu bơngai Isơrael. Inh ưh kơ achăng lê̆ ôh bơngai Isơrael kon pơlei pơla inh.”

English: So Solomon built the temple and finished it.
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao Sôlômôn pơm Hnam akŭm păng pơm pơkeh.

English: And he built the inside walls of the temple with cedar boards; from the floor of the temple to the ceiling he paneled the inside with wood; and he covered the floor of the temple with planks of cypress.
Bahnar: Pơ̆ng tơnăr hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo gah lăm đơ̆ng hơnă truh tơ kơpal, lơ̆k hơnă hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo hla iĕ.

English: Then he built the twenty-cubit room at the rear of the temple, from floor to ceiling, with cedar boards; he built it inside as the inner sanctuary, as the Most Holy Place.
Bahnar: Pơtao iŏk 'long hơngo, sư pĕng pơgăn anih mơjĭt hlok lăm Hnam akŭm, đơ̆ng hơnă truh tơ bơbŭng, noh Anih Rơgoh đe krao Anih Rơgoh Hloh.

English: And in front of it the temple sanctuary was forty cubits long.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp Anih 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh, tor să kơjung 'bar-jĭt hlok

English: The inside of the temple was cedar, carved with ornamental buds and open flowers. All was cedar; there was no stone to be seen.
Bahnar: Tơnăr lăm Hnam akŭm pơm pơ̆ng hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo ngăl, sư chhơ̆ chrek rup get đak păng pơkao 'nao tơlang, anih ayơ kư̆m pơ̆ng 'long dơnơ̆ng ngăl ưh kơ đei 'bôh tơmo ôh.

English: And he prepared the inner sanctuary inside the temple, to set the ark of the covenant of the LORD there.
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m pơm hơmet Anih 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh hloh wă tah hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang lăm noh.

English: The inner sanctuary was twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and twenty cubits high. He overlaid it with pure gold, and overlaid the altar of cedar.
Bahnar: Lăm anih Rơgoh hloh noh tor sư mơjĭt hlok, wơ̆l sư mơjĭt hlok păng kơjung sư kư̆m lei-lăi mơjĭt hlok; sư lom anih Rơgoh hloh hăm maih rơgoh sư kư̆m lom chơnang soi hăm tơ̆r, 'long hơngo.

English: So Solomon overlaid the inside of the temple with pure gold. He stretched gold chains across the front of the inner sanctuary, and overlaid it with gold.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn lom tơ lăm Hnam akŭm hăm maih rơgoh. Sư iŏk glang maih dăng 'bơ̆t anăp Anih Rơgoh hloh, anih mă lom hăm maih.

English: The whole temple he overlaid with gold, until he had finished all the temple; also he overlaid with gold the entire altar that was by the inner sanctuary.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn kư̆m lom jơ̆p Hnam akŭm hăm maih; sư kư̆m lom đĭ chơnang soi hăm maih 'măn lăm Anih Rơgoh Hloh 'noh.

English: Inside the inner sanctuary he made two cherubim of olive wood, each ten cubits high.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm lăm Anih Rơgoh Hloh noh 'bar tŏ rup chêrubim sư pơm hăm 'long ôliwơ kơjung sư pơđăm hlok.

English: One wing of the cherub was five cubits, and the other wing of the cherub five cubits: ten cubits from the tip of one wing to the tip of the other.
Bahnar: Minh pah pơnăr chêrubim să 'bar hlok minh puăt, minh pah dơ̆ng kư̆m 'bar hlok minh puăt, na đơ̆ng pah âu truh tơ jih pah to pơnăr đei pơđăm hlok.

English: And the other cherub was ten cubits; both cherubim were of the same size and shape.
Bahnar: Rup chêrubim mă 'bar kư̆m lei-lăi pơnăr sư kư̆m pơđăm hlok mơ̆n; 'bar tŏ chêrubim 'noh sư pơm tŏ ăi lei-lăi băl đĕch.

English: The height of one cherub was ten cubits, and so was the other cherub.
Bahnar: Chêrubim kơjung sư pơđăm hlok. Chêrubim mă 'bar kư̆m lei-lăi.

English: Then he set the cherubim inside the inner room; and they stretched out the wings of the cherubim so that the wing of the one touched one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall. And their wings touched each other in the middle of the room.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn dan lê̆ 'bar tŏ rup chêrubim oei bơyar pơnăr noh lăm Anih Rơgoh Hloh lăm Hnam akŭm. Minh pah pơnăr pah âu hơtŭt kơ tơnăr pah âu, minh pah pơnăr pah to hơtŭt kơ tơnăr pah to, 'bar pah pơnăr tơ'bưh băl tŏk-bŏk lăm Anih Rơgoh Hloh.

English: Also he overlaid the cherubim with gold.
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ chêrubim noh sư lom hăm maih.

English: Then he carved all the walls of the temple all around, both the inner and outer sanctuaries, with carved figures of cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers.
Bahnar: Tơ tơnăr tăp dăr kơ Hnam akŭm lăm Anih Rơgoh păng Anih Rơgoh Hloh sư chhơ̆ lu rup chêrubim, 'long gol, păng pơkao 'nao tơlang.

English: And the floor of the temple he overlaid with gold, both the inner and outer sanctuaries.
Bahnar: Hơnă Hnam akŭm sư kư̆m tuh lơ̆k hăm maih, mă Anih Rơgoh dah Anih Rơgoh hloh.

English: For the entrance of the inner sanctuary he made doors of olive wood; the lintel and doorposts were one-fifth of the wall.
Bahnar: Trong wă mơ̆t lăm Anih Rơgoh Hloh, sư pơm 'bar pah tơnang 'măng hăm tơ̆r 'long ôliwơ, 'long pơdơ̆ng đei pơđăm pah.

English: The two doors were of olive wood; and he carved on them figures of cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers, and overlaid them with gold; and he spread gold on the cherubim and on the palm trees.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t 'bar pah tơnang 'măng pơm hăm 'long ôliwơ noh, sư chhơ̆ rup chêrubim, 'long gol păng pơkao 'nao tơlang, sư hling hăm maih tơ rup chêrubim păng 'bơ̆t rup 'long gol rup pơkao 'nao tơlang.

English: So for the door of the sanctuary he also made doorposts of olive wood, one-fourth of the wall.
Bahnar: Trong mơ̆t tơ Anih Rơgoh, sư kư̆m pơm jrăng 'măng puăn pah hăm 'long ôliwơ

English: And the two doors were of cypress wood; two panels comprised one folding door, and two panels comprised the other folding door.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm 'bar hlak tơnang 'măng hăm 'long hơngo hla iĕ. 'Măng 'nâu đei 'bar hlak tơnang 'măng pơkăp băl gơh pơih păng 'măng mă minh kư̆m đei 'bar hlak tơnang 'măng pơkăp kơjăp băl gơh pơih.

English: Then he carved cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers on them, and overlaid them with gold applied evenly on the carved work.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn sư chhơ̆ lu rup chêrubim, 'long gol păng pơkao 'nao tơlang, sư kư̆m bah hăm maih, lu trong rek đêl chhơ̆.

English: And he built the inner court with three rows of hewn stone and a row of cedar beams.
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m man cham lăm Hnam akŭm đei pêng trong tơmo gĭt rang teh blah pơiel, păng roh minh trong tơpơng găn hăm 'long hơngo.

English: In the fourth year the foundation of the house of the LORD was laid, in the month of Ziv.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă puăn, 'blep kơ khei Siu. Hnam akŭm Kră Yang man pơdơ̆ng jrăng.

English: And in the eleventh year, in the month of Bul, which is the eighth month, the house was finished in all its details and according to all its plans. So he was seven years in building it.
Bahnar: Truh tơ sơnăm mă mơjĭt-mônh, 'blep kơ khei Bul wă khan khei tơhngam, đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong jang man Hnam akŭm Kră Yang noh keh đang ngăl bơih kiơ̆ 'blep thoi đei hơgăt lê̆ adrol să iĕ, hơbŏ hnam noh. Pơtao Sôlômôn pơm Hnam akŭm 7 Kră Yang keh đĭ-đăng tơpơh sơnăm 'mơ̆i.

English: But Solomon took thirteen years to build his own house; so he finished all his house.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơm hnam pơtao sư keh đang lăm mơjĭt-pêng sơnăm.

English: He also built the House of the Forest of Lebanon; its length was one hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits, with four rows of cedar pillars, and cedar beams on the pillars.
Bahnar: Sư pơm hnam pơtao tơ Bri Liban tor sư pơđăm-jĭt hlok, wơ̆l sư 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hlok, kơjung sư mơjĭt-pơđăm hlok. Sư pơtăm pêng trong jrăng hăm 'long hơngo; đei 'long tơpơng roh kơpal, jrăng sư kư̆m pơm hăm 'long hơngo.

English: And it was paneled with cedar above the beams that were on forty-five pillars, fifteen to a row.
Bahnar: Ala bơbŭng hnam pơtao sư pơ̆ng sap hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo, đei puăn-jĭt pơđăm tŏ hơpok pơjăng, minh trong roh mơjĭt-pơđăm tŏ, sư pơ̆ng hơgơn 'bơ̆t kơ̆l jrăng.

English: There were windows with beveled frames in three rows, and window was opposite window in three tiers.
Bahnar: Đei pêng trong 'măng-'mŏk sư pơrĕng tơklă băl, kư̆ kơ rim pêng tŏ 'măng-'mŏk sư minh khŭl.

English: And all the doorways and doorposts had rectangular frames; and window was opposite window in three tiers.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng 'măng păng 'long dơ̆ng măng đei puăn hlak tơnang 'măng, tơklă băl, kư̆ pêng tŏ 'măng minh khŭl.

English: He also made the Hall of Pillars: its length was fifty cubits, and its width thirty cubits; and in front of them was a portico with pillars, and a canopy was in front of them.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơdeng hăm jrăng, kơdeng tor sư 'bar-jĭt pơđăm hlok, wơ̆l să sư mơjĭt-pơđăm hlok, gah anăp kơdeng âu sư đei jrăng pơrĕng gơweng păng đei dan bơbŭng.

English: Then he made a hall for the throne, the Hall of Judgment, where he might judge; and it was paneled with cedar from floor to ceiling.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn sư kư̆m pơm minh pôm anih wă dan tang-dŏ pơtao; anih sư sek tơlang; đe krao Anih Trŏ Hơnơ̆ng, anih sek tơlang noh sư pơm hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo. Sư pơm sap đơ̆ng hơnă truh tơ bơbŭng.

English: And the house where he dwelt had another court inside the hall, of like workmanship. Solomon also made a house like this hall for Pharaoh’s daughter, whom he had taken as wife.
Bahnar: Hnam mă pơtao Sôlômôn oei sư pơm gah rŏng kơ hnam tih 'noh. Sư man lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n. Sư kư̆m pơm minh pôm hnam, ăn kơ akăn sư, kon drŏ-kăn Pharaôn, sư pơm lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: All these were of costly stones cut to size, trimmed with saws, inside and out, from the foundation to the eaves, and also on the outside to the great court.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng hnam pơtao âu, sư pơm păng tơmo gĭt ngăl, sư bŏk blah teh tơmo âu pơtŏ hơgăt trŏ kiơ̆ gah rŏng păng gah klak. Mă đơ̆ng lăm truh tơ 'nguaih đơ̆ng ala truh tơ kơpal mă gah rŏng anăp.

English: The foundation was of costly stones, large stones, some ten cubits and some eight cubits.
Bahnar: Hơnă sư pơm hăm tơmo gĭt, tơmo să, minh hlak tor sư pơđăm hlok đei tơmo mơ'nah tor sư să puăn hlok.

English: And above were costly stones, hewn to size, and cedar wood.
Bahnar: Sư lơ̆k hơnă hăm tơmo gĭt blah kăt kiơ̆ pơtŏ bơih. Sư lơ̆k hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo kơpal.

English: The great court was enclosed with three rows of hewn stones and a row of cedar beams. So were the inner court of the house of the LORD and the vestibule of the temple.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tăp dăr tơnăr hăm pêng trong tơmo gĭt, păng roh pêng trong tơpơng hăm tơ̆r 'long hơngo, sư pơm lei-lăi thoi lăm kơdeng, hăm gah cham Hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: Now King Solomon sent and brought Huram from Tyre.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn wơh bơngai năm krao wơ̆n Hiram đơ̆ng pơlei Tirơ.

English: He was the son of a widow from the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a bronze worker; he was filled with wisdom and understanding and skill in working with all kinds of bronze work. So he came to King Solomon and did all his work.
Bahnar: Hiram minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, mĕ sư bơngai drŏ-kăn adro đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Neptali, 'bă sư sơ̆ đơ̆ng bơngai Tirơ, 'bă sư pơm bơ̆jang hling đak kong, Huram sư kư̆m minh 'nu bơngai gơh hơgei thoi 'bă sư sơ̆ bơ̆jang hling đak kong, sư năm truh tơ pơtao Sôlômôn, sư jang ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: And he cast two pillars of bronze, each one eighteen cubits high, and a line of twelve cubits measured the circumference of each.
Bahnar: Huram sư hling pơm 'bar tŏ jrăng hăm kong, sư hling rim jrăng kơjung mơjĭt-tơhngam hơgăt dah iŏk tơlei pơtŏ sư, hơpôm sư đei mơjĭt-'bar hơgăt.

English: Then he made two capitals of cast bronze, to set on the tops of the pillars. The height of one capital was five cubits, and the height of the other capital was five cubits.
Bahnar: Sư tuh pơm kơ̆l 'bar tŏ jrăng hăm kong sư pơdơ̆ng kơpal jrăng, kơjung kơ̆l jrăng noh pơđăm hơgăt mă jrăng gah to pơđăm hơgăt mơ̆n.

English: He made a lattice network, with wreaths of chainwork, for the capitals which were on top of the pillars: seven chains for one capital and seven for the other capital.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m hling hơdrao hăm kong dan tơ rim kơ̆l jrăng; rim kơ̆l jrăng sư pơm tơpơh dăng tơlei rơbưn hăm kong tanh gơwŏk đơ̆ng hơdrao kơ̆l jrăng, rơbưn âu sư pơm nhen thoi pơkao.

English: So he made the pillars, and two rows of pomegranates above the network all around to cover the capitals that were on top; and thus he did for the other capital.
Bahnar: Huram sư kư̆m hling 'bar trong plei gărnăt hăm kong chô̆ tơ hơdrao rim kơ̆l jrăng wă pơgong sư 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ.

English: The capitals which were on top of the pillars in the hall were in the shape of lilies, four cubits.
Bahnar: Rim kơ̆l jrăng lăm kơdeng anăp sư hling thoi pơkao 'brê tih sư puăn hơgăt.

English: The capitals on the two pillars also had pomegranates above, by the convex surface which was next to the network; and there were two hundred such pomegranates in rows on each of the capitals all around.
Bahnar: Rim 'nguaih kơ̆l jrăng 'noh sư hling minh trong; đei 'bar-hrĕng tŏ plei gărnăt, sư dăng tăp dăr kơ̆l jrăng 'noh.

English: Then he set up the pillars by the vestibule of the temple; he set up the pillar on the right and called its name Jachin, and he set up the pillar on the left and called its name Boaz.
Bahnar: Huram sư pơtăm 'bar tŏ jrăng noh anăp Hnam akŭm Kră Yang, sư pơtăm minh pôm jrăng gah 'ma. Sư anăn jrăng 'noh Jakin; sư pơtăm jrăng gah 'ngiĕo 'noh sư anăn jrăng Bôas.

English: The tops of the pillars were in the shape of lilies. So the work of the pillars was finished.
Bahnar: Tôch kơ̆l jrăng 'noh sư pơm rup pơkao tŏng-mŏng, đĭ dôm lu jrăng 'noh sư pơm keh bơih.

English: And he made the Sea of cast bronze, ten cubits from one brim to the other; it was completely round. Its height was five cubits, and a line of thirty cubits measured its circumference.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm bơng đak hơpôm hling hăm kong să mơjĭt hơgăt; kơjung pơđăm hơgăt, đei pêng-jĭt hơgăt jum dăr.

English: Below its brim were ornamental buds encircling it all around, ten to a cubit, all the way around the Sea. The ornamental buds were cast in two rows when it was cast.
Bahnar: Rok jih bơng đak 'noh sư tuh pơm rup get đak 'bar trong tăp dăr kơ bơng 'noh; kiơ̆ kơ lăm minh hơgăt mơjĭt tŏ get sư pơm kơtă hăm bơng đak 'noh

English: It stood on twelve oxen: three looking toward the north, three looking toward the west, three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east; the Sea was set upon them, and all their back parts pointed inward.
Bahnar: Bơng đak 'nâu dan kơpal kơdŭ rŏng mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo tơwih băl kiĕng, pêng tŏ tơ'bong sư tơwih gah hơlĕch, pêng tŏ tơ'bong sư tơwih gah bơmơ̆t, pêng tŏ tơ'bong sư tơwih gah gơal, pêng tŏ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: It was a handbreadth thick; and its brim was shaped like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom. It contained two thousand baths.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r bơng hơ'bơ̆l tŏ pah, gơnăp sư thoi gơnăp pơnhan đei thoi pơkao tŏng-mŏng, bơng 'nâu mong đei puăn-jĭt puăn-rơbâu lit đak.

English: He also made ten carts of bronze; four cubits was the length of each cart, four cubits its width, and three cubits its height.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm mơjĭt tŏ gre hăm kong jơ̆ng đei tang-wang hăm kong, lăm minh pôm gre 'noh tor sư 'bar hlok, wơ̆l sư kư̆m 'bar hlok; kơjung sư minh hlok minh puăt.

English: And this was the design of the carts: They had panels, and the panels were between frames
Bahnar: Sư pơm gre 'noh sư hling tơnăr hăm kong kơtă kơ akâu gre.

English: on the panels that were between the frames were lions, oxen, and cherubim. And on the frames was a pedestal on top. Below the lions and oxen were wreaths of plaited work.
Bahnar: Rim tơnăr 'noh sư hling đei rup dăm-brang, rup rơmo păng rup chêrubim, sư pơm kơpal păng ala kơ rup dăm-brang, rup rơmo, păng rup chêrubim đei chhơ̆ rup pơkao ngăl.

English: Every cart had four bronze wheels and axles of bronze, and its four feet had supports. Under the laver were supports of cast bronze beside each wreath.
Bahnar: Rim kơ gre 'noh sư pơm puăn tŏ jơ̆ng păng tơnung sư hăm kong, puăn pah mum 'noh sư pơm đei jơ̆ng sư wă kơ pơdơ̆ng kơjăp. Puăn tŏ jơ̆ng 'nâu hling pơklep kơ akâu gre, gah đaih kơ jơ̆ng gre âu đei chhơ̆ rup pơkao tŏng-mŏng.

English: Its opening inside the crown at the top was one cubit in diameter; and the opening was round, shaped like a pedestal, one and a half cubits in outside diameter; and also on the opening were engravings, but the panels were square, not round.
Bahnar: Kơpal hơnă gre đei hling gor pơm ala, gor 'nâu minh hơgăt hlom jrŭ tơ lăm tơpơh pơ̆t minh puăt, gah đaih tơnăr akâu sư hơli pơiel pơgong. Tơnăr sư pơm hăm kong blat ưh kơ hơpôm ala kơ rim hlak kong akâu sư noh đei.

English: Under the panels were the four wheels, and the axles of the wheels were joined to the cart. The height of a wheel was one and a half cubits.
Bahnar: Ala kơ rim hlak kong akâu sư noh đei puăn tŏ jơ̆ng gre, tơnung sư rim kơ jơ̆ng gre 'noh kơjung sư tơpơh pơ̆t minh puăt.

English: The workmanship of the wheels was like the workmanship of a chariot wheel; their axle pins, their rims, their spokes, and their hubs were all of cast bronze.
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng sư 'noh pơm lei-lăi thoi jơ̆ng gre aseh tơpă, lu tơnung dăr gre, tă kơ tuh hling ngăl.

English: And there were four supports at the four corners of each cart; its supports were part of the cart itself.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t rim puăn pah mum, ala kơ puăn tŏ jrăng tơjră sư hling mam pơm tơklep hăm akâu gre.

English: On the top of the cart, at the height of half a cubit, it was perfectly round. And on the top of the cart, its flanges and its panels were of the same casting.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆r kơpal gre sư đei gor hơpôm, kơjung sư minh puăt hơgăt, akâu gor păng jơ̆ng sư hling kơtă hăm kơpal 'bơ̆r gre.

English: On the plates of its flanges and on its panels he engraved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, wherever there was a clear space on each, with wreaths all around.
Bahnar: Kơpal kơ mam blat gơnăp hơpôm kơpal lu tơmam blat akâu gre sư chhơ̆ lu rup chêrubim, dăm-brang, hla gol, anih ayơ oei rơhơi sư chhơ̆ trong pơkao tăp dăr.

English: Thus he made the ten carts. All of them were of the same mold, one measure, and one shape.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm rok lei-lăi sư pơm đei mơjĭt tŏ gre thoi noh, sư hling ngăl đĭ lu gre.

English: Then he made ten lavers of bronze; each laver contained forty baths, and each laver was four cubits. On each of the ten carts was a laver.
Bahnar: Sư pơm mơjĭt tŏ bơng đak, man hling hăm kong, lăm minh tŏ bơng đak 'noh sư mong tuh đei tơhngam-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt lit đak, minh pôm bơng đak kơjung sư 'bar hlok, sư tah lu bơng đak noh tơ lăm mơjĭt tŏ gre, minh pôm gre minh pôm bơng đak noh.

English: And he put five carts on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house. He set the Sea on the right side of the house, toward the southeast.
Bahnar: Sư dan pơđăm tŏ gre gah gơal pơđăm tŏ gre gah yă-nơ̆m kơ hnam akŭm. Sư kư̆m pơdơ̆ng bơng đak 'bơ̆t mum thoi dơnâu 'noh sư kư̆m 'măn gah 'ma, sư tơwih gah hơlĕch gơal kơ Hnam akŭm.

English: Huram made the lavers and the shovels and the bowls. So Huram finished doing all the work that he was to do for King Solomon for the house of the LORD
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm gŏ glah chơ'mŏng păng kơthao. Thoi noh. Hiram bơ̆jang keh dôm tơdrong jang mă pơtao Sôlômôn pơjao ăn kơ sư jang lăm Hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: the two pillars, the two bowl-shaped capitals that were on top of the two pillars; the two networks covering the two bowl-shaped capitals which were on top of the pillars
Bahnar: Pơm 'bar tŏ jrăng hăm kong, pơm kơ̆l sư hơgơn kơpal kơ 'bar tŏ jrăng kong, lu hơdrao hăm kong klơ̆p lê̆ kơpal kơ̆l jrăng.
