English: four hundred pomegranates for the two networks (two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowl-shaped capitals that were on top of the pillars)
Bahnar: Đei puăn-hrĕng tŏ plei gărnăt păng kong, sư pơrĕng 'bar trong minh trong minh-hrĕng tŏ sư dăng tăp dăr tôch kơ kơ̆l jrăng.

English: the ten carts, and ten lavers on the carts
Bahnar: Đei mơjĭt tŏ gre, sư dan mơjĭt tŏ bơng đak kơpal lu gre noh.

English: one Sea, and twelve oxen under the Sea
Bahnar: Sư pơm minh pôm bơng đak tih păng mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo sư pơm man ala kơ bơng đak.

English: the pots, the shovels, and the bowls. All these articles which Huram made for King Solomon for the house of the LORD were of burnished bronze.
Bahnar: Sư pơm lu gŏ glah, gơ'beng păng kơthao. Dôm lu tơmam âu Hiram pơm ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn lăm Hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư pơm hăm kong, sư pơiel rang.

English: In the plain of Jordan the king had them cast in clay molds, between Succoth and Zaretan.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn athei Hiram man lu tơmam âu tơ anih thŭng (Jôrđăn) tơ lăm anih 'noh đei teh lơ̆n, anih 'noh sơlam Sukôt păng Sarethan.

English: And Solomon did not weigh all the articles, because there were so many; the weight of the bronze was not determined.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn sư ưh kơ đei kŏng lăng tơmam 'noh ôh, yua kơ tơmam lơ dêh, sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei kĕ hơlen kŏng lăng kong 'noh dôm yơ mơ̆n.

English: Thus Solomon had all the furnishings made for the house of the LORD: the altar of gold, and the table of gold on which was the showbread
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn sư kư̆m pơm tơmam yua lăm Hnam akŭm Kră Yang sư pơm chơnang soi hăm maih; sư kư̆m pơm gơ'bang 'măn 'bĕng hăm maih.

English: the lampstands of pure gold, five on the right side and five on the left in front of the inner sanctuary, with the flowers and the lamps and the wick-trimmers of gold
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng sư pơm hăm maih se, pơđăm tŏ sư 'măn gah 'ma, pơđăm tŏ gah 'ngiĕo, 'bơ̆t anăp anih rơgoh hloh, sư kư̆m ăn pơm lu pơkao, ŭnh kơđeng păng săng kep kăt păng maih.

English: the basins, the trimmers, the bowls, the ladles, and the censers of pure gold; and the hinges of gold, both for the doors of the inner room (the Most Holy Place) and for the doors of the main hall of the temple.
Bahnar: Dôm lu pơnhan, săng, kăt brai ŭnh kơđeng, kơthao, grang tơmam mă mong tơnuh păng grang mong ngar sư pơm păng maih, dôm lu gơwŏk 'măng, sư pơm kơ lu 'măng lăm anih Rơgoh Hloh, hăm 'măng Hnam akŭm, sư kư̆m pơm hăm maih ngăl.

English: So all the work that King Solomon had done for the house of the LORD was finished; and Solomon brought in the things which his father David had dedicated: the silver and the gold and the furnishings. He put them in the treasuries of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong jang pơtao Sôlômôn pơm Hnam akŭm Kră Yang pơm keh đĭ, đang kơ 'noh pơtao Sôlômôn wơh đe chĕp đĭ dôm tơmam 'bă sư Đawit pơyơ̆r sư 'măn lê̆ lăm hnam mong tơmam, lu hu, maih păng dôm tơmam yua nai dơ̆ng mơ̆n, tah lăm Hnam Kră Yang.

English: Now Solomon assembled the elders of Israel and all the heads of the tribes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel, to King Solomon in Jerusalem, that they might bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the City of David, which is Zion.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn, krao akŭm đĭ lu kră pơgơ̆r, lu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael năm tơ sư tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem năm sơng Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang đơ̆ng lăm pơlei Đawit tơ Siôn ba tơ Hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: Therefore all the men of Israel assembled with King Solomon at the feast in the month of Ethanim, which is the seventh month.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư akŭm pơm phĕt, 'noh lăm khei tơpơh lu sư jô̆ khan khei Êthanim, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael wang akŭm hơdai hăm pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: So all the elders of Israel came, and the priests took up the ark.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu kră pơlei Isơrael truh, lu 'bok soi tung hloi Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang.

English: Then they brought up the ark of the LORD, the tabernacle of meeting, and all the holy furnishings that were in the tabernacle. The priests and the Levites brought them up.
Bahnar: Lu sư tung ba hloi hnam khăn anih akŭm. Hom Pơgơ̆p chĕp ba dôm tơmam rơgoh năm hloi tơ anih noh; lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi tung hom pơgơ̆p 'noh.

English: Also King Solomon, and all the congregation of Israel who were assembled with him, were with him before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen that could not be counted or numbered for multitude.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael minh pôm jơhngơ̆m đon akŭm hơdai, đĭ-đăng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p; sư 'bet rơmo păng triu lơlap pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r, dĭng mah pă kĕ jô̆.

English: Then the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the LORD to its place, into the inner sanctuary of the temple, to the Most Holy Place, under the wings of the cherubim.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tơm tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang tơ anih sư, anih rơgoh hloh lu sư 'măn gah ala pơnăr chêrubim.

English: For the cherubim spread their two wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim overshadowed the ark and its poles.
Bahnar: Dôm lu chêrubim bơyar pơnăr kơpal Hom Pơgơ̆p, sư klơ̆p lê̆ Hom Pơgơ̆p păng 'long tơnung tung.

English: The poles extended so that the ends of the poles could be seen from the holy place, in front of the inner sanctuary; but they could not be seen from outside. And they are there to this day.
Bahnar: Dôm lu tơnung tung kơjung na đe lăng 'bôh đơ̆ng anih rơgoh mă truh tơ Anih Rơgoh Hloh, sư kư̆m oei 'bôh mơ̆n. Mă-lei lăng đơ̆ng 'nguaih ưh kơ đei 'bôh, dôm lu tơnung tung noh, mă truh dang ei kư̆m oei đei mơ̆n.

English: Nothing was in the ark except the two tablets of stone which Moses put there at Horeb, when the LORD made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lăm Hom Pơgơ̆p 'noh đei 'bar hlak gơ'bang păng tơmo đơ̆ng Môis dan lê̆ đơ̆ng kông Hôrêp; iŏk đơ̆ng năr Kră Yang pơgơ̆p pơkă pơkăm hăm lu bơngai Isơrael kơplah lu sư 'nao lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: And it came to pass, when the priests came out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of the LORD
Bahnar: Kơplah lu 'bok soi lĕch đơ̆ng anih rơgoh đei hơmơ̆l gom 'bĕnh lăm Hnam Kră Yang.

English: so that the priests could not continue ministering because of the cloud; for the glory of the LORD filled the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi ưh kơ gơh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anih noh wă jang, yua kơ tơdrong hơdah rang mơnhal păng hơmơ̆l 'bĕnh kơ Hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: Then Solomon spoke: “The LORD said He would dwell in the dark cloud.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Sôlômôn khan; “Kră Yang ih khan ih gô oei lăm hơmơ̆l măng mu.

English: I have surely built You an exalted house, And a place for You to dwell in forever.”
Bahnar: Dang ei inh pơm Hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rŏ keh bơih; anih wă kơ Ih oei ling-lang.”

English: Then the king turned around and blessed the whole assembly of Israel, while all the assembly of Israel was standing.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao Sôlômôn sư tơwih muh măt tơ kon pơlei Isơrael, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael oei dơ̆ng iung na sư krao khan hơpơi tuh ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: And he said: “Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who spoke with His mouth to my father David, and with His hand has fulfilled it, saying
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang; 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael pơkeh đơ̆ng Ih pơkă hăm 'bă inh Đawit, yua kơ đơ̆ng ti mơsêh Ih pơsĭt trŏ nơ̆r pơkă 'noh,” Ih kư̆m khan thoi âu dơ̆ng

English: ‘Since the day that I brought My people Israel out of Egypt, I have chosen no city from any tribe of Israel in which to build a house, that My name might be there; but I chose David to be over My people Israel.’
Bahnar: ‘Iŏk đơ̆ng năr Ih pơklaih lu bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, Inh ưh kơ đei rơih iŏk ôh khŭl bơngai bu đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Isơrael, pơjing pơm Hnam akŭm wă kơ anăn Inh oei lăm noh. Mă-lei Inh đei iŏk bơih Đawit wă kơ sư pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael kon pơlei Inh.’

English: Now it was in the heart of my father David to build a temple for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: “Lăm jơhngơ̆m 'bă inh Đawit sư kư̆m đei wă pơjing minh pôm Hnam akŭm ăn kơ anăn Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: But the LORD said to my father David, ‘Whereas it was in your heart to build a temple for My name, you did well that it was in your heart.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ 'bă inh Đawit: “Yua kơ ih tơchĕng wă pơm hnam akŭm kơ anăn Inh ih đei jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: Nevertheless you shall not build the temple, but your son who will come from your body, he shall build the temple for My name.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei ih ưh kơ gơh wă pơm ôh. Kon drŏ-nglo mă ih pơjing sư gô pơm Hnam akŭm kơ Inh.’

English: So the LORD has fulfilled His word which He spoke; and I have filled the position of my father David, and sit on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised; and I have built a temple for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: “Dang ei Kră Yang, pơsĭt bơih kơ đêl nơ̆r Sư pơkă. Inh tơplih kơ 'bă inh wă pơgơ̆r hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao wei-lăng lu bơngai Isơrael. 'Blep thoi đơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă, Inh pơm keh bơih Hnam akŭm kơ anăn Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: And there I have made a place for the ark, in which is the covenant of the LORD which He made with our fathers, when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.”
Bahnar: Tơ anih 'noh inh đei pơm wă 'măn Hom, pơgơ̆p lăm Hom 'noh đei nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă pơkăm hăm lu 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆, kơplah Sư pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.”

English: Then Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh pơtao Sôlômôn dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael. Sư yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal

English: and he said: “LORD God of Israel, there is no God in heaven above or on earth below like You, who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts.
Bahnar: Păng khan; “Ơ Kră Yang lu bơngai Isơrael, mă oei tơ kơpal plĕnh ti dah tơ anih âu, ưh kơ đei yang nai thoi Ih, Ih 'mêm mơnat kơ lu đĭch đam Ih păng wei răk dôm nơ̆r Ih đei pơkă pơkăm hăm lu sư. Bu mă đĭ jơhngơ̆m năm păng oei hăm Ih.

English: You have kept what You promised Your servant David my father; You have both spoken with Your mouth and fulfilled it with Your hand, as it is this day.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m wei răk nơ̆r pơkă Ih hăm đĭch đam Ih Đawit 'bă inh trŏ tơpă tơdrong kiơ mă ti mơsêh mơyang Ih pơm keh hloi dang ei.

English: Therefore, LORD God of Israel, now keep what You promised Your servant David my father, saying, ‘You shall not fail to have a man sit before Me on the throne of Israel, only if your sons take heed to their way, that they walk before Me as you have walked before Me.’
Bahnar: “Dang ei, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael! Apinh Ih pơm pơkeh bĕ đơ̆ng nơ̆r Ih pơkă hăm 'bă inh Đawit, đĭch đam Ih. Ih đei pơkă khan: “'Bơ̆t anăp Inh ih ưh kơ đei khăi ôh bơngai gô hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao Isơrael tơdah lu kon sâu ih năm rok trong ih mă năm adrol bơih 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.”

English: And now I pray, O God of Israel, let Your word come true, which You have spoken to Your servant David my father.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, apinh Ih pơsĭt nơ̆r Ih đei pơkă bơih hăm 'bă inh Đawit đĭch đam ih.

English: “But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built!
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang, tơpă Ih wă oei tơ lăm teh âu? Mă đĭ-đăng lu plĕnh jơ̆p-jang kơpal plĕnh kư̆m tam mă mah kơ oei, pơma kơ kiơ Hnam akŭm âu đơ̆ng inh pơjing ăn kơ Ih.

English: Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O LORD my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You today
Bahnar: Mă đơ̆ng thoi noh ră, ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Ih pơđêng đon mơ̆ng nơ̆r đĭch đam Ih krao apinh 'bơ̆t anăp Ih năr âu

English: that Your eyes may be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My name shall be there,’ that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place.
Bahnar: Apinh măt Ih măng năr wei-lăng Hnam âu, anih mă Ih khan: Anăn Ih gô oei lăm hnam noh, wă kơ Ih mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r lu đĭch đam Ih krao khan kơ anih 'nâu.

English: And may You hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven Your dwelling place; and when You hear, forgive.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ tơdrong kiơ mă lu đĭch đam Ih păng kon pơlei Ih krao khan tơ anih 'nâu, apinh Ih mơ̆ng bĕ đơ̆ng anih Ih oei đơ̆ng plĕnh ti; apinh Ih mơ̆ng mă nhen păng mơnat ăn.

English: “When anyone sins against his neighbor, and is forced to take an oath, and comes and takes an oath before Your altar in this temple
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai bu mă pơm yoch hăm buôl buăl sư, đe athei sư pơkă tơdah bơngai 'noh năm 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi Ih tơ Hnam akŭm âu

English: then hear in heaven, and act, and judge Your servants, condemning the wicked, bringing his way on his head, and justifying the righteous by giving him according to his righteousness.
Bahnar: apinh Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng păng tơl tơwih sek tơlang ăn kơ đĭch đam Ih, apinh Ih pơm plơ̆ kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆, đơ̆ng sư chă trong pơm kơnê̆ tuh plơ̆ tơ kơpal kơ̆l sư, apinh Ih tơgŭm bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Ih apah bơnê kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt sư pơm.

English: “When Your people Israel are defeated before an enemy because they have sinned against You, and when they turn back to You and confess Your name, and pray and make supplication to You in this temple
Bahnar: Tơdah lu bơngai Isơrael. Đei pơm yoch hăm Ih, na lu bơngai ayăt blah iŏk. Tơdah lu sư băt wơ̆t wih tơ Ih dơ̆ng, ư-ang kơ anăn Ih păng krao khan hơdrĭ hăm Ih lăm Hnam akŭm âu

English: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of Your people Israel, and bring them back to the land which You gave to their fathers.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng plĕnh apinh Ih mơ̆ng bĕ, mơnat ăn kơ tơdrong yoch lu kon pơlei Ih Isơrael păng chông ba lu sư wơ̆t brŏk dơ̆ng tơ teh đak mă đơ̆ng Ih ăn kơ 'bok lu sư sơ̆.

English: “When the heavens are shut up and there is no rain because they have sinned against You, when they pray toward this place and confess Your name, and turn from their sin because You afflict them
Bahnar: Mưh plĕnh phang ưh kơ đei đak 'mi yua kơ đơ̆ng lu sư pơm yoch hăm Ih, mă-lei dah lu sư năm tơkan tơ anih âu krao khan hơdrĭ hăm anăn ih, hŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch lu sư, yua kơ ih phak bơtho lu sư boih.

English: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of Your servants, Your people Israel, that You may teach them the good way in which they should walk; and send rain on Your land which You have given to Your people as an inheritance.
Bahnar: Apinh ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư, apinh ih mơnat ăn kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư, đĭch đam Ih lu kon pơlei Isơrael, apinh Ih bơtho pơhrăm lu sư trong 'lơ̆ng wă kơ lu sư rok kiơ̆, ăn kơ lu sư đak 'mi tơ ala teh âu, wă kơ lu sư jang sa đei tôm tơmam.

English: “When there is famine in the land, pestilence or blight or mildew, locusts or grasshoppers; when their enemy besieges them in the land of their cities; whatever plague or whatever sickness there is
Bahnar: Mưh lăm dêh char âu đei tơdrong truh pơngot rơwĕt, phang-ang, đei lep kơnu, hơdrông, phơ̆k kơmot sa, lôch hơ'buh dah đei lu ayăt truh wang blah lăm pơlei dêh char anih lu sư, dah đei tơdrong gleh truh jĭ jăn.

English: whatever prayer, whatever supplication is made by anyone, or by all Your people Israel, when each one knows the plague of his own heart, and spreads out his hands toward this temple
Bahnar: Mưh đei minh 'nu dah đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, lu sư băt kơ tơdrong lu sư pơm ưh kơ trŏ, lu sư yơ̆r ti tơklă hnam âu, lu sư krao khan hơdrĭ tơdrong kiơ

English: then hear in heaven Your dwelling place, and forgive, and act, and give to everyone according to all his ways, whose heart You know (for You alone know the hearts of all the sons of men)
Bahnar: apinh Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti, anih mă Ih oei Ih mơ̆ng păng mơnat ăn kơ yoch lu sư, tơgŭm rim 'nu kơ lu sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang sư pơm, yua kơ Ih băt jơhngơ̆m lu sư, lăp minh 'nu Ih đĕch băt lăm jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai.

English: that they may fear You all the days that they live in the land which You gave to our fathers.
Bahnar: Lei ha apinh Ih ăn kơ lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m băt hli yom kơ Ih ling-lang, kơplah lu sư arih lăm teh đak âu mă Ih ăn kơ 'bok yă lu nhôn.

English: “Moreover, concerning a foreigner, who is not of Your people Israel, but has come from a far country for Your name’s sake
Bahnar: Gah lu tơmoi nai lu sư ưh kơ lăm lu bơngai Isơrael Ih, mă-lei yua kơ anăn Ih lu sư đơ̆ng dêh ataih truh

English: (for they will hear of Your great name and Your strong hand and Your outstretched arm), when he comes and prays toward this temple
Bahnar: lu bơngai teh đak 'nguaih lu sư kơtơ̆ng Anăn Ih ti mơsêh mơyang Ih, mưh lu sư krao khan lăm hnam âu.

English: hear in heaven Your dwelling place, and do according to all for which the foreigner calls to You, that all peoples of the earth may know Your name and fear You, as do Your people Israel, and that they may know that this temple which I have built is called by Your name.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh anih Ih oei mơ̆ng păng tơl tơwih nơ̆r lu sư krao apinh, wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆p teh đak, băt kơ anăn ih, hli yom kơ anăn Ih, lei-lăi thoi lu kon pơlei Isơrael wă kơ Ih tơbăt tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu bơngai krao apinh lăm hnam âu, đơ̆ng Inh pơm.

English: “When Your people go out to battle against their enemy, wherever You send them, and when they pray to the LORD toward the city which You have chosen and the temple which I have built for Your name
Bahnar: “Mưh lu kon pơlei đĭch đam ih tơblah hăm lu ayăt, kiơ̆ kơ đơ̆ng Ih wơh; mưh sư krao khan hơdrĭ hăm anăn ih; sư tơwih gah pơlei âu pơlei mă Ih rơih bơih, sư tơkan tơ hnam akŭm mă đơ̆ng inh pơm

English: then hear in heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
Bahnar: Apinh ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh mơ̆ng nơ̆r krao khan hơdrĭ lu sư, tơgŭm tơdrong mă lu sư apinh.

English: “When they sin against You (for there is no one who does not sin), and You become angry with them and deliver them to the enemy, and they take them captive to the land of the enemy, far or near
Bahnar: “Mưh đơ̆ng lu sư pơm yoch 'bơ̆t anăp ih, ưh kơ đei bu ưh kơ pơm yoch, Ih blĕk ơh ăn kơ lu sư đei tơdrong gleh oei lăm ti lu bơngai ayăt, tơdah đe rôp ba lu sư tơ dêh char nai, mă đơ̆ng ataih dah jê̆

English: yet when they come to themselves in the land where they were carried captive, and repent, and make supplication to You in the land of those who took them captive, saying, ‘We have sinned and done wrong, we have committed wickedness’
Bahnar: tơdah lu sư oei tơ dêh char nai lu sư tơchĕng tơbral, krao khan hơdrĭ apinh ih: ‘Lu nhôn pơm yoch, pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ pơm lơ tơdrong ưh kơ trŏ.’

English: and when they return to You with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their enemies who led them away captive, and pray to You toward their land which You gave to their fathers, the city which You have chosen and the temple which I have built for Your name
Bahnar: Dah lu sư đĭ jơhngơ̆m đĭ đon tơchĕng, wơ̆t tơbral tơ Ih krao khan apinh Ih, lăm char mă lu ayăt rôp ba lu sư, lu sư 'blŏk kơ dêh mă Ih ăn kơ lu 'bok yă lu sư sơ̆. Anih mă Ih rơih ăn bơih păng Hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ anăn Ih mă inh pơm âu bơih

English: then hear in heaven Your dwelling place their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause
Bahnar: na apinh Ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh đơ̆ng anih mă ih oei mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư krao khan hơdrĭ, tơgŭm lu sư tơdrong lu sư apinh Ih

English: and forgive Your people who have sinned against You, and all their transgressions which they have transgressed against You; and grant them compassion before those who took them captive, that they may have compassion on them
Bahnar: mơnat ăn kơ yoch lu sư pơm, lu sư pơm glăi hăm Ih, apinh Ih ăn kơ bơngai mă rôp ba lu sư đei đon mơnat kơ lu sư.

English: (for they are Your people and Your inheritance, whom You brought out of Egypt, out of the iron furnace)
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư bơngai Isơrael, noh pơlei pơla Ih, tơmam Ih yua. Ih pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ anih noh nhen thoi anih đe 'buh jôr bơsei.

English: that Your eyes may be open to the supplication of Your servant and the supplication of Your people Israel, to listen to them whenever they call to You.
Bahnar: “Apinh Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu đĭch đam Ih yua kơ lu sư jing pơlei pơla Isơrael Ih, apinh Ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư krao khan hơdrĭ 'bơ̆t Ih.

English: For You separated them from among all the peoples of the earth to be Your inheritance, as You spoke by Your servant Moses, when You brought our fathers out of Egypt, O Lord GOD.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Ih klah lê̆ lu sư phara đơ̆ng lăm khŭl kon bơngai lăm teh đak âu, ih wă ăn kơ lu sư jing tơmam Ih, trŏ 'blep thoi Ih đei khan kơ 'bok Môis đĭch đam Ih sơ̆, đơ̆ng năr Ih pơklaih lu 'bok yă nhôn đơ̆ng lăm dêh char Êyiptơ.”

English: And so it was, when Solomon had finished praying all this prayer and supplication to the LORD, that he arose from before the altar of the LORD, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread up to heaven.
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Sôlômôn krao khan kơ Kră Yang đang bơih; sư iung dơ̆ng tơ anăp chơnang soi Kră Yang, 'bơ̆t anih sư pơtăm kŭl-tăng sư iung yơ̆r ti tơ kơpal plĕnh.

English: Then he stood and blessed all the assembly of Israel with a loud voice, saying
Bahnar: Sư iung krao khan hơpơi tơdrong pŭn hiôk ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael khan

English: “Blessed be the LORD, who has given rest to His people Israel, according to all that He promised. There has not failed one word of all His good promise, which He promised through His servant Moses.
Bahnar: “Bơnê kơkuh ư-ang kơ Kră Yang mă ăn tơdrong hiôk hơđơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai Isơrael, kiơ̆ thoi dôm nơ̆r ih pơkă! Nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, mă ih yua 'bơ̆r Môis đĭch đam Ih bơtho, Ih khan ưh kơ đei nơ̆r ayơ mă ưh kơ đei pơm pơkeh.

English: May the LORD our God be with us, as He was with our fathers. May He not leave us nor forsake us
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Sư oei hơdai lu bơ̆n thoi lĕ Sư oei hơdai lu 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆, 'nĕ ăn kơ Sư hŭt achăng lê̆ lu bơ̆n.

English: that He may incline our hearts to Himself, to walk in all His ways, and to keep His commandments and His statutes and His judgments, which He commanded our fathers.
Bahnar: Apinh Sư tơgŭm bơ̆n năm jê̆ Sư wă kơ lu bơ̆n năm kiơ̆ trong Sư, wei răk nơ̆r sư tơtă, tơdrong juăt Sư păng nơ̆r Sư bơtho tơtă, mă Sư bơtho kơ lu 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆.

English: And may these words of mine, with which I have made supplication before the LORD, be near the LORD our God day and night, that He may maintain the cause of His servant and the cause of His people Israel, as each day may require
Bahnar: Hơpơi rŏ kơ nơ̆r inh krao khan bơih, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, oei lăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n măng năr păng tơgŭm dôm tơdrong đĭch đam Sư jang păng kư̆m tơgŭm tơdrong kon pơlei pơla Isơrael Sư jang sa rim năr kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong lu sư kăl yua.

English: that all the peoples of the earth may know that the LORD is God; there is no other.
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu kon pơlei pơla lăm ala teh đak băt kơnăl kơ Sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'nguaih kơ Sư ưh pă đei yang nai bơih.

English: Let your heart therefore be loyal to the LORD our God, to walk in His statutes and keep His commandments, as at this day.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei iŏk jơhngơ̆m đon 'lơ̆ng, chu yom pơm kiơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n pơkă, tơdrong juăt sư păng nơ̆r sư tơtă kư̆m thoi lu iĕm oei pơm dang ei.”

English: Then the king and all Israel with him offered sacrifices before the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn, hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, oei hăm sư, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And Solomon offered a sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered to the LORD, twenty-two thousand bulls and one hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the children of Israel dedicated the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn sư, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang, đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu tŏ rơmo tơno, đei minh-hrĕng 'bar-rơbâu tŏ triu, păng bơbe. Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei hăm pơtao Sôlômôn chơt hiôk pơyơ̆r pơm keh hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: On the same day the king consecrated the middle of the court that was in front of the house of the LORD; for there he offered burnt offerings, grain offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar that was before the LORD was too small to receive the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings.
Bahnar: Lăm năr 'noh pơtao Sôlômôn sư klah sư 'măn lê̆ minh anih tŏk-bŏk cham 'bơ̆t anăp, Hnam akŭm Kră Yang; tơ anih 'noh sư wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, păng tơmam soi rơmă tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê, yua chơnang pơm hăm kong noh iĕ, ưh kơ mah wă dan đĭ dôm lu tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, lu rơmă tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê.

English: At that time Solomon held a feast, and all Israel with him, a great assembly from the entrance of Hamath to the Brook of Egypt, before the LORD our God, seven days and seven more days—fourteen days.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla Isơrael akŭm hơdai hăm pơtao Sôlômôn, akŭm minh anih să iŏk đơ̆ng trong mơ̆t pơlei Hamat truh tơ thong đak Êyiptơ, akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lăm tơpơh năr.

English: On the eighth day he sent the people away; and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the good that the LORD had done for His servant David, and for Israel His people.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơhngam pơtao ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla brŏk; kon pơlei kư̆m krao khan hơpơi pŭn hiôk kơ pơtao kơplah lu sư brŏk tơ anih lu sư, lu sư chơt hiôk 'nă hal lăm jơhngơ̆m, yua kơ Kră Yang wei-lăng đĭch đam Sư Đawit hăm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, kon pơlei pơla Sư rơih.

English: And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished building the house of the LORD and the king’s house, and all Solomon’s desire which he wanted to do
Bahnar: Sôlômôn man Hnam akŭm Kră Yang, hnam sư kơdih păng dôm lu hnam mă sư man đang bơih.

English: that the LORD appeared to Solomon the second time, as He had appeared to him at Gibeon.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang tơ'bôh akâu sư ăn kơ Sôlômôn wơ̆t mă 'bar, kư̆m thoi Kră Yang tơ'bôh kơ sư tơ pơlei Gibeôn.

English: And the LORD said to him: “I have heard your prayer and your supplication that you have made before Me; I have consecrated this house which you have built to put My name there forever, and My eyes and My heart will be there perpetually.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ sư: “Inh kơtơ̆ng bơih dôm nơ̆r ih krao khan apinh 'bơ̆t anăp Inh. Inh 'măn lê̆ pha bơih Hnam 'nâu mă ih pơm wă kơ rơgoh, wă kơ anăn Inh oei lăm noh ling-lang; măt păng jơhngơ̆m Inh gô oei tơ noh ling-lang.

English: Now if you walk before Me as your father David walked, in integrity of heart and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded you, and if you keep My statutes and My judgments
Bahnar: “Gah ih, tơdah ih yak kiơ̆ trong Inh kư̆m thoi Đawit, 'bă ih yak năm bơih hăm jơhngơ̆m đon rơgoh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Inh athei ih, wei răk dôm nơ̆r Inh pơkă tơtă khan kơ ih

English: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom over Israel forever, as I promised David your father, saying, ‘You shall not fail to have a man on the throne of Israel.’
Bahnar: lei Inh gô ăn kơ ih hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael kơjăp ling-lang kiơ̆ thoi Inh đei pơkă hăm Đawit 'bă ih: “Ih ưh kơ kơ'bah kơ bơngai hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael.”

English: But if you or your sons at all turn from following Me, and do not keep My commandments and My statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods and worship them
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah ih păng lu kon sâu ih weh tơklah đơ̆ng Inh ưh kơ wă wei răk khôi juăt păng dôm nơ̆r Inh tơtă ăn kơ lu iĕm, na bơ̆jang păng kơkuh kơ rup yang nai

English: then I will cut off Israel from the land which I have given them; and this house which I have consecrated for My name I will cast out of My sight. Israel will be a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
Bahnar: lei Inh gô pơpuh tơweh lu sư đơ̆ng dêh char mă Inh ăn bơih kơ lu sư oei; klaih kơ noh inh gô pơrăm hŭt lê̆ Hnam akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mă Inh 'măn anăn Inh, păng lu bơngai Isơrael đe gô pơrăm che bơle hiĕk achơ̆ kơ lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp kon bơngai lăm teh đak 'nâu.

English: And as for this house, which is exalted, everyone who passes by it will be astonished and will hiss, and say, ‘Why has the LORD done thus to this land and to this house?’
Bahnar: Hnam akŭm 'nâu, jing rơ̆m rĕk, rim 'nu bơngai năm rok trong Hnam akŭm 'noh lăng hlĭch, păng apinh tơduă khan; Yua kơ kiơ Kră Yang pơm kơ dêh char 'nâu păng Hnam akŭm 'nâu thoi âu.”

English: Then they will answer, ‘Because they forsook the LORD their God, who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and have embraced other gods, and worshiped them and served them; therefore the LORD has brought all this calamity on them.’ ”
Bahnar: Đe gô khan: 'Noh yua kơ lu sư weh tơklah đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, Tơ'ngla tơlĕch lu yă 'bok sư đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, lu sư kiơ̆ yang nai, bơ̆jang păng kơkuh kơ yang 'noh, yua kơ thoi 'noh bơih na Kră Yang ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong truh răm thoi âu.”

English: Now it happened at the end of twenty years, when Solomon had built the two houses, the house of the LORD and the king’s house
Bahnar: Lăp 'blep 'bar-jĭt sơnăm kơplah Sôlômôn pơm keh 'bar tŏ Hnam, pơm hnam akŭm păng hnam pơtao sư kơdih.

English: (Hiram the king of Tyre had supplied Solomon with cedar and cypress and gold, as much as he desired), that King Solomon then gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
Bahnar: Na kơplah 'noh pơtao Sôlômôn pơjao ăn kơ Hiram pơtao pơlei Tirơ, 'bar-jĭt tŏ pơlei lăm dêh Galilê, yua kơ Hiram ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn 'long hơngo, 'long hơngo hla iĕ păng maih, mơ̆ng kơ sư wă dôm yơ.

English: Then Hiram went from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him, but they did not please him.
Bahnar: Hiram năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Tirơ, truh tơ noh wă lăng dôm pơlei mă Sôlômôn ăn kơ sư 'noh, sư ưh kơ lăp jơhngơ̆m ôh.

English: So he said, “What kind of cities are these which you have given me, my brother?” And he called them the land of Cabul, as they are to this day.
Bahnar: Na sư khan: “Ơ 'nhŏng, lu pơlei 'nâu đei kiơ mă ih ăn kơ inh?” Thoi noh đe krao dôm tŏ pơlei noh char Kabula mă truh tơ dang ei.

English: Then Hiram sent the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold.
Bahnar: Hiram gơih ăn kơ Sôlômôn minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt talâng jên maih.

English: And this is the reason for the labor force which King Solomon raised: to build the house of the LORD, his own house, the Millo, the wall of Jerusalem, Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong Sôlômôn chă ra đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng bơngai wă pơm Hnam akŭm Kră Yang păng hnam pơtao sư, pơm milô, păng dur pơlei Jêrusalem, Hasor, pơlei Mêgiđô păng Geser.

English: (Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up and taken Gezer and burned it with fire, had killed the Canaanites who dwelt in the city, and had given it as a dowry to his daughter, Solomon’s wife.)
Bahnar: Pharaôn, pơtao char Êyiptơ tŏk tơgar blah iŏk pơlei Geser soh pơđĭ pơlei 'noh păng pơlôch đĭ kon bơngai Kanaan 'noh, đơ̆ng noh sư ăn kơ kon drŏ-kăn sư pơlei 'noh jing tơmam sư kơdih, kon drŏ-kăn sư 'noh akăn pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: And Solomon built Gezer, Lower Beth Horon
Bahnar: Thoi noh, pơtao Sôlômôn tơiung pơjing ming pơlei Geser dơ̆ng, păng pơlei Bêt Hôrôn gah ala.

English: Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness, in the land of Judah
Bahnar: Pơlei Balat păng pơlei Tamar tơ lăm char 'blach Juđa.

English: all the storage cities that Solomon had, cities for his chariots and cities for his cavalry, and whatever Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn kư̆m đei pơm pơlei 'măn dôm tơmam, 'măn gre aseh, pơlei ăn kơ lu linh hao aseh oei păng dôm tơdrong Sôlômôn wă pơm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm char Liban păng đĭ-đăng lăm char sư pơgơ̆r.

English: All the people who were left of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, who were not of the children of Israel
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă oei arih đơ̆ng lu bơngai Amôrit, bơngai Hêtit bơngai Phêrisit, bơngai Hêwit păng lu bơngai Jêbus, lu sư ưh kơ trŏ kơ bơngai Isơrael ôh.

English: that is, their descendants who were left in the land after them, whom the children of Israel had not been able to destroy completely—from these Solomon raised forced labor, as it is to this day.
Bahnar: Dôm lu kon sâu sư mă oei arih lăm dêh char mă lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ kĕ pơlôch pơđĭ 'noh, na Sôlômôn rôp lu sư pơm đĭch bơ̆jang truh tơ dang ei.

English: But of the children of Israel Solomon made no forced laborers, because they were men of war and his servants: his officers, his captains, commanders of his chariots, and his cavalry.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah lu bơngai Isơrael, Sôlômôn ưh kơ rôp lu sư pơm đĭch ôh, lu sư pơm linh tơblah, mơ'nah pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r linh, mơ'nah pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r lu yŏng linh, mơ'nah wei-lăng lu bơngai hao gre aseh păng lu bơngai hao aseh.

English: Others were chiefs of the officials who were over Solomon’s work: five hundred and fifty, who ruled over the people who did the work.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu 'bok yŏng wei-lăng tơdrong jang mă Sôlômôn pơjao; lu sư đei pơđăm-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu wei-lăng kon pơlei bơ̆jang pơm Hnam akŭm păng pơm hnam pơtao.

English: But Pharaoh’s daughter came up from the City of David to her house which Solomon had built for her. Then he built the Millo.
Bahnar: Lăp kon drŏ-kăn pơtao Pharaôn năm đơ̆ng pơlei Đawit năm tơ hnam pơtao sư kơdih, mă hnam Sôlômôn pơm ăn kơ sư; pơtao kư̆m pơm dur wă găn lu ayăt.

English: Now three times a year Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar which he had built for the LORD, and he burned incense with them on the altar that was before the LORD. So he finished the temple.
Bahnar: Pêng wơ̆t lăm minh sơnăm Sôlômôn juăt kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam pơyơ̆r apinh tơdrong hiôk-hian tơ kơpal chơnang soi mă sư đei pơm ăn kơ Kră Yang păng soh tơmam 'bâu phu hai 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Sư pơm pơkeh Hnam akŭm.

English: King Solomon also built a fleet of ships at Ezion Geber, which is near Elath on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn kư̆m pơm lơlap duk thŏng-nan tơ pơlei Êsiôn Gêber oei jê̆ pơlei Êlat tơ đak Dơsĭ 'Brê lăm dêh char Eđôm.

English: Then Hiram sent his servants with the fleet, seamen who knew the sea, to work with the servants of Solomon.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Hiram wơh đĭch đam sư, wă khan lu bơngai hơgei huơ̆r thŏng-nan lăm đak dơsĭ năm tơgŭm hơdai lu đĭch đam Sôlômôn.

English: And they went to Ophir, and acquired four hundred and twenty talents of gold from there, and brought it to King Solomon.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tơ dêh char Ôphir, lu sư chă chĕp ba puăn-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt talâng maihb đơ̆ng dêh char 'noh năm ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: Now when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the LORD, she came to test him with hard questions.
Bahnar: Wă yă pơtao dêh char Sêba kơtơ̆ng đe ư-ang kơ pơtao Sôlômôn đơ̆ng anăn Kră Yang, sư năm tơ noh wă pơlong lăng tơdrong hơgei Sôlômôn hăm tơdrong pơpơn tơnat.

English: She came to Jerusalem with a very great retinue, with camels that bore spices, very much gold, and precious stones; and when she came to Solomon, she spoke with him about all that was in her heart.
Bahnar: Yă pơtao sư truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem hơdai hăm lơ bơngai lơ aseh lăk-đa chơ pơgang 'bâu phu, đei maih lơ păng lu tơmo gĭt kư̆m lơ. Lăp sư năm truh tơ Sôlômôn bơih, sư roi kơ pơtao Sôlômôn dôm đon sư tơchĕng wă jet 'noh.

English: So Solomon answered all her questions; there was nothing so difficult for the king that he could not explain it to her.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn tơl tơwih dôm nơ̆r sư jet 'noh. Ưh kơ đei nơ̆r jet ayơ hlơp mă Sôlômôn ưh kơ băt tơl tơwih ăn kơ sư.

English: And when the queen of Sheba had seen all the wisdom of Solomon, the house that he had built
Bahnar: Lăp yă pơtao dêh char Sêba 'bôh dôm tơdrong gơh hơgei Sôlômôn păng hnam pơtao sư đei pơm

English: the food on his table, the seating of his servants, the service of his waiters and their apparel, his cupbearers, and his entryway by which he went up to the house of the LORD, there was no more spirit in her.
Bahnar: tơmam sŏng sa kơpal gơ'bang, tang-dŏ lu bơngai jang sư hơ-oei, tơdrong jang lu đĭch đam sư, hơbĕn ao lu sư hrŭk, lu bơngai năm ba kơchŏk đak nhă pơtao păng dôm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r lăm Hnam kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, yă pơtao ưh pă gơh pơma kiơ.

English: Then she said to the king: “It was a true report which I heard in my own land about your words and your wisdom.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ pơtao Sôlômôn: “Dôm tơdrong inh kơtơ̆ng đe roi lăm char inh gah nơ̆r pơma păng tơdrong gơh hơgei ih trŏ tơpă bơih.

English: However I did not believe the words until I came and saw with my own eyes; and indeed the half was not told me. Your wisdom and prosperity exceed the fame of which I heard.
Bahnar: Kơplah inh tam mă truh tơ âu păng măt inh ưh tam mă 'bôh inh ưh kơ lui ôh dôm tơdrong mă đe roi 'noh; tơdrong mă inh kơtơ̆ng lăp minh puăt tơdrong gơh hơgei păng tơdrong mơdrŏng ih oei hloh kơ dôm tơdrong inh kơtơ̆ng.

English: Happy are your men and happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you and hear your wisdom!
Bahnar: Pŭn hiôk tih tơpă kơ lu đĭch đam ih bơngai mă oei hơdai ih! Lu bơngai mă oei awih awăn 'bơ̆t anăp ih ling-lang păng kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong gơh hơgei ih.

English: Blessed be the LORD your God, who delighted in you, setting you on the throne of Israel! Because the LORD has loved Israel forever, therefore He made you king, to do justice and righteousness.”
Bahnar: Kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, yua kơ Sư lăp đon kơ ih ăn kơ ih hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael! Yua kơ Kră Yang 'mêm kơ Isơrael ling-lang, thoi noh na Sư ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao wei-lăng wă kơ ih pơm tơdrong trŏ păng 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Then she gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, spices in great quantity, and precious stones. There never again came such abundance of spices as the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.
Bahnar: Yă pơtao ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt talâng (kĭ) maih, ăn lơ 'long pơgang 'bâu phu păng lu tơmo gĭt. Ưh tam đei bu chĕp 'long pơgang 'bâu phu lơ dang yă pơtao dêh Sêba chĕp ba ăn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: Also, the ships of Hiram, which brought gold from Ophir, brought great quantities of almug wood and precious stones from Ophir.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei duk Hiram chơ ba maih đơ̆ng dêh char Ôphir, sư kư̆m chơ ba 'long kơte păng tơmo gĭt lơlap.

English: And the king made steps of the almug wood for the house of the LORD and for the king’s house, also harps and stringed instruments for singers. There never again came such almug wood, nor has the like been seen to this day.
Bahnar: Pơtao yua 'long kơte pơm jrăng tơm Hnam Kră Yang păng hnam pơtao, păng lu brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng ăn kơ lu bơngai hơri. Đơ̆ng năr noh truh dang ei ưh kơ đei bu chơ ba 'long kơte lơ dang noh.

English: Now King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba all she desired, whatever she asked, besides what Solomon had given her according to the royal generosity. So she turned and went to her own country, she and her servants.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn ăn kơ yă pơtao dêh Sêba dôm tơmam kiơ sư wă, dôm tơmam sư apinh, ưh kơ jô̆ dôm tơmam mă pơtao Sôlômôn juăt ăn kơ sư adrol. Đơ̆ng noh yă pơtao păng lu đĭch đam sư wih brŏk tơ dêh sư kơdih.

English: The weight of gold that came to Solomon yearly was six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold
Bahnar: Lăm rim sơnăm Sôlômôn sư ra maih đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng kĭ.

English: besides that from the traveling merchants, from the income of traders, from all the kings of Arabia, and from the governors of the country.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ jô̆ maih iŏk đơ̆ng lu bơngai mơdro păng đơ̆ng lu anih tĕch mơdro hăm lu teh đak 'nguaih, đơ̆ng đĭ lu pơtao dêh Arơ̆p păng đơ̆ng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r tơ rim char chĕp ba ăn kơ sư.

English: And King Solomon made two hundred large shields of hammered gold; six hundred shekels of gold went into each shield.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn pơm 'bar-hrĕng tŏ khêl tih păng maih hling hơtăng. Lăm rim kơ minh hlak khêl noh yua dang puăn kĭ maih.

English: He also made three hundred shields of hammered gold; three minas of gold went into each shield. The king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m pơm pêng-hrĕng hlak khêl iĕ păng maih hling hơtăng, lăm rim kơ minh hlak khêl noh yua dang tơ 'bar kĭ. Pơtao tah 'măn khêl 'noh lăm hnam Bri char Liban.

English: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m đei pơm minh pôm tang-dŏ tih hăm bơla rôih, bah maih se.

English: The throne had six steps, and the top of the throne was round at the back; there were armrests on either side of the place of the seat, and two lions stood beside the armrests.
Bahnar: Tang-dŏ 'nâu đei tơdrâu kơnao, mă kơjung hloh 'bơ̆t gơning rŏng sư wĭl đei pơm hơgơn ti 'bar pah tang-dŏ păng 'bơ̆t cheng hơgơn ti đei 'bar tŏ rup dăm-brang.

English: Twelve lions stood there, one on each side of the six steps; nothing like this had been made for any other kingdom.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei mơjĭt-'bar to rup dăm-brang nai dơ̆ng, 'bơ̆t rim kơ̆l tơdrâu kơ 'nao: Ưh tam đei dêh char ayơ mă pơm tang-dŏ pơtao thoi noh.

English: All King Solomon’s drinking vessels were gold, and all the vessels of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold. Not one was silver, for this was accounted as nothing in the days of Solomon.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơchŏk pơnhan wă nhă tă kơ pơm hăm maih ngăl păng đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam yua lăm hnam pơtao tơ Bri char Liban tă kơ pơm păng maih rơgoh, ưh kơ đei tơmam kiơ pơm păng hu. Lăm chăl pơtao Sôlômôn, hu ưh kơ gĭt ôh.

English: For the king had merchant ships at sea with the fleet of Hiram. Once every three years the merchant ships came bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and monkeys.
Bahnar: Yua kơ pơtao đei lơ duk đơ̆ng Tarsis lăm đak dơsĭ hơdai hăm duk Hiram, lăm pêng sơnăm minh 'măng brŏk chơ ba maih, hu, bơla rôih, kuĕnh păng hơmră.

English: So King Solomon surpassed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn bơih mơdrŏng păng gơh hơgei đe ư-ang hloh kơ đĭ-đăng pơtao lăm teh đak 'nâu.

English: Now all the earth sought the presence of Solomon to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai lăm teh đak 'nâu chă wă 'maih tơ'bơ̆p Sôlômôn, wă mơ̆ng tơdrong gơh hơgei đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư.

English: Each man brought his present: articles of silver and gold, garments, armor, spices, horses, and mules, at a set rate year by year.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm, bu năm kư̆m chĕp ba tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơtao, mơ'nah pơm păng hu mơ'nah pơm păng maih, hơbĕn ao, đao hơlă, đak pơgang 'bâu phu, aseh, aseh iĕ.

English: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen; he had one thousand four hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he stationed in the chariot cities and with the king at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn akŭm pơđĭ gre aseh păng aseh, minh-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng gre aseh păng mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu aseh. Sư 'măn gre aseh lăm lu pơlei lu linh đei lu gre aseh jê̆ pơtao tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedar trees as abundant as the sycamores which are in the lowland.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn pơm kơ hu đe lăng ưh kơ gĭt thoi tơmo hmă đĕch lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng 'long hơngo lơ thoi 'long hơra chăt tơ jơ̆ng kông groi.

English: Also Solomon had horses imported from Egypt and Keveh; the king’s merchants bought them in Keveh at the current price.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôlômôn chă aseh đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ păng char Kue; lu bơngai mă pơtao Sôlômôn yua wă mơdro ăn kơ sư năm tơ char Kue chă răt lu sư răt huay kơ kăp dêh.

English: Now a chariot that was imported from Egypt cost six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse one hundred and fifty; and thus, through their agents, they exported them to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Syria.
Bahnar: Đe răt minh pôm gre aseh đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ dang tơpơh kĭ hu, minh pôm aseh đe răt dang minh kĭ tơpơh lang hu. Lu bơngai mă pơtao Sôlômôn pơjao tơdrong jang mơdro mơchan noh tĕch đơ̆ng tơ pơtao bơngai Hêtit păng pơtao Aram.

English: But King Solomon loved many foreign women, as well as the daughter of Pharaoh: women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites
Bahnar: 'Nguaih kơ kon hơdruh Pharaôn, pơtao Sôlômôn hưch kơ lơ adruh bơngai tơmoi nai. Noh lu drŏ-kăn bơngai Môap, Ammôn, Eđôm, Siđôn păng Hêlit.

English: from the nations of whom the LORD had said to the children of Israel, “You shall not intermarry with them, nor they with you. Surely they will turn away your hearts after their gods.” Solomon clung to these in love.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch adrung bơngai noh. Kră Yang khan bơih kơ lu bơngai Isơrael: Iĕm ưh kơ gơh iŏk klo dah iŏk akăn đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung bơngai 'noh; yua kơ lu sư gô pơhlŭ pơlung lu iĕm kiơ̆ kơkuh kơ rup yang lu sư. Mă-lei Sôlômôn oei hưch kơ drŏ-kăn bơngai 'noh.

English: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines; and his wives turned away his heart.
Bahnar: Sư đei tơpơh-hrĕng akăn oei kơ kon adruh pơtao păng đei pêng-hrĕng akăn kơnhŏng, lu sư pơhlŭ pơlung jơhngơ̆m đon Sôlômôn weh đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: For it was so, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned his heart after other gods; and his heart was not loyal to the LORD his God, as was the heart of his father David.
Bahnar: Truh tơ Sôlômôn kră pă kĕ lu akăn sư pơhlŭ pơlung sư kiơ̆ yang lu sư; jơhngơ̆m sư ưh pă chu yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi jơhngơ̆m đon Đawit 'bă sư.

English: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sôlômôn kơkuh kơ Astoret yang drŏ-kăn yang lu bơngai Siđôn păng chu kiơ̆ kơ Milkôm yang lu bơngai Ammôn yang kơnê̆ dêh.

English: Solomon did evil in the sight of the LORD, and did not fully follow the LORD, as did his father David.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Sôlômôn pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng sư ưh kơ wă chu kiơ̆ Kră Yang hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak thoi Đawit 'bă sư chu yom bơih.

English: Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, on the hill that is east of Jerusalem, and for Molech the abomination of the people of Ammon.
Bahnar: Kơpal groi gah hơlĕch kơ pơlei Jêrusalem Sôlômôn man minh pôm hnam kơ Kêmôs yang lu bơngai Môap păng kơ yang Môlek yang lu bơngai Ammôn.

English: And he did likewise for all his foreign wives, who burned incense and sacrificed to their gods.
Bahnar: Sư pơm ăn kơ đĭ lu akăn sư bơngai tơmoi thoi noh, na đĭ-đăng lu sư soh tơmam 'bâu phu păng soi kơkuh kơ yang lu sư.

English: So the LORD became angry with Solomon, because his heart had turned from the LORD God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil dêh kơ Sôlômôn, yua kơ jơhngơ̆m đon sư weh tơklah đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, Tơ'ngla mă đei tơ'bôh ăn kơ sư akâu 'bar 'măng bơih.

English: and had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods; but he did not keep what the LORD had commanded.
Bahnar: Khan kơ sư bơih ih 'nĕ kơ kiơ̆ lu yang nai; mă-lei sư ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă.

English: Therefore the LORD said to Solomon, “Because you have done this, and have not kept My covenant and My statutes, which I have commanded you, I will surely tear the kingdom away from you and give it to your servant.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan kơ Sôlômôn: “Yua kơ ih pơm tơdrong 'nâu, ih ưh kơ wei răk tơdrong Inh pơgơ̆p păng tơdrong juăt Inh tơtă kơ ih, na Inh gô hek lê̆ teh đak mă ih pơgơ̆r 'nâu, asong ăn kơ đĭch đam ih.

English: Nevertheless I will not do it in your days, for the sake of your father David; I will tear it out of the hand of your son.
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ Đawit 'bă ih, na Inh ưh kơ pơm ôh tơdrong 'nâu kơplah chăl ih dang ei, Inh gô hek teh đak 'nâu đơ̆ng tơpang ti kon drŏ-nglo ih.

English: However I will not tear away the whole kingdom; I will give one tribe to your son for the sake of My servant David, and for the sake of Jerusalem which I have chosen.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ hek asong pơđĭ hloi ôh; mă-lei Inh gô 'măn lê̆ minh adrĕch adrung ăn kơ sư yua kơ Đawit đĭch đam Inh păng yua kơ pơlei Jêrusalem, pơlei mă Inh đei rơih.”

English: Now the LORD raised up an adversary against Solomon, Hadad the Edomite; he was a descendant of the king in Edom.
Bahnar: Kră Yang atŏk minh 'nu bơngai ayăt tơblah hăm Sôlômôn, 'noh Hađat bơngai Eđôm; sư bơngai adrĕch adrung pơtao Eđôm.

English: For it happened, when David was in Edom, and Joab the commander of the army had gone up to bury the slain, after he had killed every male in Edom
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit 'nao oei lăm Eđôm na Jôap yŏng linh tŏk năm 'bŭ lu bơngai lôch, đei pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo lăm char Eđôm.

English: (because for six months Joab remained there with all Israel, until he had cut down every male in Edom)
Bahnar: Jôap păng bơngai Isơrael oei tơ noh tơdrâu khei, dĭng mă lu sư pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo lăm char Eđôm.

English: that Hadad fled to go to Egypt, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him. Hadad was still a little child.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Hađat hơdai hăm lu bơngai Eđôm đĭch đam 'bă sư kơdâu klĕnh tơ char Êyiptơ kơplah 'noh Hađat oei 'lơ̆p.

English: Then they arose from Midian and came to Paran; and they took men with them from Paran and came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house, apportioned food for him, and gave him land.
Bahnar: Lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng char Midian năm tơ char Paran; lu sư rôp chông ba bơngai Paran năm tơ char Êyiptơ tơ'bơ̆p pơtao Pharaôn. Pơtao Pharaôn ăn kơ sư hnam oei, tơmam sa păng mir chŭn.

English: And Hadad found great favor in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him as wife the sister of his own wife, that is, the sister of Queen Tahpenes.
Bahnar: Pơtao Pharaôn mơnat kơ Hađat tih dêh, na sư ăn kơ Hađat oei kơ oh akăn sư, wă khan oh yă Tahpênes akăn pơtao Pharaôn.

English: Then the sister of Tahpenes bore him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house. And Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among the sons of Pharaoh.
Bahnar: Oh yă Tahpênes tơpŭ ăn kơ sư kon drŏ-nglo anăn sư Gênubat, dĭng Gênubat ưh pă mŏm bơih na Tahpênes iŏk rong sư tơ lăm hnam pơtao. Tơ noh Gênubat wơ̆ 'lŏ oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơtao Pharaôn.

English: So when Hadad heard in Egypt that David rested with his fathers, and that Joab the commander of the army was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, “Let me depart, that I may go to my own country.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Hađat oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ kơtơ̆ng ang Đawit lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư, păng Jôap yŏng linh kư̆m đĭ lôch bơih, na sư khan kơ pơtao Pharaôn: Apinh ih ăn kơ inh brŏk tơ dêh char inh kơdih

English: Then Pharaoh said to him, “But what have you lacked with me, that suddenly you seek to go to your own country?” So he answered, “Nothing, but do let me go anyway.”
Bahnar: “Mă-lei Pharaôn tơl sư: Ih oei hơdai inh tơ âu hăm đei kơ'bah tơdrong kiơ na ih 'maih brŏk tơ dêh char ih kơdih? Na sư tơl: “Huay kơ'bah tơdrong kiơ ră.” Mă-lei apinh ih ăn kơ inh brŏk tơ dêh char inh kơdih.

English: And God raised up another adversary against him, Rezon the son of Eliadah, who had fled from his lord, Hadadezer king of Zobah.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn minh 'nu ayăt hăm sư, bơngai nai dơ̆ng anăn sư Rêson kon drŏ-nglo Êliađa, kơdâu klĕnh đơ̆ng yŏng sư Hadadêser pơtao char Sôba.

English: So he gathered men to him and became captain over a band of raiders, when David killed those of Zobah. And they went to Damascus and dwelt there, and reigned in Damascus.
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit pơlôch linh pơtao Sôba, na Rêson krao akŭm lơ bơngai kiơ̆ sư, na sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu linh tơklah 'noh, năm truh tơ pơlei Đamas oei tơ noh na pôk sư kơdih pơm pơtao plei Đamas.

English: He was an adversary of Israel all the days of Solomon (besides the trouble that Hadad caused); and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
Bahnar: Rêson minh 'nu bơngai ayăt hăm lu bơngai Isơrael truh đĭ chăl pơtao Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r păng pơm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi Hađat đei pơm; sư pơgơ̆r dêh char Aram păng sư blah bơngai Isơrael.

English: Then Solomon’s servant, Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite from Zereda, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow, also rebelled against the king.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat, bơngai Êphraim oei tơ pơlei Sêrêđa, sư đĭch đam Sôlômôn; mĕ sư adro, anăn Sêrua; sư wă iung blah pơtao Sôlômôn mơ̆n.

English: And this is what caused him to rebel against the king: Solomon had built the Millo and repaired the damages to the City of David his father.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong yua kơ kiơ mă sư iung blah pơtao: Sôlômôn man tơiung dur găn păng hơmet ming dur mă hlôh pơchah lăm pơlei Đawit 'bă sư.

English: The man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor; and Solomon, seeing that the young man was industrious, made him the officer over all the labor force of the house of Joseph.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam sư minh 'nu bơngai pran hơgei; Sôlômôn 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm pơnam hơgei bơ̆jang, na Sôlômôn ăn kơ sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai jang apah lăm adrĕch Jôsep.

English: Now it happened at that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite met him on the way; and he had clothed himself with a new garment, and the two were alone in the field.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh Jêrôbôam lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem rok trong, Ahija bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơlei Silô tơ'bơ̆p sư, Ahija hrŭk minh blah ao tai 'nao, 'bar 'nu măr sư đĕch oei tơ 'noh.

English: Then Ahijah took hold of the new garment that was on him, and tore it into twelve pieces.
Bahnar: Ahija iŏk ao tai 'nao mă sư oei hrŭk 'noh hek pơm mơjĭt-'bar hlak.

English: And he said to Jeroboam, “Take for yourself ten pieces, for thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon and will give ten tribes to you
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư khan kơ Jêrôbôam: “Iŏk bĕ kơ ih mơjĭt hlak, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael đei khan: 'Nâu, Inh gô iŏk hek lê̆ dêh char 'nâu đơ̆ng ti Sôlômôn, gô ăn kơ ih mơjĭt adrĕch adrung.

English: (but he shall have one tribe for the sake of My servant David, and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel)
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ Đawit đĭch đam Inh păng Jêrusalem pơlei mă Inh rơih iŏk boih, đơ̆ng rim adrĕch adrung Isơrael Inh gô lê̆ kơ sư minh adrĕch.

English: because they have forsaken Me, and worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the people of Ammon, and have not walked in My ways to do what is right in My eyes and keep My statutes and My judgments, as did his father David.
Bahnar: Inh pơm thoi noh yua kơ sư achăng lê̆ Inh năm kơkuh kơ Astoret yang drŏ-kăn lu bơngai Siđôn, Kêmôs yang lu bơngai Môap, Milkôm yang lu bơngai Ammôn, sư ưh pă năm kiơ̆ trong Inh, ưh pă pơm 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, păng kư̆m ưh kơ wă răk tơdrong juăt Inh păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă thoi Đawit, 'bă sư đei pơm.

English: However I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand, because I have made him ruler all the days of his life for the sake of My servant David, whom I chose because he kept My commandments and My statutes.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei ră Inh ưh kơ iŏk đĭ ôh teh đak đơ̆ng tơpang ti Sôlômôn, lê̆ kơ sư oei pơgơ̆r đĭ chăl arih sư, yua kơ Đawit đĭch đam Inh, Inh rơih iŏk boih, sư boih wei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong juăt Inh.

English: But I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand and give it to you—ten tribes.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh gô iŏk teh đak đơ̆ng kon drŏ-nglo sư, na ăn kơ ih pơgơ̆r mơjĭt adrĕch adrung.

English: And to his son I will give one tribe, that My servant David may always have a lamp before Me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen for Myself, to put My name there.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn minh adrĕch adrung kơ kon drŏ-nglo sư wă kơ Đawit đĭch đam Inh oei đei minh pôm ŭnh kơđeng ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, pơlei mă Inh rơih iŏk wă 'măn Anăn Inh lăm noh.

English: So I will take you, and you shall reign over all your heart desires, and you shall be king over Israel.
Bahnar: Inh rơih iŏk ih, ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael, ih gô pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m ih wă.

English: Then it shall be, if you heed all that I command you, walk in My ways, and do what is right in My sight, to keep My statutes and My commandments, as My servant David did, then I will be with you and build for you an enduring house, as I built for David, and will give Israel to you.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh pơkă, năm lăm trong Inh, pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, hăm wei răk khôi juăt Inh păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă thoi Đawit đĭch đam Inh đei pơm, lei Inh gô oei hơdai ih. Inh gô pơm kơ adrĕch hnam ih kơjăp thoi Inh đei pơm kơ Đawit păng Inh gô ăn bơngai Isơrael kơ ih.

English: And I will afflict the descendants of David because of this, but not forever.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi ei na inh gô phak lu adrĕch adrung Đawit mă-lei ưh kơ ling-lang ôh.”

English: Solomon therefore sought to kill Jeroboam. But Jeroboam arose and fled to Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
Bahnar: Băt thoi noh Sôlômôn chă hloi wă pơlôch Jêrôbôam mă-lei Jêrôbôam iung hăt hot kơdâu ôn tơ dêh Êyiptơ, năm tơ Sisak pơtao Êyiptơ; păng oei hloi tơ pơtao Êyiptơ dĭng truh tơ Sôlômôn lôch.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai Sôlômôn pơm, đĭ-đăng tơdrong kiơ pơtao Sôlômôn pơm păng tơdrong gơh hơgei pơtao đe đei chih răk bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon Sôlômôn?

English: And the period that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: Then Solomon rested with his fathers, and was buried in the City of David his father. And Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư lôch sư năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư păng đe 'bŭ sư lăm pơlei Đawit, 'bă sư, Rôbôam kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: And Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had gone to Shechem to make him king.
Bahnar: Rôbôam năm tơ pơlei Sichem, yua kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael năm akŭm tơ noh bơih wă pôk sư pơm pơtao.

English: So it happened, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard it (he was still in Egypt, for he had fled from the presence of King Solomon and had been dwelling in Egypt )
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat, kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh kơplah sư oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ anih sư kơdâu ôn kơ pơtao Sôlômôn, sư wih brŏk đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: that they sent and called him. Then Jeroboam and the whole assembly of Israel came and spoke to Rehoboam, saying
Bahnar: Đe athei bơngai năm krao sư đơ̆ng noh, na Jêrôbôam păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael năm tơ Rôbôam păng khan kơ sư

English: “Your father made our yoke heavy; now therefore, lighten the burdensome service of your father, and his heavy yoke which he put on us, and we will serve you.”
Bahnar: “'Bă ih tơ'băk ăn kơ nhôn 'long ăt trăp dêh, mă-lei dang ei apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn hơiơch 'biơ̆ dôm tơdrong jang gleh trăp păng 'long ăt trăp mă 'bă ih tơ'băk ăn kơ nhôn, na nhôn gô bơ̆jang kơ ih.”

English: So he said to them, “Depart for three days, then come back to me.” And the people departed.
Bahnar: Na Rôbôam tơl: “Iĕm brŏk bĕ, kơtĕch pêng năr iĕm năm tơ âu dơ̆ng.” Na lu kon pơlei wih brŏk.

English: Then King Rehoboam consulted the elders who stood before his father Solomon while he still lived, and he said, “How do you advise me to answer these people?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Pơtao Rôbôam pơđâu hăm lu đe kră mă đêl bơ̆jang kơ Sôlômôn 'bă sư, kơplah 'bă sư oei arih: Sư jet: Lu iĕm pơđâu liơ, wă kơ inh tơl tơwih ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla 'nâu?

English: And they spoke to him, saying, “If you will be a servant to these people today, and serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be your servants forever.”
Bahnar: Lu sư tơl: “Tơdah năr 'nâu ih pơm thoi đĭch đam kon pơlei pơla, awih awăn kơ lu sư, tơl tơwih pơma dơnuh pơ'lơ̆ng hăm lu sư, lei lu sư gô pơm đĭch đam ih ling-lang.”

English: But he rejected the advice which the elders had given him, and consulted the young men who had grown up with him, who stood before him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Rôbôam sơngah ưh kơ kiơ̆ ôh nơ̆r lu kră 'noh roi kơ sư; đơ̆ng noh sư jet lu bơngai iung tơdăm hơdai sư, oei awih awăn kơ sư.

English: And he said to them, “What advice do you give? How should we answer this people who have spoken to me, saying, ‘Lighten the yoke which your father put on us’?”
Bahnar: Pơtao jet: “Lu iĕm roi lăng kơ inh wă tơl tơwih kơ kon pơlei pơla thoi yơ? Lu sư đei khan kơ inh 'long ăt 'bă ih tơ'băk ăn kơ nhôn trăp dêh, apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn hơiơch 'biơ̆?”

English: Then the young men who had grown up with him spoke to him, saying, “Thus you should speak to this people who have spoken to you, saying, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, but you make it lighter on us’—thus you shall say to them: ‘My little finger shall be thicker than my father’s waist!
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơdăm iung hơdai sư 'noh tơl sư: Khan kơ lu kon pơlei mă khan kơ ih. 'Bă ih tơ'băk ăn kơ nhôn 'long ăt trăp dêh, apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn hơiơch; ih tơl lu sư: ‘Hơnglâu dĕng inh tih hloh kơ kơiĕng 'bă inh.’

English: And now, whereas my father put a heavy yoke on you, I will add to your yoke; my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scourges!’ ”
Bahnar: Sơ̆ 'bă inh tơ'băk ăn kơ iĕm 'long ăt trăp, na inh gô tơ'băk ăn kơ iĕm 'long ăt trăp hloh kơ 'noh dơ̆ng; 'bă inh phak iĕm hăm sơnguĕt akar, inh gô phak iĕm hăm hơguăt.”

English: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king had directed, saying, “Come back to me the third day.”
Bahnar: Na kơtĕch pêng năr bơih, Jêrôbôam hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla năm tơ Rôbôam, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r pơtao đei khan: “Pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơnh iĕm năm tơ âu.”

English: Then the king answered the people roughly, and rejected the advice which the elders had given him
Bahnar: Pơtao tơl tơwih kơ kon pơlei pơla hăm nơ̆r tơdrăp, sư ưh kơ tơl tơwih kơ kon pơlei pơla kiơ̆ thoi lu đe kră athei ôh.

English: and he spoke to them according to the advice of the young men, saying, “My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke; my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scourges!”
Bahnar: Sư tơl tơwih kơ lu kon pơlei pơla kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r lu tơdăm păng khan: “'Bă inh tơ'băk ăn kơ iĕm 'long ăt trăp bơih, inh gô tơ'băk ăn kơ iĕm 'long ăt trăp hloh kơ 'noh dơ̆ng. 'Bă inh bơtho phak pơjĭ iĕm hăm sơnguĕt akar, inh gô phak bơtho iĕm hăm hơguăt sôch.”

English: So the king did not listen to the people; for the turn of events was from the LORD, that He might fulfill His word, which the LORD had spoken by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, pơtao ưh kơ mơ̆ng ôh nơ̆r kon pơlei pơla pơma, yua kơ tơdrong 'noh truh đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn, wă pơsĭt nơ̆r Sư mă Kră Yang yua boih Ahija bơngai Silô khan kơ Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat.

English: Now when all Israel saw that the king did not listen to them, the people answered the king, saying: “What share have we in David? We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse. To your tents, O Israel! Now, see to your own house, O David!” So Israel departed to their tents.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai Isơrael 'bôh pơtao ưh pă mơ̆ng lu sư bơih, lu kon pơlei pơla khan kơ pơtao “Lu nhôn hăm đei kiơ lăm Đawit? Nhôn hăm đei yua tơmam kiơ lăm kon drŏ-nglo Jese. Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael! Iĕm athei brŏk tơ bơsŭn iĕm kơdih. Ơ Đawit! Ih athei lăng bĕ kơ hnam ih kơdih.” Na lu bơngai Isơrael wih brŏk tơ bơsŭn lu sư kơdih.

English: But Rehoboam reigned over the children of Israel who dwelt in the cities of Judah.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai oei tơ lu pơlei lăm Juđa. Rôbôam oei pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Then King Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was in charge of the revenue; but all Israel stoned him with stones, and he died. Therefore King Rehoboam mounted his chariot in haste to flee to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pơtao Rôbôam wơh Adôram bơngai pơgơ̆r pơgŏ tơdrong jang khei, lei na lu bơngai Isơrael klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo. Pơtao Rôbôam hăt hot tŏk tơ gre aseh sư kơdâu ôn tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai Isơrael pơm tơwih blah adrĕch hnam Đawit truh tơ dang ei.

English: Now it came to pass when all Israel heard that Jeroboam had come back, they sent for him and called him to the congregation, and made him king over all Israel. There was none who followed the house of David, but the tribe of Judah only.
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon pơlei Isơrael kơtơ̆ng ang Jêrôbôam brŏk bơih, lu sư wơh bơngai năm krao sư akŭm hơdai păng pôk sư pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael. Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu kiơ̆ adrĕch Đawit lăp adrĕch Juđa đĕch kiơ̆.

English: And when Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah with the tribe of Benjamin, one hundred and eighty thousand chosen men who were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, that he might restore the kingdom to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
Bahnar: Lăp Rôbôam truh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem bơih, sư krao akŭm đĭ-đăng adrĕch Juđa păng adrĕch adrung Bênjamin đei minh-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh tơblah, wă tơblah hăm bơngai Isơrael, wă iŏk tơwih teh đak 'noh ăn kơ Rôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn.

English: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying
Bahnar: Mă-lei nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok kei-Dei khan kơ Semaia bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh

English: “Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ Rôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn, pơtao Juđa, đĭ-đăng adrĕch Juđa, Bênjamin păng lu kon pơlei mă oei oei tơ noh

English: ‘Thus says the LORD: “You shall not go up nor fight against your brethren the children of Israel. Let every man return to his house, for this thing is from Me.” ’ ” Therefore they obeyed the word of the LORD, and turned back, according to the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: 'Nĕ kơ năm tŏk blah lu bơngai Isơrael 'nhŏng oh iĕm. Rim 'nu athei brŏk bĕ tơ hnam sư kơdih, yua kơ tơdrong 'nâu lĕch đơ̆ng Inh.” Lu sư chu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan, brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim, and dwelt there. Also he went out from there and built Penuel.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam pơjing hnam tơ Pơlei Sechem kơjăp tơ kơpal groi Êphraim, sư oei hloi tơ noh, sư lĕch đơ̆ng noh năm pơm Pơlei Pênuel.

English: And Jeroboam said in his heart, “Now the kingdom may return to the house of David
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam tơchĕng lăm đon sư: “Dêh char pơtao âu gô brŏk hơlơ̆k tơ adrĕch Đawit.

English: If these people go up to offer sacrifices in the house of the LORD at Jerusalem, then the heart of this people will turn back to their lord, Rehoboam king of Judah, and they will kill me and go back to Rehoboam king of Judah.”
Bahnar: Tơdah lu kon pơlei 'nâu tŏk năm wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lăm Hnam Akŭm Kră Yang tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, lei jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư gô kiơ̆ pơtao lu sư Rôbôam pơtao đe Juđa,” lu sư gô pơlôch lê̆ inh, na lu sư gô brŏk tơ Rôbôam pơtao đe Juđa.

English: Therefore the king asked advice, made two calves of gold, and said to the people, “It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Here are your gods, O Israel, which brought you up from the land of Egypt!”
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao pơđâu athei đe pơm 'bar tŏ rup rơmo păng maih, pơtao khan kơ kon pơlei pơla: “Lu iĕm tŏk năm chă kiơ tơ pơlei Jêrusalem ataih dêh! Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael 'nâu bơih yang lu iĕm, mă chông tơlĕch lu iĕm đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.”

English: And he set up one in Bethel, and the other he put in Dan.
Bahnar: Sư dan minh pôm rup yang lăm pơlei Bethel, minh pôm rup nai sư dan lăm pơlei Đan.

English: Now this thing became a sin, for the people went to worship before the one as far as Dan.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh jing tơdrong yoch, lu kon pơlei pơla năm tơ pơlei Đan kơkuh kơ minh pôm rup yang rơmo tơ noh.

English: He made shrines on the high places, and made priests from every class of people, who were not of the sons of Levi.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam kư̆m đei pơm lơ hnam yang tơ kơpal anih kơjung păng sư rơih bơngai đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei mă ưh kơ khŭl Lêwi, athei lu sư pơm 'bok soi.

English: Jeroboam ordained a feast on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, like the feast that was in Judah, and offered sacrifices on the altar. So he did at Bethel, sacrificing to the calves that he had made. And at Bethel he installed the priests of the high places which he had made.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam kư̆m đei tơchĕng wă pơjing minh tơdrong pơm giĕng lăm khei tơhngam năr mơjĭt-pơđăm, thoi đe juăt kơ pơm giĕng lăm dêh Juđa, na sư pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi tơ kơpal chơnang. Sư pơm tơdrong noh tơ pơlei Bethel, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sơmah kơ 'bar tŏ rup yang kon rơmo mă sư đei pơm bơih păng maih. Pơtao kư̆m dan tơ pơlei Bethel lu 'bok soi, oei lăm hnam mă sư pơm bơih tơ anih kơjung 'noh.

English: So he made offerings on the altar which he had made at Bethel on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, in the month which he had devised in his own heart. And he ordained a feast for the children of Israel, and offered sacrifices on the altar and burned incense.
Bahnar: Sư năm tơ chơnang soi đêl sư pơm boih tơ pơlei Bethel. Lăm năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei tơhngam, khei mă sư rơih kơdih, sư pơjing minh năr phĕt ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael, na sư năm tŏk tơ chơnang soi wă soh tơmam 'bâu phu.

English: And behold, a man of God went from Judah to Bethel by the word of the LORD, and Jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incense.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Nơ̆r Kră Yang wơh na minh 'nu bơngai mă jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lĕch đơ̆ng char Juđa năm tơ pơlei Bethel, kơplah Jêrôbôam oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t chơnang soi wă soh pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: Then he cried out against the altar by the word of the LORD, and said, “O altar, altar! Thus says the LORD: ‘Behold, a child, Josiah by name, shall be born to the house of David; and on you he shall sacrifice the priests of the high places who burn incense on you, and men’s bones shall be burned on you.’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai 'noh ôr khan kơ chơnang soi kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: “Ơ chơnang soi, chơnang soi! 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu đe gô tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo ăn kơ adrĕch hnam Đawit anăn sư Jôsia. Sư gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơpal ih, lu 'bok soi đơ̆ng anih kơjung, lu 'bok soi noh bơngai mă soh tơmam 'bâu phu kơpal ih tơ rim anih kơjung păng đe gô soh kơting bơngai kơpal ih.”

English: And he gave a sign the same day, saying, “This is the sign which the LORD has spoken: Surely the altar shall split apart, and the ashes on it shall be poured out.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, 'bok khan lê̆ adrol tơ'bôh minh tơdrong hlĭch, khan: “'Nâu tơdrong tơ'bôh hlĭch mă Kră Yang đei khan bơih: Chơnang soi gô pơchah tơnuh gô tơsĭ huŏng đĭ tơ teh.”

English: So it came to pass when King Jeroboam heard the saying of the man of God, who cried out against the altar in Bethel, that he stretched out his hand from the altar, saying, “Arrest him!” Then his hand, which he stretched out toward him, withered, so that he could not pull it back to himself.
Bahnar: Kơplah pơtao Jêrôbôam kơtơ̆ng bơngai đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma ôr blah hăm chơnang soi tơ pơlei Bethel, na pơtao Jêrôbôam chro đơ̆ng chơnang soi yơ̆r ti păng khan: “Rôp sư bĕ!” Ti đêl sư chro tơhlâu tơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua 'noh Kră Yang pơm kơ ti sư arăng kro hloi, ưh pă gơh kơchôt dơ̆ng.

English: The altar also was split apart, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Chơnang soi pơchah hloi păng tơnuh tơsĭ tơ teh, 'blep thoi tơdrong đei tơ'bôh hlĭch đơ̆ng bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei chu nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho khan.

English: Then the king answered and said to the man of God, “Please entreat the favor of the LORD your God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored to me.” So the man of God entreated the LORD, and the king’s hand was restored to him, and became as before.
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ bơngai đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua: “Apinh ih krao khan bĕ apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, apinh ih krao khan tơgŭm inh, wă kơ ti inh gơh klaih thoi so.” Bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei krao khan apinh Kră Yang na ti pơtao klaih gơh kơchôt thoi so hloi.

English: Then the king said to the man of God, “Come home with me and refresh yourself, and I will give you a reward.”
Bahnar: Na pơtao khan kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua: “Apinh ih brŏk tơ hnam sŏng sa hơdai hăm inh, inh gô ăn kơ ih tơmam.”

English: But the man of God said to the king, “If you were to give me half your house, I would not go in with you; nor would I eat bread nor drink water in this place.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei tơl pơtao khan: “Mă ih ăn kơ inh minh puăt dêh char ih, inh kư̆m ưh kơ năm hơdai ih păng inh kư̆m ưh kơ sŏng sa dah nhă đak tơ âu.

English: For so it was commanded me by the word of the LORD, saying, ‘You shall not eat bread, nor drink water, nor return by the same way you came.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan kơ inh: ‘Ih 'nĕ kơ sŏng sa dah nhă đak păng ih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ brŏk rok trong đêl ih năm.’ ”

English: So he went another way and did not return by the way he came to Bethel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, sư wih brŏk trong nai, sư ưh pă năm rok trong đêl, sư năm tơ pơlei Bethel.

English: Now an old prophet dwelt in Bethel, and his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Bethel; they also told their father the words which he had spoken to the king.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră bơih oei lăm Pơlei Bethel, lu kon drŏ-nglo sư ră roi ăn kơ sư dôm tơdrong đêl bơngai đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơm tơ Pơlei Bethel lăm năr 'noh, păng dôm nơ̆r sư đei pơma hăm pơtao. Lu sư roi ăn kơ 'bă lu sư đĭ dôm nơ̆r noh.

English: And their father said to them, “Which way did he go?” For his sons had seen which way the man of God went who came from Judah.
Bahnar: 'Bă lu sư jet. “Lei bơngai 'noh sư brŏk năm trong ayơ?” Na lu kon drŏ-nglo sư tơhlâu ăn kơ 'bă sư trong bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei đơ̆ng char Juđa noh brŏk.

English: Then he said to his sons, “Saddle the donkey for me.” So they saddled the donkey for him; and he rode on it
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: “Tơlĕch ăn kơ inh aseh iĕ” lu kon drŏ-nglo sư tơlĕch ăn kơ sư aseh sư hao hloi.

English: and went after the man of God, and found him sitting under an oak. Then he said to him, “Are you the man of God who came from Judah?” And he said, “I am.”
Bahnar: Sư druh kiơ̆ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei, tơ'bơ̆p sư oei ngôi ala tơm 'long kôih, Sư jet: “Hăm trŏ kơ ih bơngai đơ̆ng char Juđa mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua?” Bơngai ei tơl: “Trŏ kơ inh bơih.”

English: Then he said to him, “Come home with me and eat bread.”
Bahnar: Bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră 'noh khan kơ sư: “Bĕ kiơ̆ inh brŏk tơ hnam sŏng sa.”

English: And he said, “I cannot return with you nor go in with you; neither can I eat bread nor drink water with you in this place.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai 'noh tơl sư: “Inh ưh kơ gơh brŏk hơdai ih. Kŭm ưh kơ gơh sŏng sa dah nhă đak hơdai hăm ih tơ anih 'nâu mơ̆n.

English: For I have been told by the word of the LORD, ‘You shall not eat bread nor drink water there, nor return by going the way you came.’ ”
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan bơih kơ inh. Ih 'nĕ kơ sŏng sa dah nhă đak tơ anih 'noh, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ brŏk rok trong đêl ih năm.”

English: He said to him, “I too am a prophet as you are, and an angel spoke to me by the word of the LORD, saying, ‘Bring him back with you to your house, that he may eat bread and drink water.’ ” (He was lying to him.)
Bahnar: Bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră 'noh tơl sư khan: “Inh kư̆m dai bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lei-lăi thoi ih. Đei minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang khan kơ inh: ‘Ih athei chông ba sư brŏk tơ hnam ih sŏng sa, nhă đak.’ ” Mă-lei bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră hơlĕnh kơ sư.

English: So he went back with him, and ate bread in his house, and drank water.
Bahnar: Thoi ei bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei chu kiơ̆, sŏng sa nhă đak tơ hnam sư.

English: Now it happened, as they sat at the table, that the word of the LORD came to the prophet who had brought him back
Bahnar: Kơplah bre sư oei ngôi 'bơ̆t gơ'bang sŏng sa, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră mă chông ba sư brŏk 'noh.

English: and he cried out to the man of God who came from Judah, saying, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Because you have disobeyed the word of the LORD, and have not kept the commandment which the LORD your God commanded you
Bahnar: Bơngai kră ôr khan kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua mă sư đơ̆ng dêh Juđa 'noh khan: “Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ ih ưh kơ chu nơ̆r Kră Yang, păng ưh kơ wei răk nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơtă pơkă kơ ih.

English: but you came back, ate bread, and drank water in the place of which the LORD said to you, “Eat no bread and drink no water,” your corpse shall not come to the tomb of your fathers.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih brŏk păng sŏng sa nhă đak tơ anih mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn ih sŏng sa nhă đak. Lei na mưh ih lôch, akâu ih ưh kơ gơh 'bŭ hơdai tơ bơsat lu 'bok kơdră ih ôh.

English: So it was, after he had eaten bread and after he had drunk, that he saddled the donkey for him, the prophet whom he had brought back.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei sŏng sa păng nhă đak đang boih, na bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră mă chông sư brŏk ăn kơ sư aseh hao brŏk.

English: When he was gone, a lion met him on the road and killed him. And his corpse was thrown on the road, and the donkey stood by it. The lion also stood by the corpse.
Bahnar: Sư brŏk oei rok trong tơ'bơ̆p dăm-brang châu pơlôch sư hloi, lê̆ akâu sư 'bơ̆t trong, aseh păng dăm-brang dơ̆ng gah cheng.

English: And there, men passed by and saw the corpse thrown on the road, and the lion standing by the corpse. Then they went and told it in the city where the old prophet dwelt.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai năm trong 'noh 'bôh akâu bơngai lôch păng dăm-brang dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng, na năm roi ăn tôm tơdrong kơ lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei 'bok mă khan lê̆ adrol kră 'noh oei.

English: Now when the prophet who had brought him back from the way heard it, he said, “It is the man of God who was disobedient to the word of the LORD. Therefore the LORD has delivered him to the lion, which has torn him and killed him, according to the word of the LORD which He spoke to him.”
Bahnar: Lăp bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kră bơngai mă chông ba sư brŏk kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, na khan: Sư 'noh bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ chu nơ̆r Kră Yang. Thoi noh na Kră Yang ăn dăm-brang châu pơlôch sư, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei khan boih kơ sư.

English: And he spoke to his sons, saying, “Saddle the donkey for me.” So they saddled it.
Bahnar: Sư khan hloi kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: Tơlĕch ăn kơ 'bă aseh, na lu kon sư tơlĕch ăn aseh kơ 'bă sư.

English: Then he went and found his corpse thrown on the road, and the donkey and the lion standing by the corpse. The lion had not eaten the corpse nor torn the donkey.
Bahnar: Sư năm tơ noh 'bôh akâu bơngai lôch 'noh 'bơ̆t trong, hăm aseh păng dăm-brang dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng, dăm-brang ưh kơ sa akâu bơngai lôch păng kư̆m ưh kơchâu aseh 'noh.

English: And the prophet took up the corpse of the man of God, laid it on the donkey, and brought it back. So the old prophet came to the city to mourn, and to bury him.
