Bahnar: 'Bok khan lê̆ adrol kră 'noh atŏk akâu bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua noh tơ kơpal kơdŭ aseh, chơ ba sư brŏk tơ pơlei sư, nhơ̆m hmoi pơdong păng 'bŭ hơmet.

English: Then he laid the corpse in his own tomb; and they mourned over him, saying, “Alas, my brother!”
Bahnar: Sư 'bŭ atâu 'noh lăm bơsat sư kơdih, nhơ̆m hmoi kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua. Ơ! Mơnat oh inh.

English: So it was, after he had buried him, that he spoke to his sons, saying, “When I am dead, then bury me in the tomb where the man of God is buried; lay my bones beside his bones.
Bahnar: Đang kơ 'bŭ bơngai 'noh, na sư khan kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: Layơ 'bă lôch lu iĕm athei 'bŭ 'bă lăm bơsat mă bơ̆n 'bŭ akâu bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua, 'măn kơting inh 'bơ̆t cheng kơting bơngai 'noh.

English: For the saying which he cried out by the word of the LORD against the altar in Bethel, and against all the shrines on the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, will surely come to pass.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ dôm nơ̆r sư pơma chu nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma blah chơnang soi lăm Pơlei Bethel păng lu hnam pơm yang tơ kơjung lăm dêh Samari, gô 'blep trŏ tơpă.

English: After this event Jeroboam did not turn from his evil way, but again he made priests from every class of people for the high places; whoever wished, he consecrated him, and he became one of the priests of the high places.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong noh hlôi bơih, Jêrôbôam ưh kơ weh ôh đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ sư pơm 'noh, sư rai chă pôk lơ bơngai đơ̆ng lăm pơlei pơla pơm 'bok soi tơ hnam kơkuh kơ rup yang tơ lu anih kơjung bơngai bu 'maih pơm 'bok soi, sư ăn kơ bơngai 'noh pơm 'bok soi tơ rim anih kơjung.

English: And this thing was the sin of the house of Jeroboam, so as to exterminate and destroy it from the face of the earth.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nâu jing tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ tih kơ adrĕch hnam Jêrôbôam pơm ăn kơ dêh char sư pơchah pơchek păng đe pơlôch đĭ-đăng đơ̆ng kơpal teh đak âu.

English: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam became sick.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh Ahija kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôbôam jĭ

English: And Jeroboam said to his wife, “Please arise, and disguise yourself, that they may not recognize you as the wife of Jeroboam, and go to Shiloh. Indeed, Ahijah the prophet is there, who told me that I would be king over this people.
Bahnar: Na Jêrôbôam khan kơ akăn sư. “Ih pơm thoi bơngai nai, wă kơ đe ưh kơ băt ih akăn inh. Na năm tơ Pơlei Silô, Ahija bơngai khan Lê̆ adrol oei tơ noh, sư đei khan lê̆ adrol gah inh gô pơm pơtao lu kon pơlei pơla 'nâu.

English: Also take with you ten loaves, some cakes, and a jar of honey, and go to him; he will tell you what will become of the child.”
Bahnar: Ih chĕp ba mơjĭt tŏ 'bĕng mi dôm tŏ 'bĕng 'ngam păng chĕp ba minh pôm get đak sut, na ih năm tơ noh tơ'bơ̆p sư. Sư roi ăn kơ ih gô đei tơdrong kiơ truh kơ kon ba.”

English: And Jeroboam’s wife did so; she arose and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. But Ahijah could not see, for his eyes were glazed by reason of his age.
Bahnar: Akăn Jêrôbôam pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh. Sư iung, năm truh tơ hnam Ahija Pơlei Silô. Măt Ahija ưh kơ bang yua kơ sư đĭ kră bơih.

English: Now the LORD had said to Ahijah, “Here is the wife of Jeroboam, coming to ask you something about her son, for he is sick. Thus and thus you shall say to her; for it will be, when she comes in, that she will pretend to be another woman.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Ahija: “To akăn Jêrôbôam năm jet ih gah kon drŏ-nglo sư jĭ, na ih athei khan kơ sư păng tơl sư thoi âu. Mưh sư truh, sư pơm bơngai nai.”

English: And so it was, when Ahijah heard the sound of her footsteps as she came through the door, he said, “Come in, wife of Jeroboam. Why do you pretend to be another person? For I have been sent to you with bad news.
Bahnar: Lăp akăn Jêrôbôam truh 'bơ̆t 'măng, na Ahija kơtơ̆ng re jơ̆ng sư nơnăm na khan kơ sư: “Ơ akăn Jêrôbôam mơ̆t bĕ. Yua kơ kiơ ih pơm bơngai nai? Đei nơ̆r tơtă kơ inh athei inh khan tơbăt kơ ih minh tơdrong sơ'ngon tih krưp.

English: Go, tell Jeroboam, ‘Thus says the LORD God of Israel: “Because I exalted you from among the people, and made you ruler over My people Israel
Bahnar: Roi bĕ kơ Jêrôbôam 'nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “Inh pôk atŏk ih đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei pơla, ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao Isơrael kon pơlei pơla inh.

English: and tore the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it to you; and yet you have not been as My servant David, who kept My commandments and who followed Me with all his heart, to do only what was right in My eyes
Bahnar: Inh iŏk lê̆ teh đak đơ̆ng hnam Đawit na pơjao ăn kơ ih; mă-lei ih ưh kơ pơm rok kiơ̆ Đawit đĭch đam Inh, sư wei răk tơdrong juăt Inh păng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m, sư pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.”

English: but you have done more evil than all who were before you, for you have gone and made for yourself other gods and molded images to provoke Me to anger, and have cast Me behind your back
Bahnar: Ih pơm kơnê̆ dêh hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai adrol kơ ih, pơm kơdih yang plơ̆ng man lu rup yang, wă kơ Inh hil păng hŭt lê̆ Inh tơ rŏng.

English: therefore behold! I will bring disaster on the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam every male in Israel, bond and free; I will take away the remnant of the house of Jeroboam, as one takes away refuse until it is all gone.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong 'noh na Inh gô ăn tơdrong truh pơmat kơ hnam adrĕch Jêrôbôam, Inh gô pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo, mă bơngai rơngei dah đĭch lăm khŭl Isơrael, Inh gô soh hơpuih pơgoh hnam adrĕch Jêrôbôam, thoi đe soh tơmam 'mê̆ dĭng mă goh.

English: The dogs shall eat whoever belongs to Jeroboam and dies in the city, and the birds of the air shall eat whoever dies in the field; for the LORD has spoken!” ’
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lăm hnam dơnŏ Jêrôbôam, dah sư lôch lăm pơlei kŏ gô hek sa, dah sư lôch tơ bri, sem păr gô choh sa, yua kơ Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Arise therefore, go to your own house. When your feet enter the city, the child shall die.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, iung brŏk bĕ, lăp ih wă mơ̆t tơ pơlei kon ih gô lôch.

English: And all Israel shall mourn for him and bury him, for he is the only one of Jeroboam who shall come to the grave, because in him there is found something good toward the LORD God of Israel in the house of Jeroboam.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei Isơrael gô nhơ̆m hmoi păng 'bŭ sư; lăm hnam dơnŏ Jêrôbôam lăp minh 'nu đĕch 'bŭ lăm bơsat, yua kơ lăm hnam Jêrôbôam lăp minh 'nu sư đĕch đei jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆ hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: “Moreover the LORD will raise up for Himself a king over Israel who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam; this is the day. What? Even now!
Bahnar: Kră Yang Sư kơdih gô tơiung kơ minh 'nu pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r Isơrael, sư gô pơlôch pơđĭ hnam dơnŏ Jêrôbôam lăm năr 'nâu hloi? Tơpă năr 'nâu hloi.

English: For the LORD will strike Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water. He will uproot Israel from this good land which He gave to their fathers, and will scatter them beyond the River, because they have made their wooden images, provoking the LORD to anger.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô teh pơrăm lu bơngai Isơrael thoi 'nhĕt trang gơlăr hoch lăm đak, sư gô buch lê̆ đơ̆ng rơh lu bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng lăm char 'lơ̆ng rŏ, mă Kră Yang ăn kơ 'bok kơdră lu sư păng pơm kơ lu sư tơklah tơklang tơ pah to đak krong Ơphrat, yua kơ lu sư pơm gơ̆ng rup yang Asera wă tơblĕk Kră Yang.

English: And He will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, who sinned and who made Israel sin.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Jêrôbôam pơm yoch păng pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael jing yoch na Kră Yang achăng hŭt lu sư.”

English: Then Jeroboam’s wife arose and departed, and came to Tirzah. When she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.
Bahnar: Akăn Jêrôbôam iung brŏk tơ pơlei Tirsa Lăp sư 'nao truh 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam sư, 'bôh kon drŏ-nglo sư lôch bơih.

English: And they buried him; and all Israel mourned for him, according to the word of the LORD which He spoke through His servant Ahijah the prophet.
Bahnar: Đe 'bŭ sư, đĭ-đăng Isơrael nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư, 'blep thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang yua 'bơ̆r Ahija 'bok khan lê̆ adrol đei khan bơih noh.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he made war and how he reigned, indeed they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai mă Jêrôbôam đei pơm, tơdrong sư tơblah păng tơdrong sư pơgơ̆r, đei chih bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao Isơrael.

English: The period that Jeroboam reigned was twenty-two years. So he rested with his fathers. Then Nadab his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Jêrôbôam pơgơ̆r 'bar-jĭt 'bar sơnăm, đơ̆ng noh sư lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư, kon drŏ-nglo sư anăn Nađap tŏk pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: And Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king. He reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the LORD had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put His name there. His mother’s name was Naamah, an Ammonitess.
Bahnar: Rôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn pơgơ̆r lăm dêh char Juđa; kơplah sư tŏk pơgơ̆r, sư puăn-jĭt mônh sơnăm bơih; sư pơgơ̆r mơjĭt-tơpơh sơnăm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, pơlei mă Kră Yang rơih đơ̆ng lăm rim adrĕch adrung Isơrael, wă 'măn Anăn Sư tơ noh. Mĕ pơtao anăn Naama bơngai Ammôn.

English: Now Judah did evil in the sight of the LORD, and they provoked Him to jealousy with their sins which they committed, more than all that their fathers had done.
Bahnar: Khŭl bơngai Juđa pơm yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Lu sư pơm yoch tơblĕk Kră Yang hloh kơ lu 'bok yă lu sư pơm sơ̆.

English: For they also built for themselves high places, sacred pillars, and wooden images on every high hill and under every green tree.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa kư̆m dai pơm ăn kơ lu sư kơdih hnam kơkuh kơ lu rup yang tơ anih kơjung, pơm gơ̆ng soi păng tơmo, lu gơ̆ng rup yang Asêrim yang drŏ-kăn tơ anih groi kơjung tơ ala rim tơnơm 'long.

English: And there were also perverted persons in the land. They did according to all the abominations of the nations which the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Đei lu drŏ-kăn ngôi kư̆ kă pơm đi oei tơ lăm char 'noh, lu sư pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ krưp dêh thoi lu adrĕch adrung mă Kră Yang areh pơpuh tơweh lê̆ bơih đơ̆ng anăp lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: It happened in the fifth year of King Rehoboam that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pơđăm lăm chăl Rôbôam pơgơ̆r, pơtao Êyiptơ anăn Sisak, sư tŏk blah pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And he took away the treasures of the house of the LORD and the treasures of the king’s house; he took away everything. He also took away all the gold shields which Solomon had made.
Bahnar: Pơtao noh blah iŏk đĭ tơmam yua đơ̆ng lăm hnam Kră Yang păng đơ̆ng lăm hnam pơtao. Sư kư̆m chĕp ba pơđĭ lu khêl mă Sôlômôn pơm păng maih 'noh.

English: Then King Rehoboam made bronze shields in their place, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, who guarded the doorway of the king’s house.
Bahnar: Pơtao Rôbôam wơh bơngai pơm khêl păng kong tơplih kơ khêl 'noh, sư pơjao ăn kơ lu yŏng linh gak 'măng jang hnam pơtao.

English: And whenever the king entered the house of the LORD, the guards carried them, then brought them back into the guardroom.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t pơtao năm mơ̆t lăm Hnam Kră Yang, lu bơngai gak kiơ̆ chĕp khêl 'noh, đang bơih lu sư năm ming pơdrâu tơ lăm anih lu bơngai gak noh dơ̆ng.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Bahnar: Pôm lu tơdrong jang mă Rôbôam đei pơm păng dôm tơdrong jang nai mă sư pơm bơih, đe đei chih răk lê̆ bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon kơ lu pơtao Juđa.

English: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all their days.
Bahnar: Rôbôam hăm Jêrôbôam bre sư tơblah băl ling-lang ưh kơ pơdơh.

English: So Rehoboam rested with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the City of David. His mother’s name was Naamah, an Ammonitess. Then Abijam his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Rôbôam lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư. Đe 'bŭ sư hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư tơ pơlei Đawit. Mĕ sư anăn Naama, bơngai Ammôn. Abijam kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijam became king over Judah.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-tơhngam chăl Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat pơgơ̆r, Abijam pơtơm pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r dêh char Juđa.

English: He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Maachah the granddaughter of Abishalom.
Bahnar: Sư pơgơ̆r pêng sơnăm lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem. Mĕ sư anăn Maaka kon drŏ-kăn Abisalom.

English: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him; his heart was not loyal to the LORD his God, as was the heart of his father David.
Bahnar: Sư năm kiơ̆ đĭ trong tơdrong yoch mă 'bă sư đei pơm bơih adrol kơ sư; lăm jơhngơ̆m sư ưh kơ pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư, thoi jơhngơ̆m 'bok kơdră sư pơm.

English: Nevertheless for David’s sake the LORD his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, by setting up his son after him and by establishing Jerusalem
Bahnar: Mă-lei yua kơ Đawit, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư minh pôm ŭnh kơđeng lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư, pơm ăn kơ pơlei Jêrusalem oei kơjăp

English: because David did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, and had not turned aside from anything that He commanded him all the days of his life, except in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
Bahnar: yua kơ Đawit đei pơm bơih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, sư pơm kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong mă Kră Yang tơtă kơ sư lăm đĭ chăl arih sư, lăp minh tơdrong pơm glăi hăm Uri bơngai Hêtit đĕch.

English: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
Bahnar: Rôbôam păng Jêrôbôam tơblah băl ling-lang dĭng đĭ chăl Abijam pơgơ̆r.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong jang păng tơdrong Abijam đei pơm bơih, đe chih răk lê̆ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Juđa? Abijam păng Jêrôbôam kư̆m tơblah băl.

English: So Abijam rested with his fathers, and they buried him in the City of David. Then Asa his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Abijam lôch năm oei hơdai hăm 'bok kơdră sư; đe 'bŭ sư lăm pơlei Đawit. Asa kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa became king over Judah.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt chăl Jêrôbôam pơm pơtao đe Isơrael, Asa tŏk pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r char Juđa.

English: And he reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem. His grandmother’s name was Maachah the granddaughter of Abishalom.
Bahnar: Sư pơgơ̆r puăn-jĭt mônh sơnăm lăm pơlei Jêrusalem. Yă tơm gah 'bă sư anăn Maaka kon drŏ-kăn Abisalom.

English: Asa did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, as did his father David.
Bahnar: Asa pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, thoi Đawit 'bok kơdră sư đei pơm.

English: And he banished the perverted persons from the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
Bahnar: Sư pơpuh tơlĕch lu bơngai drŏ-nglo ngôi kư̆ kă pơm đi đơ̆ng lăm char sư pơgơ̆r păng teh pơchah pơđĭ lu rup yang mă đêl lu 'bok kơdră sư pơm.

English: Also he removed Maachah his grandmother from being queen mother, because she had made an obscene image of Asherah. And Asa cut down her obscene image and burned it by the Brook Kidron.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m plôh tơlĕch yă sư Maaka đơ̆ng pơm yă pơtao lăm hnam pơtao, yua kơ yă sư man gơ̆ng rup yang Asêra drŏ-kăn mă kơnê̆ krưp dêh. Asa kư̆m teh tơpăk lê̆ gơ̆ng pôm yang păng soh rŭk lê̆ tơ lăm thŭng Kidrôn.

English: But the high places were not removed. Nevertheless Asa’s heart was loyal to the LORD all his days.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ yuih hŭt lê̆ ôh lu anih kơjung đe pơm yang, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m Asa pơm 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang truh đĭ chăl arih sư.

English: He also brought into the house of the LORD the things which his father had dedicated, and the things which he himself had dedicated: silver and gold and utensils.
Bahnar: Sư chĕp ba tah lăm hnam Kră Yang hu, maih păng dôm tơmam kăl đơ̆ng 'bă sư păng đơ̆ng sư kơdih pơyơ̆r.

English: Now there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
Bahnar: Asa pơtao đe Juđa, Baasa pơtao đe Isơrael, bre sư tơblah băl hơnơ̆ng truh đĭ chăl arih bre sư.

English: And Baasha king of Israel came up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might let none go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
Bahnar: Baasa pơtao Isơrael tŏk blah char Juđa, đơ̆ng noh sư pơm kơđông pơlei Rama, mă kơjăp wă găn bơngai Juđa kuă ăn lĕch dah mơ̆t tơ dêh char Asa pơtao Juđa.

English: Then Asa took all the silver and gold that was left in the treasuries of the house of the LORD and the treasuries of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants. And King Asa sent them to Ben-Hadad the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who dwelt in Damascus, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Asa iŏk đĭ hu, maih đơ̆ng lăm Hnam Kră Yang păng đơ̆ng hnam pơtao, pơjao ăn kơ đĭch đam sư păng wơh lu sư năm tơ Ben Hadat kon drŏ-nglo Tabrimmôn, sâu Hêsiôn, pơtao Siri, oei pơgơ̆r tơ pơlei Đamas păng khan

English: “Let there be a treaty between you and me, as there was between my father and your father. See, I have sent you a present of silver and gold. Come and break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, so that he will withdraw from me.”
Bahnar: “Ba athei pơgơ̆p băl, thoi 'bă ba đei pơgơ̆p băl sơ̆; 'nâu tơmam hu, maih inh pơyơ̆r gơih ăn kơ ih. Dang ei ih athei sut lê̆ đĭ đêl ih pơgơ̆p hăm Baasa pơtao Isơrael, wă kơ sư weh ataih đơ̆ng inh.”

English: So Ben-Hadad heeded King Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel. He attacked Ijon, Dan, Abel Beth Maachah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
Bahnar: Ben Hadat chu nơ̆r pơtao Asa, athei lu linh sư năm tơblah hăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael. Sư blah iŏk pơlei Ijôn, pơlei Đan, pơlei Abel Bet Maaka, đĭ char Kinêrot păng đĭ kơ char Naptali.

English: Now it happened, when Baasha heard it, that he stopped building Ramah, and remained in Tirzah.
Bahnar: Baasa kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu, sư pơdơh hloi ưh pă pơm kơđông pơlei Rama dơ̆ng păng brŏk oei tơ pơlei Tirsa.

English: Then King Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none was exempted. And they took away the stones and timber of Ramah, which Baasha had used for building; and with them King Asa built Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh pơtao Asa pơkă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđa, ưh kơ lê̆ minh 'nu bơngai bu, lu sư pŭ iŏk lu tơmo păng lu 'long tơ̆r mă đêl Baasa yua pơm kơđông pơlei Rama; đơ̆ng noh pơtao Asa yua tơmam 'noh pơm pơlei Gêba lăm char Bênjamin, păng pơlei Mispa.

English: The rest of all the acts of Asa, all his might, all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang nai mă Asa pơm păng tơdrong pơgơ̆r đei yua, dôm tơdrong sư đei pơm păng dôm lu pơlei sư đei tơiung pơjing đei chih răk lê̆ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar lu pơtao đe Juđa. Kơplah sư đĭ kră bơih, sư jĭ jơ̆ng.

English: So Asa rested with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the City of David his father. Then Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Asa lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư; păng đe 'bŭ sư hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư tơ pơlei Đawit 'bok sư. Jêhôsaphat kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: Now Nadab the son of Jeroboam became king over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and he reigned over Israel two years.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, Nađap kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôbôam pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael, sư pơgơ̆r lăm 'bar sơnăm.

English: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin by which he had made Israel sin.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, năm kiơ̆ trong pơm yoch thoi 'bă sư đei pơm bơih, pơm kơ lu bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch kiơ̆.

English: Then Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him. And Baasha killed him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines, while Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.
Bahnar: Baasa kon drŏ-nglo Ahija adrĕch hnam Isakar chă đon wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư, lăm kơplah Nađap păng lu bơngai Isơrael wang blah iŏk pơlei Gibêthôn, pơlei lu bơngai Philistin. Na Baasa pơlôch sư.

English: Baasha killed him in the third year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă pêng lăm chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa Baasa pơlôch Nađap păng pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r tơplih hloi.

English: And it was so, when he became king, that he killed all the house of Jeroboam. He did not leave to Jeroboam anyone that breathed, until he had destroyed him, according to the word of the LORD which He had spoken by His servant Ahijah the Shilonite
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'nao pơm pơtao, sư pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai gah adrĕch hnam Jêrôbôam, ưh kơ lê̆ minh 'nu bơngai bu arih, lăm hnam dơnŏ Jêrôbôam sư kư̆m pơlôch pơđĭ kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang yua 'bơ̆r Ahija đĭch đam Sư pơlei Silô.

English: because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he had sinned and by which he had made Israel sin, because of his provocation with which he had provoked the LORD God of Israel to anger.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch Jêrôbôam pơm kơ lu bơngai Isơrael dai pơm yoch păng pơm tơblĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang nai păng dôm tơdrong jang mă Nađap đei pơm đe đei chih lê̆ bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Isơrael?

English: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
Bahnar: Asa pơtao đe Juđa păng Baasa pơtao Isơrael tơblah băl hơnơ̆ng truh đĭ chăl arih bre sư.

English: In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah became king over all Israel in Tirzah, and reigned twenty-four years.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pêng lăm chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, Baasa kon drŏ-nglo Ahija pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael tơ pơlei Tirsa păng sư pơgơ̆r 'bar-jĭt puăn sơnăm.

English: He did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin by which he had made Israel sin.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, sư năm kiơ̆ trong Jêrôbôam păng tơdrong yoch sư, sư kư̆m pơm ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael dai wang pơm yoch kiơ̆.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Jehu the son of Hanani, against Baasha, saying
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang tơbăt kơ Jêhu, kon drŏ-nglo Hanani nơ̆r noh tơblah hăm Baasa

English: “Inasmuch as I lifted you out of the dust and made you ruler over My people Israel, and you have walked in the way of Jeroboam, and have made My people Israel sin, to provoke Me to anger with their sins
Bahnar: Inh tơiung atŏk ih đơ̆ng 'mui teh ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao lu kon pơlei pơla Isơrael Inh. Mă-lei ih năm kiơ̆ trong Jêrôbôam păng pơm kơ lu bơngai Isơrael kon pơlei pơla Inh pơm yoch, pơm tơblĕk Inh hăm tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: surely I will take away the posterity of Baasha and the posterity of his house, and I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh gô pơlôch pơgoh lê̆ Baasa, păng đĭ hnam dơnŏ adrĕch sư, Inh gô pơm kơ hnam sư răm đĭ, thoi hnam Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat.

English: The dogs shall eat whoever belongs to Baasha and dies in the city, and the birds of the air shall eat whoever dies in the fields.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu gah hnam Baasa lôch lăm pơlei, kŏ gô sa păng tơdah lôch tơ bri sem păr gô choh sa.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, what he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai Baasa păng tơdrong mă sư đei pơm bơih đe đei chih lê̆ bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: So Baasha rested with his fathers and was buried in Tirzah. Then Elah his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Baasa lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư, păng đe 'bŭ sư tơ Pơlei Tirsa. Êlah kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: And also the word of the LORD came by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha and his house, because of all the evil that he did in the sight of the LORD in provoking Him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and because he killed them.
Bahnar: Đei dơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Jêhu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, kon Hanani, nơ̆r noh blah Baasa păng adrĕch sư, yua kơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ mă sư đei pơm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, păng tơblĕk Kră Yang hăm tơdrong sư pơm, sư pơm rok thoi adrĕch hnam Jêrôbôam păng yua kơ sư pơlôch pơrăm adrĕch hnam noh.

English: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha became king over Israel, and reigned two years in Tirzah.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt tơdrâu, chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, Êlah kon drŏ-nglo Baasa tŏk pơm pơtao đe Isơrael. Sư oei tơ Pơlei Tirsa, pơgơ̆r lăp 'bar sơnăm đĕch.

English: Now his servant Zimri, commander of half his chariots, conspired against him as he was in Tirzah drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, steward of his house in Tirzah.
Bahnar: Simri bơngai pơm yŏng wei-lăng minh puăt gre aseh sư, chă đon pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư. Êla oei lăm Pơlei Tirsa, kơplah et tơdrô suai tơ lăm hnam Arsa bơngai wei-lăng hnam pơtao tơ pơlei Tirsa

English: And Zimri went in and struck him and killed him in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Simri mơ̆t lăm hnam teh păng 'bet pơlôch hloi Êla lăm sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt tơpơh chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, đơ̆ng noh Sư tŏk pơm pơtao pơtrơp hloi.

English: Then it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he was seated on his throne, that he killed all the household of Baasha; he did not leave him one male, neither of his relatives nor of his friends.
Bahnar: Lăp Simri tŏk pơm pơtao, sư pơlôch pơđĭ bơngai lăm hnam Baasa ưh kơ lê̆ minh 'nu drŏ-nglo ayơ, mă khan lăm adrĕch adrung dah buăl juăt.

English: Thus Zimri destroyed all the household of Baasha, according to the word of the LORD, which He spoke against Baasha by Jehu the prophet
Bahnar: Thoi noh Simri pơlôch pơđĭ boih adrĕch hnam Baasa, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan bơih kơ Jêhu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol nơ̆r noh blah Baasa

English: for all the sins of Baasha and the sins of Elah his son, by which they had sinned and by which they had made Israel sin, in provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their idols.
Bahnar: yua kơ tơdrong yoch Baasa păng Êlah kon drŏ-nglo sư đei pơm, păng tơdrong sư pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael dai wang pơm yoch rok sư, tơblĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael hăm tơdrong lu sư pơm kơkuh kơ rup yang.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai Êlah pơm, đe đei chih lê̆ bơih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri had reigned in Tirzah seven days. And the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar-jĭt tơpơh chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, Simri pơgơ̆r 'nao lăp tơpơh năr tơ lăm Pơlei Tirsa. Kơplah noh lu linh Isơrael oei wang tăp dăr Pơlei Gibêthôn, pơlei lu bơngai Philistin.

English: Now the people who were encamped heard it said, “Zimri has conspired and also has killed the king.” So all Israel made Omri, the commander of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.
Bahnar: Lăp lu linh lăm kơđông kơtơ̆ng đe khan Simri blơ̆ păng pơlôch pơtao. Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla Isơrael pôk Ômri bơngai mă pơm yŏng linh, ăn kơ sư pơm pơtao Isơrael.

English: Then Omri and all Israel with him went up from Gibbethon, and they besieged Tirzah.
Bahnar: Na Ômri păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael tŏk đơ̆ng Pơlei Gibêthôn năm wang tơ Pơlei Tirsa.

English: And it happened, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the citadel of the king’s house and burned the king’s house down upon himself with fire, and died
Bahnar: Lăp Simri 'bôh đe wang tăp dăr kơ pơlei bơih na sư mơ̆t tơ lăm kơđông hnam pơtao mă kơjăp dêh, na sư soh hnam pơtao păng akâu sư lôch hloi lăm noh.

English: because of the sins which he had committed in doing evil in the sight of the LORD, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he had committed to make Israel sin.
Bahnar: 'Noh yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch sư pơm, pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, rok kiơ̆ trong Jêrôbôam, kơdih akâu sư pơm yoch păng pơm ăn kơ Isơrael jing yoch kiơ̆.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and the treason he committed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai mă Simri pơm păng tơdrong Simri chă đon pơdăr blơ̆ pơtao đe đei chih lê̆ bơih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: Then the people of Israel were divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king, and half followed Omri.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael tơklah jing 'bar khŭl; minh khŭl kiơ̆ Tipni, kon drŏ-nglo Ginat, wă pôk sư pơm pơtao; minh khŭl kiơ̆ Ômri.

English: But the people who followed Omri prevailed over the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath. So Tibni died and Omri reigned.
Bahnar: Mă-lei khŭl Ômri pran hloh kơ khŭl kiơ̆ Tipni, kon drŏ-nglo Ginat. Thoi noh Tipni lôch na Ômri pơm pơtao.

English: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri became king over Israel, and reigned twelve years. Six years he reigned in Tirzah.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pêng-jĭt mônh lăm chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, Ômri tŏk pơm pơtao đe Isơrael, sư pơgơ̆r mơjĭt-'bar sơnăm. Sư pơgơ̆r oei lăm Pơlei Tirsa tơdrâu sơnăm.

English: And he bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver; then he built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built, Samaria, after the name of Shemer, owner of the hill.
Bahnar: Sư răt groi Samari đơ̆ng 'bok Sêmer 'bar hlak talâng hu; tơ kơpal groi 'noh sư pơjing minh pôm pơlei kơjăp sư anăn pơlei 'noh Samari, anăn kiơ̆ tơ'ngla groi noh.

English: Omri did evil in the eyes of the LORD, and did worse than all who were before him.
Bahnar: Ômri pơm kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai adrol kơ sư.

English: For he walked in all the ways of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sin by which he had made Israel sin, provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their idols.
Bahnar: Sư kiơ̆ trong Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat đei pơm, tơdrong sư pơm 'noh pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch kiơ̆, tơblĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael hăm tơdrong kơkuh kơ rup yang.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and the might that he showed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang nai mă Ômri pơm, păng tơdrong sư gơh pơgơ̆r, đe đei chih bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: So Omri rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria. Then Ahab his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Ômri lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư, đe 'bŭ sư lăm Pơlei Samari. Ahap kon drŏ-nglo sư, pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah, Ahab the son of Omri became king over Israel; and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă pêng-jĭt tơhngam, chăl Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa, Ahap kon drŏ-nglo Ômri pơm pơtao đe Isơrael tơ Pơlei Samari 'bar-jĭt 'bar sơnăm.

English: Now Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD, more than all who were before him.
Bahnar: Ahap kon drŏ-nglo Ômri pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu pơtao adrol kơ sư.

English: And it came to pass, as though it had been a trivial thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took as wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal, king of the Sidonians; and he went and served Baal and worshiped him.
Bahnar: Sư lăng pơm yoch rok thoi Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat iĕ đĕch, sư iŏk Jêsebel kon drŏ-kăn Êtbaal pơtao đe Siđôn pơm akăn; sư bơ̆jang kơ yang Baal păng kơkuh kơ yang 'noh.

English: Then he set up an altar for Baal in the temple of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
Bahnar: Sư pơm chơnang soi ăn kơ yang Baal lăm hnam yang Baal lăm Pơlei Samari.

English: And Ahab made a wooden image. Ahab did more to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him.
Bahnar: Ahap kư̆m man minh pôm rup yang yă Asêra. Ahap pơm lơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆, pơm tơblĕk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael hloh kơ lu pơtao đe Isơrael adrol kơ sư.

English: In his days Hiel of Bethel built Jericho. He laid its foundation with Abiram his firstborn, and with his youngest son Segub he set up its gates, according to the word of the LORD, which He had spoken through Joshua the son of Nun.
Bahnar: Lăm chăl Ahap pơgơ̆r, Hiel đơ̆ng pơlei Bethel tơiung pơdơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrikô. Lăp sư wă man jrăng hơnă hnam Abiram kon drŏ-nglo kơdră sư lôch, kơplah sư pơm 'măng jang, Sêgup kon adruch sư lôch. Trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang, yua 'bơ̆r Jôsuê, kon drŏ-nglo Nun đei khan lê̆ adrol.

English: And Elijah the Tishbite, of the inhabitants of Gilead, said to Ahab, “As the LORD God of Israel lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, except at my word.”
Bahnar: Êli bơngai Pơlei Tisbe, oei tơ Pơlei Tisbe lăm char Gileat, sư khan kơ Ahap: “Inh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael mă arih khan: Lăm sơnăm tơ anăp 'nâu, gô đei tơdrong phang-ang, tŭk păng đak 'mi ưh kơ đei jur tơ teh, dĭng truh tơ Inh đei khan dơ̆ng.”

English: Then the word of the LORD came to him, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Êli

English: “Get away from here and turn eastward, and hide by the Brook Cherith, which flows into the Jordan.
Bahnar: “Ih athei weh đơ̆ng âu năm tơ gah hơlĕch, ôn akâu ih tơ Thong đak Kêrit, gah hơlĕch kơ đak krong Jôrđăn.

English: And it will be that you shall drink from the brook, and I have commanded the ravens to feed you there.”
Bahnar: Ih gô nhă đak thong Kêrit 'noh păng Inh gô wơh sem ak 'me rong ih tơ noh.”

English: So he went and did according to the word of the LORD, for he went and stayed by the Brook Cherith, which flows into the Jordan.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Êli chu nơ̆r Kră Yang athei sư năm oei tơ thong đak Kêrit gah hơlĕch kơ đak krong Jôrđăn.

English: The ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening; and he drank from the brook.
Bahnar: Rim pơgê kơsơ̆ ak jơngong ba ăn kơ sư 'bĕng mi păng 'nhĕm kông păng sư nhă đak thong Kêrit.

English: And it happened after a while that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh 'biơ̆ đak thong 'noh hrơ̆, yua kơ ưh kơ đei đak 'mi tơ lăm char noh.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to him, saying
Bahnar: Na đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Êli

English: “Arise, go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and dwell there. See, I have commanded a widow there to provide for you.”
Bahnar: “Ih athei iung weh đơ̆ng anih 'nâu năm bĕ tơ Pơlei Sarepha lăm dêh char Siđôn ih oei hloi tơ noh. Na Inh đei pơkă bơih kơ minh 'nu drŏ-kăn adro 'me rong ih tơ noh”.

English: So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, indeed a widow was there gathering sticks. And he called to her and said, “Please bring me a little water in a cup, that I may drink.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, sư iung năm tơ Pơlei Sarepha; lăp sư truh 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei, sư 'bôh minh 'nu drŏ-kăn adro oei dônh 'long ŭnh, Êli krao drŏ-kăn adro 'noh păng khan: “Inh apinh ih sŏ đak lăm ge hơya tŏ sĕt ăn kơ inh nhă.”

English: And as she was going to get it, he called to her and said, “Please bring me a morsel of bread in your hand.”
Bahnar: Lăp drŏ-kăn adro 'noh wă năm sŏ đak, Êli krao hơlơ̆k sư dơ̆ng păng khan: “Ih athei chĕp ba ăn kơ inh 'bĕng mi hai!”

English: So she said, “As the LORD your God lives, I do not have bread, only a handful of flour in a bin, and a little oil in a jar; and see, I am gathering a couple of sticks that I may go in and prepare it for myself and my son, that we may eat it, and die.”
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn adro ei tơl: “Đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih oei arih băt, inh ưh pă đei minh pôm 'bĕng. Inh oei pă minh chup tơpŭng lăm ge păng đak rơmă kư̆m dai oei tŏ sĕt lăm getchai. 'Nâu inh chă dônh minh 'bar tŏ 'long ŭnh, wă brŏk pơm ăn kơ nhi kon drŏ-nglo inh 'bĕng; wă sa pơtôch, na nhi gô lôch đĕch bơih.”

English: And Elijah said to her, “Do not fear; go and do as you have said, but make me a small cake from it first, and bring it to me; and afterward make some for yourself and your son.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Êli khan kơ sư: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli, ih athei brŏk pơm hloi thoi ih khan 'noh, mă adrol ih athei yua tơpŭng 'noh pơm ăn kơ inh minh pôm 'bĕng iĕ, đơ̆ng noh ba ăn kơ inh tơ âu; đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh ih pơm ăn kơ ih păng kon drŏ-nglo ih.

English: For thus says the LORD God of Israel: ‘The bin of flour shall not be used up, nor shall the jar of oil run dry, until the day the LORD sends rain on the earth.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ đei nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael khan: ‘Tơpŭng ưh kơ đĭ ôh đơ̆ng lăm ge păng đak rơmă kư̆m ưh kơ đĭ mơ̆n đơ̆ng lăm get, dĭng truh tơ năr Kră Yang ăn đak 'mi jur tơ teh.’ ”

English: So she went away and did according to the word of Elijah; and she and he and her household ate for many days.
Bahnar: Sư brŏk pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Êli khan, lăm hnam dơnŏ sư păng Êli sa 'bĕng 'noh tôm mah rim năr.

English: The bin of flour was not used up, nor did the jar of oil run dry, according to the word of the LORD which He spoke by Elijah.
Bahnar: Tơpŭng ưh kơ đĭ đơ̆ng lăm ge, đak rơmă ôliwơ kư̆m ưh kơ đĭ đơ̆ng lăm get, trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei yua Êli bơtho akhan.

English: Now it happened after these things that the son of the woman who owned the house became sick. And his sickness was so serious that there was no breath left in him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh kon drŏ-nglo yă tơ'ngla hnam jĭ dêh rai dêh kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m.

English: So she said to Elijah, “What have I to do with you, O man of God? Have you come to me to bring my sin to remembrance, and to kill my son?”
Bahnar: Na yă tơ'ngla hnam 'noh khan kơ Êli. “Ơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua, inh hăm ih đei tơdrong kiơ? Hăm trŏ ih năm tơ hnam inh 'nâu wă tơ'blŏk kơ inh đei tơdrong yoch păng pơlôch kon drŏ-nglo inh”.

English: And he said to her, “Give me your son.” So he took him out of her arms and carried him to the upper room where he was staying, and laid him on his own bed.
Bahnar: Êli tơl sư: “Ăn kon ih tơ âu,” Êli glơng iŏk đơ̆ng ti mĕ sư tŏk tơ anih sư 'bĭch tơ kơpal, tơ'bĭch sư kơpal giơng.

English: Then he cried out to the LORD and said, “O LORD my God, have You also brought tragedy on the widow with whom I lodge, by killing her son?”
Bahnar: Na sư krao khan kơ Kră Yang: “Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Yua kơ kiơ Ih ăn tơdrong truh kơ yă adro 'nâu, hnam sư 'nâu jơ̆ anih inh oei pơdơh, mă wă lê̆ kơ kon sư lôch hă?”

English: And he stretched himself out on the child three times, and cried out to the LORD and said, “O LORD my God, I pray, let this child’s soul come back to him.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư brom kơpal bơngai 'lơ̆p 'noh pêng wơ̆t păng krao khan kơ Kră Yang: “Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Apinh Ih ăn bơhngol bơngai 'lơ̆p 'nâu wih mơ̆t lăm akâu sư dơ̆ng.”

English: Then the LORD heard the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came back to him, and he revived.
Bahnar: Kră Yang mơ̆ng păng tơl tơwih nơ̆r Êli krao khan; bơhngol bơngai 'lơ̆p 'noh mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ lăm akâu sư na sư iung arih dơ̆ng.

English: And Elijah took the child and brought him down from the upper room into the house, and gave him to his mother. And Elijah said, “See, your son lives!”
Bahnar: Êli glơng bơngai 'lơ̆p 'noh đơ̆ng anih kơpal jur tơ ala, jao bơngai 'lơ̆p 'noh kơ mĕ sư păng khan, “ih lăng âu kon ih arih bơih.”

English: Then the woman said to Elijah, “Now by this I know that you are a man of God, and that the word of the LORD in your mouth is the truth.”
Bahnar: Yă adro noh khan kơ Êli: “Dang ei inh băt kơ ih 'nâu minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua, dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang pơm lăm 'bơ̆r ih sĭt tơpă.”

English: And it came to pass after many days that the word of the LORD came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go, present yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain on the earth.”
Bahnar: Đunh năr đơ̆ng noh, truh lăm sơnăm mă pêng, đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Êli: “Ih athei năm tơ'bơ̆p Ahap; Inh gô ăn đak 'mi jruh tơ teh dơ̆ng.

English: So Elijah went to present himself to Ahab; and there was a severe famine in Samaria.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Êli năm tơ'bơ̆p Ahap. Kơplah noh lăm dêh char Samari đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt tih dêh.

English: And Ahab had called Obadiah, who was in charge of his house. (Now Obadiah feared the LORD greatly.
Bahnar: Ahap krao Ôbadia bơngai wei-lăng hnam pơtao Ôbadia hli yom kơ Kră Yang dêh.

English: For so it was, while Jezebel massacred the prophets of the LORD, that Obadiah had taken one hundred prophets and hidden them, fifty to a cave, and had fed them with bread and water.)
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêsebel pơlôch lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă Kră Yang yua, Ôbadia ba minh-hrĕng 'nu lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ôn lu sư tơ 'bar anih lăm hơgơp tơmo lăm minh anih pơđăm-jĭt 'nu, ăn kơ lu sư tơmam sa păng đak nhă.

English: And Ahab had said to Obadiah, “Go into the land to all the springs of water and to all the brooks; perhaps we may find grass to keep the horses and mules alive, so that we will not have to kill any livestock.”
Bahnar: Ahap khan kơ Ôbadia: “Ih athei chă năm tơ jơ̆p-jang dêh char păng tơ rim kơ tu thong đak, rŏ lăng bơ̆n chă oei 'bôh đei 'nhĕt wă kơ hiĕm aseh oei arih, wă kơ lu sem dơrong huay kơ lôch hiong.”

English: So they divided the land between them to explore it; Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na bre sư asong băl chă năm jơ̆p tơring char. Ahap sư năm trong 'nâu, Ôbadia sư năm trong to.

English: Now as Obadiah was on his way, suddenly Elijah met him; and he recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, “Is that you, my lord Elijah?”
Bahnar: Kơplah Ôbadia oei năm rok trong Êli tơ'bơ̆p sư. Ôbadia kơnăl kơ sư na drap tơ teh păng jet: “Hăm trŏ kơ ih Êli yŏng inh ưh?”

English: And he answered him, “It is I. Go, tell your master, ‘Elijah is here.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư tơl: “Trŏ kơ inh bơih. Năm roi bĕ kơ yŏng ih khan: ‘Êli oei tơ âu.’ ”

English: So he said, “How have I sinned, that you are delivering your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?
Bahnar: Ôbadia tơl: “Inh đei pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ, na ih pơjao inh mă đam ih lăm tơpang ti Ahap, wă kơ sư pơlôch inh?

English: As the LORD your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my master has not sent someone to hunt for you; and when they said, ‘He is not here,’ he took an oath from the kingdom or nation that they could not find you.
Bahnar: Inh pơma tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih mă oei arih, ưh kơ đei minh pôm dêh char ayơ, minh adrĕch adrung ayơ mă yŏng inh ưh kơ đei athei lu sư chă ih; păng tơdah đe khan: Êli ưh kơ đei tơ âu, sư athei dêh char dah adrĕch adrung 'noh athei pơkă gah tơdrong khan lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh ih.

English: And now you say, ‘Go, tell your master, “Elijah is here” ’!
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei ih khan kơ inh: “Ih athei năm roi kơ yŏng ih: Êli oei tơ âu.”

English: And it shall come to pass, as soon as I am gone from you, that the Spirit of the LORD will carry you to a place I do not know; so when I go and tell Ahab, and he cannot find you, he will kill me. But I your servant have feared the LORD from my youth.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ băt mưh inh weh đơ̆ng ih, kơnh Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang gô pôk hiŏng tơweh ih tơ nai, Mưh inh năm roi kơ Ahap, athei năm tơ âu na ưh kơ 'bôh ih tơ anih 'nâu lei sư gô pơlôch inh, mă khan inh đam ih, hli yom kơ Kră Yang đơ̆ng inh oei 'lơ̆p ră.

English: Was it not reported to my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of the LORD, how I hid one hundred men of the LORD’s prophets, fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
Bahnar: Kơplah Jêsebel pơlôch lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă Kră Yang yua, inh năm ba minh-hrĕng 'nu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă Kră Yang yua chă ôn tơ 'bar anih hơgơp tơmo, tơ minh anih pơđăm-jĭt 'nu inh ăn kơ lu sư tơmam sa păng đak nhă.

English: And now you say, ‘Go, tell your master, “Elijah is here.” ’ He will kill me!”
Bahnar: Na dang ei ih khan: “Ih athei roi bĕ kơ yŏng ih, Êli tơ âu. Sư gô pơlôch inh.”

English: Then Elijah said, “As the LORD of hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will surely present myself to him today.”
Bahnar: Êli tơl: “Inh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tih hloh oei arih, inh gô tơ'bơ̆p Ahap năr 'nâu.”

English: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Ôbadia năm tơ'bơ̆p păng roi kơ Ahap, na Ahap năm tơ'bơ̆p Êli.

English: Then it happened, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, “Is that you, O troubler of Israel?”
Bahnar: Lăp Ahap 'bôh Êli na sư khan kơ Êli. “Ih hă pơrŭng lu bơngai Isơrael?”

English: And he answered, “I have not troubled Israel, but you and your father’s house have, in that you have forsaken the commandments of the LORD and have followed the Baals.
Bahnar: Êli tơl: “Inh ưh kơ pơrŭng ôh lu bơngai Isơrael, ih păng hnam 'bă ih pơrŭng lu bơngai Isơrael, yua kơ lu iĕm hŭt lê̆ tơdrong Kră Yang tơtă na lui kiơ̆ yang Baal.

English: Now therefore, send and gather all Israel to me on Mount Carmel, the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal, and the four hundred prophets of Asherah, who eat at Jezebel’s table.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei bĕ đe năm krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, tơ'bơ̆p inh tơ kông Karmel păng puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah yang Baal, păng puăn-hrĕng 'nu lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol yang Asêra păng lu bơngai sŏng sa tơ gơ'bang Jêsebel.

English: So Ahab sent for all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together on Mount Carmel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Ahap athei đe năm krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael păng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm akŭm tơ Kông Karmel.

English: And Elijah came to all the people, and said, “How long will you falter between two opinions? If the LORD is God, follow Him; but if Baal, follow him.” But the people answered him not a word.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Êli năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei pơla păng khan: Lu iĕm năm ting bơring kiơ̆ 'bar pah trong 'nâu dĭng dang yơ? Tơdah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lei iĕm athei kiơ̆ Kră Yang, tơdah Baal jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lei iĕm athei kiơ̆ Sư. Mă-lei lu kon pơlei pơla ưh kơ đei tơl sư minh nơ̆r.

English: Then Elijah said to the people, “I alone am left a prophet of the LORD; but Baal’s prophets are four hundred and fifty men.
Bahnar: Na Êli khan kơ lu kon pơlei pơla: “Inh, lăp minh 'nu inh đĕch bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă Kră Yang yua mă oei oei, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah yang Baal đei puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.

English: Therefore let them give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, but put no fire under it; and I will prepare the other bull, and lay it on the wood, but put no fire under it.
Bahnar: Chă ăn kơ nhôn 'bar tŏ rơmo tơno; ăn kơ lu sư rơih iŏk minh pôm kơdih, kăt hlơ-hlah na dan sư kơpal 'long ŭnh mă-lei 'nĕ kơ soh ŭnh, inh kư̆m dai kăt hlơ-hlah minh pôm rơmo tơno dan kơpal 'long ŭnh kư̆m ưh kơ soh ŭnh mơ̆n.

English: Then you call on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the LORD; and the God who answers by fire, He is God.” So all the people answered and said, “It is well spoken.”
Bahnar: Iĕm athei krao apinh anăn yang iĕm, gah inh krao apinh Anăn Kră Yang. Yang ayơ mă tơl tơwih ăn ŭnh soh 'long ŭnh, 'noh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla tơl khan: Nơ̆r ih pơma 'noh trŏ bơih.

English: Now Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one bull for yourselves and prepare it first, for you are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under it.”
Bahnar: Êli khan kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah yang Baal. Iĕm rơih iŏk minh pôm rơmo tơno kơ lu iĕm bĕ, păng kăt hlơ-hlah adrol yua kơ iĕm bơngai lơ; na krao apinh anăn yang lu iĕm; mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ soh ŭnh tơ 'long ŭnh noh.

English: So they took the bull which was given them, and they prepared it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even till noon, saying, “O Baal, hear us!” But there was no voice; no one answered. Then they leaped about the altar which they had made.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu sư iŏk rơmo dui ba tơ noh, kăt hlơ-hlah pơm hơmet, Đơ̆ng noh lu sư krao apinh hăm anăn yang Baal: Ơ Baal! Apinh tơl tơwih nơ̆r nhôn. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei nơ̆r tơl tơwih; lu sư suang pơplŏng tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi lu sư pơm 'noh, đơ̆ng pơgê hrôih truh tơ 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: And so it was, at noon, that Elijah mocked them and said, “Cry aloud, for he is a god; either he is meditating, or he is busy, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he is sleeping and must be awakened.”
Bahnar: Truh năr dơ̆ng bơih Êli che bơle kơ lu sư khan: “Iĕm krao mă rơ̆n wăi, sư yang tơpă wăi. Băt Sư oei tơchĕng, băt sư oei krŭl tơ nai păng băt sư oei chă ngôi tơ ataih, dah mă oei tep, iĕm râu sư wăi.

English: So they cried aloud, and cut themselves, as was their custom, with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng lei lu sư krao ôr rai rơ̆n, iŏk đao tơju raih akâu lu sư kơdih pham lĕch djrông djrang mang.

English: And when midday was past, they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice. But there was no voice; no one answered, no one paid attention.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr kơsơ̆ glơh bơih lu sư krao ôr 'bơ̆r re păng truh jơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba ăn kơ yang Baal 'bơ̆t jơ kơsơ̆ ei bơih, mă-lei ưh kơ kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r kiơ, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu tơl păng ưh kơ đei bu mă hiơ̆k ăn.

English: Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.” So all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of the LORD that was broken down.
Bahnar: Na Êli khan kơ lu kon pơlei pơla, “apinh iĕm năm jê̆ tơ âu:” Na lu kon pơlei pơla năm dơ̆ng jê̆ sư. Êli hơmet ming chơnang soi Kră Yang mă răm bơih.

English: And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of the LORD had come, saying, “Israel shall be your name.”
Bahnar: Êli iŏk mơjĭt-'bar tŏ tơmo kiơ̆ kơsô̆ mơjĭt-'bar adrĕch kon drŏ-nglo Jakôp, bơngai mă nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: “Anăn ih gô krao Isơrael.

English: Then with the stones he built an altar in the name of the LORD; and he made a trench around the altar large enough to hold two seahs of seed.
Bahnar: Sư yua mơjĭt-'bar tŏ tơmo 'noh pơm minh pôm chơnang soi yua hăm Anăn Kră Yang; sư sir hơbong tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi, să sư bơ̆n gơh tah 'bar hnŏng mong găr adrĕch.

English: And he put the wood in order, cut the bull in pieces, and laid it on the wood, and said, “Fill four waterpots with water, and pour it on the burnt sacrifice and on the wood.”
Bahnar: Sư dan 'long ŭnh păng kăt kơnăt 'nhĕm rơmo tơno 'noh dan tơ kơpal 'long ŭnh. Đơ̆ng noh sư khan: “Tuh đak 'bĕnh kơ puăn tŏ ge păng tuh đak noh tơ kơpal 'nhĕm kơnăt păng 'long ŭnh.”

English: Then he said, “Do it a second time,” and they did it a second time; and he said, “Do it a third time,” and they did it a third time.
Bahnar: “Sư athei đe tuh đak 'măng mă 'bar dơ̆ng đe tuh đak 'măng mă 'bar. Sư khan dơ̆ng:” Iĕm athei tuh dơ̆ng 'măng mă pêng, na đe tuh 'măng mă pêng.

English: So the water ran all around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.
Bahnar: Dĭng đak ro tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi păng 'bĕnh kơ hơbong.

English: And it came to pass, at the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near and said, “LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known this day that You are God in Israel and I am Your servant, and that I have done all these things at Your word.
Bahnar: Gah kơsơ̆, truh jơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi, Êli bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm dơ̆ng jê̆ chơnang soi 'noh păng krao khan: “Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Isăk păng Isơrael, năr 'nâu apinh ih ăn kơ đe băt Ih boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm khŭl bơngai Isơrael. Inh đĭch đam Ih, chu nơ̆r Ih pơm kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong Ih bơtho akhan.

English: Hear me, O LORD, hear me, that this people may know that You are the LORD God, and that You have turned their hearts back to You again.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang! Apinh Ih mơ̆ng păng tơl tơwih nơ̆r inh, wă kơ lu kon pơlei pơla 'nâu băt kơnăl Ih bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng gô pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m lu sư wih tơ Ih.

English: Then the fire of the LORD fell and consumed the burnt sacrifice, and the wood and the stones and the dust, and it licked up the water that was in the trench.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh ŭnh đơ̆ng Kră Yang jruh soh sa tơmam soi 'buh, 'long ŭnh, tơmo, 'mui teh păng đak lăm hơbong 'noh hrơ̆ đĭ.

English: Now when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces; and they said, “The LORD, He is God! The LORD, He is God!”
Bahnar: Lăp kon pơlei pơla 'bôh thoi noh bơih lu sư drap brom tơ teh kơkuh păng khan: Kră Yang bơih 'Bok Kei-Dei! Kră Yang bơih 'Bok Kei-Dei!”

English: And Elijah said to them, “Seize the prophets of Baal! Do not let one of them escape!” So they seized them; and Elijah brought them down to the Brook Kishon and executed them there.
Bahnar: Êli khan kơ lu sư: “Rôp bĕ đĭ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah yang Baal, 'nĕ kơ ăn minh 'nu bơngai ayơ klaih.” Lu sư rôp hloi lu bơngai 'noh. Êli chông ba lu sư jur tơ thong đak Kisôn păng pơlôch đĭ lu sư tơ noh.

English: Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.”
Bahnar: Êli khan kơ Ahap: “Tŏk năm, sŏng sa păng et yua kơ inh kơtơ̆ng jơwa 'mi tih.”

English: So Ahab went up to eat and drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; then he bowed down on the ground, and put his face between his knees
Bahnar: Na Ahap tŏk năm sŏng sa păng et, Êli tŏk tơ kơpal kông Karmel, kŭp tơ teh, muh măt sư kŭp sơlam 'bar pah kŭl-tăng sư.

English: and said to his servant, “Go up now, look toward the sea.” So he went up and looked, and said, “There is nothing.” And seven times he said, “Go again.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ đam sư: “Ih năm lăng tơ gah đak dơsĭ.” Đam sư tŏk lăng, păng khan: “Inh ưh kơ đei 'bôh kiơ.” Êli khan dơ̆ng: “Ih athei năm dơ̆ng tơ noh tơpơh wơ̆t.”

English: Then it came to pass the seventh time, that he said, “There is a cloud, as small as a man’s hand, rising out of the sea!” So he said, “Go up, say to Ahab, ‘Prepare your chariot, and go down before the rain stops you.’ ”
Bahnar: Wơ̆t mă tơpơh, đam sư khan: “Tơ đak dơsĭ inh 'bôh hơmơ̆l tŏ tơpang ti bơngai tŏk đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ.” Êli khan. “Năm roi bĕ kơ Ahap: Apinh pơtao hơmet gre aseh jah jur năm, kơnh hli kơ 'mi pơm kơ ih ưh kơ gơh kơ năm.

English: Now it happened in the meantime that the sky became black with clouds and wind, and there was a heavy rain. So Ahab rode away and went to Jezreel.
Bahnar: Lăp pă 'biơ̆ kơ noh đei hơmơ̆l găm suek, đei kial bah păng đei 'mi tih hloi. Ahap hao gre aseh hăt hot năm tơ Pơlei Jêsreel.

English: Then the hand of the LORD came upon Elijah; and he girded up his loins and ran ahead of Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
Bahnar: Ti Kră Yang chro pel akâu Êli. Sư iŏk tơlei tơ̆n, tơ̆n tơ kơiĕng păng sư kơdâu adrol kơ Ahap, truh tơ 'măng wă mơ̆t Pơlei Jêsreel.

English: And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, also how he had executed all the prophets with the sword.
Bahnar: Ahap roi kơ yă Jêsebel dôm tơdrong Êli đei pơm boih păng thoi yơ tơdrong sư yua đao gưm pơlôch lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol gah Baal hăm.

English: Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I do not make your life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time.”
Bahnar: Na yă Jêsebel athei đe năm khan kơ Êli: “Năr dơning lăm jơ 'nâu, tơdah inh ưh kơ pơrăm tơdrong arih ih, thoi ih pơrăm tơdrong arih minh 'nu lăm lu sư, lei apinh lu yang phak inh mă trăp.”

English: And when he saw that, he arose and ran for his life, and went to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah, and left his servant there.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Êli hli, sư iung kơdâu weh wă pơklaih tơdrong arih sư. Sư năm truh tơ Pơlei Bêrsêba lăm char Juđa, lê̆ lu đam sư oei tơ noh.

English: But he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a broom tree. And he prayed that he might die, and said, “It is enough! Now, LORD, take my life, for I am no better than my fathers!”
Bahnar: Gah Êli, sư năm tơ char glă dang minh năr kơ trong, sư hơ-oei ngôi 'bơ̆t yơ̆p tơm 'long hơngo, sư apinh 'maih wă kơ jah lôch. “Hrăp bơih, dang ei ơ Kră Yang! Jah iŏk bĕ tơdrong arih inh, yua kơ inh ưh kơ đei kiơ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ lu 'bok kơdră inh.”

English: Then as he lay and slept under a broom tree, suddenly an angel touched him, and said to him, “Arise and eat.”
Bahnar: Na sư 'bĭch 'bơ̆t ala tơm 'long 'noh tep. Blư đei minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng râu sư, khan: “Iung sa bĕ.”

English: Then he looked, and there by his head was a cake baked on coals, and a jar of water. So he ate and drank, and lay down again.
Bahnar: Sư iung lăng 'bôh minh tơpei 'bĕng 'bơ̆t kơ̆l anih sư 'bĭch oei 'buh kơpal tơmo ŭnh păng minh pôm get đak, sư iŏk sa păng nhă đak 'noh đơ̆ng noh sư 'bĭch dơ̆ng.

English: And the angel of the LORD came back the second time, and touched him, and said, “Arise and eat, because the journey is too great for you.”
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng năm tơ sư dơ̆ng wơ̆t mă 'bar râu sư khan: “Iung sa bĕ, yua kơ trong oei ataih dêh.”

English: So he arose, and ate and drank; and he went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights as far as Horeb, the mountain of God.
Bahnar: Na sư iung sa păng nhă, sư đei jơhngơ̆m pran hloi đơ̆ng tơmam sa 'noh, đơ̆ng noh sư năm puăn-jĭt năr puăn-jĭt măng dĭng truh tơ Hôrêp kông Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And there he went into a cave, and spent the night in that place; and behold, the word of the LORD came to him, and He said to him, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
Bahnar: Truh tơ noh, sư mơ̆t tơ hơgơp tơmo, 'bĭch tep lăm noh minh măng. Đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ sư: “Ơ Êli ih pơm kiơ tơ âu?”

English: So he said, “I have been very zealous for the LORD God of hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken Your covenant, torn down Your altars, and killed Your prophets with the sword. I alone am left; and they seek to take my life.”
Bahnar: Sư tơl: “Jơhngơ̆m inh oei adrin yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, yua kơ bơngai Isơrael sơngah bơih kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Ih, pơrăm lê̆ chơnang soi ih, păng iŏk đao gưm pơlôch lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă Ih yua. Pă minh 'nu inh oei arih, na dang ei lu sư kư̆m oei chă wă pơlôch inh.”

English: Then He said, “Go out, and stand on the mountain before the LORD.” And behold, the LORD passed by, and a great and strong wind tore into the mountains and broke the rocks in pieces before the LORD, but the LORD was not in the wind; and after the wind an earthquake, but the LORD was not in the earthquake
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lĕch bĕ păng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ kơpal kông, yua kơ Kră Yang wă năm trong 'noh.” Đei hloi kial tih tơthu kơtang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, kial tơthu pơm kơ kông 'noh đah lang păng lu tơmo pơchah đĭ, mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei lăm kial 'noh. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ kial hơbŭt 'noh đei teh tơdrŏ, mă-lei Kră Yang kư̆m ưh kơ đei lăm teh tơdrŏ.

English: and after the earthquake a fire, but the LORD was not in the fire; and after the fire a still small voice.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ teh tơdrŏ đei pla ŭnh; mă-lei Kră Yang kư̆m ưh kơ oei lăm pla ŭnh. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pla ŭnh đei nơ̆r hơbôn pơma hơdar.

English: So it was, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle and went out and stood in the entrance of the cave. Suddenly a voice came to him, and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
Bahnar: Lăp Êli kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma 'noh sư iŏk ao tai gom muh măt sư, păng lĕch dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng hơgơp tơmo. Đei nơ̆r khan kơ sư, “Ơ Êli, ih pơm kiơ tơ âu?”

English: And he said, “I have been very zealous for the LORD God of hosts; because the children of Israel have forsaken Your covenant, torn down Your altars, and killed Your prophets with the sword. I alone am left; and they seek to take my life.”
Bahnar: Êli tơl: “Jơhngơ̆m inh oei adrin dêh yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih Hloh, yua kơ bơngai Isơrael sơngah bơih kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Ih, pơrăm lê̆ chơnang soi Ih pơlôch lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hăm đao gưm pă minh 'nu inh oei arih, dang ei lu sư kư̆m oei chă wă pơlôch inh.

English: Then the LORD said to him: “Go, return on your way to the Wilderness of Damascus; and when you arrive, anoint Hazael as king over Syria.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ sư: “Ih brŏk hơlơ̆k bĕ trong đêl ih năm 'noh truh tơ Pơlei Đamas. Mưh ih truh tơ noh bơih ih tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu kơ Hasael pơm pơtao char Siri.

English: Also you shall anoint Jehu the son of Nimshi as king over Israel. And Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel Meholah you shall anoint as prophet in your place.
Bahnar: Păng tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu kơ Jêhu kon drŏ-nglo Nimsi pôk sư pơm pơtao đe Isơrael; đơ̆ng noh ih athei tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu kơ Êlisê kon drŏ-nglo Saphat đơ̆ng Pơlei Abel Mêhôla jing bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơplih ih.

English: It shall be that whoever escapes the sword of Hazael, Jehu will kill; and whoever escapes the sword of Jehu, Elisha will kill.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu klaih đơ̆ng đao gưm Hasael, Jêhu gô pơlôch sư; bu klaih đơ̆ng đao gưm Jêhu Êlisê gô pơlôch sư.

English: Yet I have reserved seven thousand in Israel, all whose knees have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth that has not kissed him.”
Bahnar: Gah Inh đei rơih iŏk tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ hơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp yang Baal, 'bơ̆r lu sư tam lah chŭm sư ôh.”

English: So he departed from there, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he was with the twelfth. Then Elijah passed by him and threw his mantle on him.
Bahnar: Na Êli năm đơ̆ng anih 'noh tơ'bơ̆p hloi Êlisê, kon drŏ-nglo Saphat oei rơuơ chŭn hơdai hăm mơjĭt-'bar đôi rơmo rơuơ nai, sư choh rơuơ đôi rơmo mă mơjĭt-'bar. Êli năm jê̆ sư păng klơ̆m ăn kơ sư ao tai.

English: And he left the oxen and ran after Elijah, and said, “Please let me kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you.” And he said to him, “Go back again, for what have I done to you?”
Bahnar: Êlisê achăng lê̆ rơmo choh sư 'noh kơdâu kiơ̆ Êli, păng khan: “Apinh ih ăn kơ inh brŏk tơ'bơ̆p chŭm mĕ 'bă inh 'mơ̆i, đơ̆ng noh inh gô kiơ̆ ih hloi.” Êli tơl: “Năm brŏk đơ̆ng noh hơlơ̆k tơ âu dơ̆ng, inh đei ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ kơ ih ôh.”

English: So Elisha turned back from him, and took a yoke of oxen and slaughtered them and boiled their flesh, using the oxen’s equipment, and gave it to the people, and they ate. Then he arose and followed Elijah, and became his servant.
Bahnar: Êlisê tơklah đơ̆ng Êli brŏk, sư rôp 'bet sa minh đôi rơmo, đơ̆ng noh iŏk 'long rơuơ blah pơm 'long ŭnh 'buh pai 'nhĕm rơmo, đơ̆ng noh pai ăn kơ lu đam sa. Đang boih sư iung năm kiơ̆ Êli pơm jơ̆ng 'bang păng bơ̆jang kơ sư.

English: Now Ben-Hadad the king of Syria gathered all his forces together; thirty-two kings were with him, with horses and chariots. And he went up and besieged Samaria, and made war against it.
Bahnar: Ben Hadat pơtao dêh char Siri, sư krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu linh sư; đei pêng-jĭt 'bar 'nu pơtao kiơ̆ sư. Aseh păng gre aseh kư̆m lơ, lu sư tŏk năm wang Pơlei Samari păng blah.

English: Then he sent messengers into the city to Ahab king of Israel, and said to him, “Thus says Ben-Hadad
Bahnar: Sư wơh đam sư năm mơ̆t lăm pơlei tơ'bơ̆p Ahap pơtao đe Isơrael, na khan: “'Nâu nơ̆r Ben Hadat khan

English: ‘Your silver and your gold are mine; your loveliest wives and children are mine.’ ”
Bahnar: ‘Hu maih ih 'noh tơmam inh; đĭ-đăng lu kon akăn ih mă 'lơ̆ng hloh noh tơmam inh ngăl bơih.’ ”

English: And the king of Israel answered and said, “My lord, O king, just as you say, I and all that I have are yours.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael tơl: “Ơ yŏng pơtao inh, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r ih khan, inh păng dôm tơmam inh đei 'noh tơmam ih ngăl.”

English: Then the messengers came back and said, “Thus speaks Ben-Hadad, saying, ‘Indeed I have sent to you, saying, “You shall deliver to me your silver and your gold, your wives and your children”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă pơtao wơh năm dơ̆ng păng khan: “Ben Hadat khan: ‘Inh wơh bơngai năm khan tơbăt kơ ih: Ih athei jao ăn kơ inh hu maih, lu akăn ih păng lu kon ih.

English: but I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, and they shall search your house and the houses of your servants. And it shall be, that whatever is pleasant in your eyes, they will put it in their hands and take it.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, pơgê dơning lăm jơ 'nâu inh gô wơh đĭch đam inh năm truh tơ hnam ih, lu sư gô chă yuih lăng dôm tơmam kiơ mă lu sư kăl lăm hnam ih păng lăm hnam đĭch đam ih, lu sư iŏk chĕp ba pơđĭ.’ ”

English: So the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, “Notice, please, and see how this man seeks trouble, for he sent to me for my wives, my children, my silver, and my gold; and I did not deny him.”
Bahnar: Pơtao đe Isơrael kơtơ̆ng thoi noh bơih na sư krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu 'bok kră lăm dêh char păng khan: “Lu iĕm lăng deh thoi yơ bơngai 'nâu chă đon wă pơrăm lu bơ̆n, yua kơ sư đei wơh boih lu đĭch đam sư wă athei inh pơjao ăn kon akăn inh păng lu hu maih inh kơ sư, inh kư̆m ưh pă gơh sơngah bơih.”

English: And all the elders and all the people said to him, “Do not listen or consent.”
Bahnar: Lu đe kră păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla khan: “Pơtao, ih 'nĕ kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r sư păng 'nĕ kơ chu sư.”

English: Therefore he said to the messengers of Ben-Hadad, “Tell my lord the king, ‘All that you sent for to your servant the first time I will do, but this thing I cannot do.’ ” And the messengers departed and brought back word to him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Ahap khan kơ lu bơngai mă pơtao 'Ben Hadat wơh: “Iĕm athei khan kơ yŏng inh: Dôm tơdrong ih apinh đơ̆ng inh mă adrol 'noh inh gô pơm; mă-lei wơ̆t 'nâu inh ưh kơ gơh pơm ôh?” Lu bơngai mă đơ̆ng Ben Hadat wơh 'noh brŏk roi dôm nơ̆r 'noh.

English: Then Ben-Hadad sent to him and said, “The gods do so to me, and more also, if enough dust is left of Samaria for a handful for each of the people who follow me.”
Bahnar: Ben Hadat wơh bơngai nai dơ̆ng tơ'bơ̆p Ahap khan: “Apinh lu yang phak inh mă trăp tơdah 'mui teh tơ Samari tôm mah kơ rim tơpang ti lu linh lăm minh 'nu minh chup.”

English: So the king of Israel answered and said, “Tell him, ‘Let not the one who puts on his armor boast like the one who takes it off.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Ahap tơl: “Brŏk khan kơ sư: ‘Bơngai hrŭk ao mam 'nĕ kơ pơang akâu kơdih thoi bơngai mă plôh lê̆ ao.’ ”

English: And it happened when Ben-Hadad heard this message, as he and the kings were drinking at the command post, that he said to his servants, “Get ready.” And they got ready to attack the city.
Bahnar: Ben Hadat oei et tơdrô hơdai hăm lu pơtao lăm kơđông, lăp sư kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r 'noh, na khan hloi kơ lu linh sư: “Iĕm athei hơmet năm blah.” Đơ̆ng noh lu linh năm hloi wă blah pơlei 'noh.

English: Suddenly a prophet approached Ahab king of Israel, saying, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Have you seen all this great multitude? Behold, I will deliver it into your hand today, and you shall know that I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm tơ'bơ̆p Ahap, pơtao đe Isơrael păng khan: “Kră Yang khan: ‘Ih hăm 'bôh ưh minh khŭl linh lơlap 'nâu? Năr 'nâu Inh gô pơjao lu sư lăm tơpang ti ih, wă kơ ih băt Inh bơih Kră Yang.’ ”

English: So Ahab said, “By whom?” And he said, “Thus says the LORD: ‘By the young leaders of the provinces.’ ” Then he said, “Who will set the battle in order?” And he answered, “You.”
Bahnar: Ahap jet dơ̆ng: “Bu gô pơm tơdrong 'nâu?” 'Bok khan lê̆ adrol tơl. “'Nâu Kră Yang khan: “Ih athei yua lu bơngai tơdăm bơ̆jang ala kơ lu 'bok pơgơ̆r tơring char gô pơm.’ ” Ahap apinh dơ̆ng. “Lei bu wă pơtơm năm tơblah?” 'Bok khan lê̆ adrol tơl: “Ih bơih.”

English: Then he mustered the young leaders of the provinces, and there were two hundred and thirty-two; and after them he mustered all the people, all the children of Israel—seven thousand.
Bahnar: Na Ahap krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơdăm bơ̆jang ala kơ lu 'bok pơgơ̆r tơring, đei 'bar-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'bar 'nu. Sư kư̆m krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael đei tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu dơ̆ng.

English: So they went out at noon. Meanwhile Ben-Hadad and the thirty-two kings helping him were getting drunk at the command post.
Bahnar: Lu Sư lĕch năm 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk 'năr dơ̆ng kơplah Ben Hadat hơdai hăm pêng-jĭt 'bar 'nu pơtao buăl dơ̆ng sư et tơdrô suai lăm kơđông.

English: The young leaders of the provinces went out first. And Ben-Hadad sent out a patrol, and they told him, saying, “Men are coming out of Samaria!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơdăm bơ̆jang ala lu 'bok pơgơ̆r tơring char lĕch adrol: 'Ben Hadat wơh bơngai năm chop lăng lu sư; wih roi kơ Ben Hadat. “Đei bơngai lĕch đơ̆ng Pơlei Samari.”

English: So he said, “If they have come out for peace, take them alive; and if they have come out for war, take them alive.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Tơdah lu sư năm tơ âu apinh tơdrong hiôk-hian, lei iĕm athei rong arih; dah mă lu sư năm tơ âu wă tơblah iĕm kư̆m athei rôp arih mơ̆n.”

English: Then these young leaders of the provinces went out of the city with the army which followed them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơdăm bơ̆jang ala kơ lu 'bok pơgơ̆r tơring char lĕch hlôi kơ pơlei tih boih păng lu linh kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư.

English: And each one killed his man; so the Syrians fled, and Israel pursued them; and Ben-Hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with the cavalry.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơlôch lu bơngai ayăt 'noh mơ̆ng kơ tơ'bơ̆p 'bơ̆t anăp. Đĭ-đăng lu linh Siri kơdâu tơklah tơklang na lu linh Isơrael druh 'moi. Ben Hadat klaih, kơdâu hao seh hơdai hăm minh 'bar 'nu lu linh hao seh.

English: Then the king of Israel went out and attacked the horses and chariots, and killed the Syrians with a great slaughter.
Bahnar: Pơtao đe Isơrael năm blah lu linh hao aseh, pơlôch lu bơngai Siri lơ dêh.

English: And the prophet came to the king of Israel and said to him, “Go, strengthen yourself; take note, and see what you should do, for in the spring of the year the king of Syria will come up against you.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh 'bok khan lê̆ adrol năm dơ̆ng jê̆ pơtao đe Isơrael păng khan: “Ih athei năm pơjing ming lu linh ih mă pran kơtang đơ̆ng, ih athei lăng hơmet mă hơlen tơdrong kiơ wă pơm, yua kơ bơyan puih sơnăm anăp kơnh pơtao Siri gô năm blah ih dơ̆ng.

English: Then the servants of the king of Syria said to him, “Their gods are gods of the hills. Therefore they were stronger than we; but if we fight against them in the plain, surely we will be stronger than they.
Bahnar: Lu đam Siri bơ̆jang kơ pơtao siri khan kơ pơtao sư: “Yang lu sư 'noh yang kông, thoi noh na lu sư pran hloh kơ bơ̆n. Mă-lei tơdah bơ̆n tơblah hăm lu sư tơ lăm thŭng dơnă, lei sĭt bơ̆n pran hloh kơ lu sư.

English: So do this thing: Dismiss the kings, each from his position, and put captains in their places
Bahnar: Apinh pơtao athei pơm thoi âu: Tơjur đĭ lu pơtao 'noh đơ̆ng anih lu sư pơgơ̆r linh, na pôk atŏk lu yŏng linh pơgơ̆r tơplih lu sư.

English: and you shall muster an army like the army that you have lost, horse for horse and chariot for chariot. Then we will fight against them in the plain; surely we will be stronger than they.” And he listened to their voice and did so.
Bahnar: Păng ih athei chă tơmơ̆t linh mă tôm dôm linh ih mă hiong adrol 'noh, chă aseh păng gre aseh kư̆m tôm lei-lăi thoi so; đơ̆ng noh lu bơ̆n gô tơblah hăm lu sư tơ lăm thŭng dơnă. Sĭt lu bơ̆n gô pran hloh kơ lu sư.” Pơtao đe Siri mơ̆ng păng pơm kiơ̆ hloi thoi noh.

English: So it was, in the spring of the year, that Ben-Hadad mustered the Syrians and went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng Ben Hadat krao akŭm lu linh Siri tŏk năm tơ Pơlei Aphek wă tơblah hăm lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And the children of Israel were mustered and given provisions, and they went against them. Now the children of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of goats, while the Syrians filled the countryside.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael kư̆m krao akŭm đĭ-đăng, hơmet tơmam sa wă tơblah. Kon pơlei Isơrael pơm kơđông lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp tơklă kon pơlei Siri thoi 'bar khŭl bơbe tŏ-ĕt, gah lu linh bơngai Siri lơ dêh 'bĕnh-'bang kơ tơring char.

English: Then a man of God came and spoke to the king of Israel, and said, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Because the Syrians have said, “The LORD is God of the hills, but He is not God of the valleys,” therefore I will deliver all this great multitude into your hand, and you shall know that I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua năm jê̆ pơtao Isơrael păng khan: “Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ kon pơlei Siri khan kơ Kră Yang noh yang kông, ưh kơ trŏ kơ yang thŭng dơnă ôh. Thoi noh na inh gô pơjao lu linh lơlap 'nâu lăm tơpang ti ih păng iĕm gô băt Inh bơih Kră Yang.”

English: And they encamped opposite each other for seven days. So it was that on the seventh day the battle was joined; and the children of Israel killed one hundred thousand foot soldiers of the Syrians in one day.
Bahnar: 'Bar khŭl sư tơdơ̆ng tơklă băl lăm tơpơh năr. Năr mă tơpơh lu sư tơblah băl; lăm minh năr lu linh Isơrael pơlôch lu linh Siri yak jơ̆ng hloh minh-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu.

English: But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; then a wall fell on twenty-seven thousand of the men who were left. And Ben-Hadad fled and went into the city, into an inner chamber.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai klaih đơ̆ng anih tơblah 'noh kơdâu ôn tơ lăm Pơlei Aphek, mă-lei dur pơlei pơchah kơtĭt lu sư lôch đei 'bar-jĭt tơpơh 'nu. Ben Hadat kư̆m kơdâu mơ̆t lăm pơlei, sư ôn tơ minh anih hlơp.

English: Then his servants said to him, “Look now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings. Please, let us put sackcloth around our waists and ropes around our heads, and go out to the king of Israel; perhaps he will spare your life.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai jang kơ pơtao khan kơ pơtao: “Lu nhôn kơtơ̆ng đe khan pơtao đe Isơrael đei tơdrong mơnat. Dang ei apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn tơ̆n 'bi tơ kơiĕng păng pơ̆n tơlei tơ kơ̆l đơ̆ng noh yơ̆r ti năm tơ'bơ̆p pơtao đe Isơrael. Rŏ lăng sư kư̆m ăn kơ ih arih mơ̆n.”

English: So they wore sackcloth around their waists and put ropes around their heads, and came to the king of Israel and said, “Your servant Ben-Hadad says, ‘Please let me live.’ ” And he said, “Is he still alive? He is my brother.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu sư tơ̆n 'bi tơ kơiĕng păng pơ̆n tơlei tơ kơ̆l lu sư lĕch yơ̆r ti chu thuơ kơ pơtao Isơrael păng khan: “Ben Hadat đĭch đam ih khan: ‘Apinh ih ăn kơ inh arih.’ ” Ahap jet: “Sư oei arih hă? Sư 'noh 'nhŏng oh inh.”

English: Now the men were watching closely to see whether any sign of mercy would come from him; and they quickly grasped at this word and said, “Your brother Ben-Hadad.” So he said, “Go, bring him.” Then Ben-Hadad came out to him; and he had him come up into the chariot.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'noh mơ̆ng nơ̆r pơtao Ahap pơma 'noh 'lơ̆ng tơpă na lu sư lui hloi, khan: “Ben Hadat 'noh 'nhŏng oh ih tơpă.” Ahap khan dơ̆ng: “Lu iĕm năm iŏk sư tơ âu.” Na 'Ben Hadat năm tơ'bơ̆p Ahap. Pơtao Ahap pơtơm 'Ben Hadat hao gre aseh sư.

English: So Ben-Hadad said to him, “The cities which my father took from your father I will restore; and you may set up marketplaces for yourself in Damascus, as my father did in Samaria.” Then Ahab said, “I will send you away with this treaty.” So he made a treaty with him and sent him away.
Bahnar: Ben Hadat khan kơ Ahap: “Inh gô pơdrâu ăn kơ ih dôm lu pơlei mă 'bă inh tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng 'bă ih. Ih gô pơm hnam mơdro sa tih tơ lăm Pơlei Đamas, kư̆m thoi 'bă inh đei pơm bơih tơ lăm Pơlei Samari.” Ahap tơl: “Gah inh, gô drơ̆ng ăn kơ ih brŏk kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r ih pơkă 'nâu.” Thoi noh Ahap pơkă pơkăm pơgơ̆p hăm 'Ben Hadat, đơ̆ng noh ăn kơ Ben Hadat brŏk.

English: Now a certain man of the sons of the prophets said to his neighbor by the word of the LORD, “Strike me, please.” And the man refused to strike him.
Bahnar: Chu nơ̆r Kră Yang, đei minh 'nu lăm lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol khan kơ buăl sư: “Apinh ih teh inh,” Mă-lei buăl sư ưh kơ teh sư.

English: Then he said to him, “Because you have not obeyed the voice of the LORD, surely, as soon as you depart from me, a lion shall kill you.” And as soon as he left him, a lion found him and killed him.
Bahnar: Na sư khan: “Yua kơ ih ưh kơ chu nơ̆r Kră Yang, na lăp ih weh đơ̆ng inh kơnh dăm-brang gô châu pơlôch ih.” Lăp sư weh, đei minh pôm Dăm-brang châu sư lôch hloi.

English: And he found another man, and said, “Strike me, please.” So the man struck him, inflicting a wound.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bơngai khan lê̆ adrol tơ'bơ̆p bơngai nai dơ̆ng, na sư khan: “Apinh ih teh inh.” Bơngai 'noh teh hloi bơngai khan Lê̆ adrol truh đei rơka.

English: Then the prophet departed and waited for the king by the road, and disguised himself with a bandage over his eyes.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bơngai khan lê̆ adrol 'noh năm ngôi 'bơ̆t trong gô pơtao. Sư gom muh măt sư hăm che pơm bơngai nai.

English: Now as the king passed by, he cried out to the king and said, “Your servant went out into the midst of the battle; and there, a man came over and brought a man to me, and said, ‘Guard this man; if by any means he is missing, your life shall be for his life, or else you shall pay a talent of silver.’
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao năm brih trong 'noh sư ôr apinh pơtao: “Đĭch đam ih oei lăm anih tơblah; na đei minh 'nu năm ba kơ inh minh 'nu bơngai bơnă păng khan kơ inh: ‘Ih athei wei bơngai 'nâu; tơdah sư kơdâu klĕnh tơ nai, lei tơdrong arih ih gô tơplih kơ sư 'noh, dah mă ih duh minh talâng hu.’

English: While your servant was busy here and there, he was gone.” Then the king of Israel said to him, “So shall your judgment be; you yourself have decided it.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah đĭch đam ih oei hăt kơ tơdrong jang 'nâu tơdrong jang to, na bơngai bơnă 'noh kơdâu klĕnh.” Pơtao Isơrael khan kơ sư: “Tơdrong 'noh, kơdih ih gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong sek tơlang.”

English: And he hastened to take the bandage away from his eyes; and the king of Israel recognized him as one of the prophets.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư pơih lê̆ che đơ̆ng gom muh măt sư 'noh na pơtao Isơrael kơnăl sư 'noh bơngai khan lê̆ adrol.

English: Then he said to him, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Because you have let slip out of your hand a man whom I appointed to utter destruction, therefore your life shall go for his life, and your people for his people.’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai khan lê̆ adrol 'noh khan kơ pơtao Isơrael: “Kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: ‘Yua kơ ih achăng bơngai mă Inh jao ăn kơ ih wă kơ ih pơlôch sư. Na tơdrong arih ih gô tơplih tơdrong arih sư, păng tơdrong arih lu kon pơlei ih gô tơplih tơdrong arih lu kon pơlei pơla sư.’ ”

English: So the king of Israel went to his house sullen and displeased, and came to Samaria.
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih, lăm char Samari, jơhngơ̆m sư blĕk ơh hơ'ngon ưh pă băt dang yơ.

English: And it came to pass after these things that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard which was in Jezreel, next to the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu tơdrong 'noh, đei dơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu: Nabôt Pơlei Jêsreel, đei minh hlak pơgar hơmu jê̆ hnam Ahap pơtao dêh Samari.
