English: So Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, “Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, because it is near, next to my house; and for it I will give you a vineyard better than it. Or, if it seems good to you, I will give you its worth in money.”
Bahnar: Ahap khan kơ Nabôt. “Apinh ih ăn kơ inh pơgar hơmu ih 'noh, inh wă pơm pơgar pơtăm hla 'nhot, yua kơ jê̆ hnam inh. Ba tơplih hăm pơgar hơmu inh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ pơgar hơmu ih 'nâu, dah ih wă tĕch dôm yơ, inh gô ăn kơ ih jên.”

English: But Naboth said to Ahab, “The LORD forbid that I should give the inheritance of my fathers to you!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Nabôt khan kơ Ahap: “Apinh Kră Yang wei 'nĕ ăn inh ăn kơ ih tơmam đơ̆ng 'bok kơdră inh.

English: So Ahab went into his house sullen and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him; for he had said, “I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers.” And he lay down on his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no food.
Bahnar: Ahap mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ hiôk păng sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ nơ̆r Nabôt, bơngai Jêsreel; đei khan kơ pơtao: “Inh ưh kơ gơh ăn kơ ih ôh tơmam đơ̆ng lu 'bok kơdră inh. Ahap mơ̆t 'bĭch tơ giơng tep om ơh sơ'ngon ưh kơ sŏng sa.

English: But Jezebel his wife came to him, and said to him, “Why is your spirit so sullen that you eat no food?”
Bahnar: Jêsebel akăn sư năm jê̆ sư păng jet sư: “Yua kơ kiơ ih ơh Sơ'ngon păng ưh kơ sŏng sa?”

English: He said to her, “Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite, and said to him, ‘Give me your vineyard for money; or else, if it pleases you, I will give you another vineyard for it.’ And he answered, ‘I will not give you my vineyard.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư tơl: “Yua kơ inh khan kơ Nabôt bơngai Jêsreel: ‘Tĕch ăn kơ inh mir hơmu ih 'noh inh gô ăn jên dah mă tơplih băl hăm mir hơmu inh nai kư̆m bưh, mă-lei sư khan: ‘Inh ưh kơ gơh ăn kơ ih mir hơmu inh.’ ”

English: Then Jezebel his wife said to him, “You now exercise authority over Israel! Arise, eat food, and let your heart be cheerful; I will give you the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.”
Bahnar: Jêsebel akăn sư khan kơ sư: “Dang ei hăm trŏ kơ ih pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael ưh? Jah iung păng sŏng bĕ, chơt hiôk bĕ, Inh gô ăn kơ ih mir hơmu Nabôt, bơngai Jêsreel.”

English: And she wrote letters in Ahab’s name, sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters to the elders and the nobles who were dwelling in the city with Naboth.
Bahnar: Jêsebel chih hla bơar yua hăm anăn pơtao Ahap păng chơ̆m tơdra đơ̆ng pơtao, đơ̆ng noh gơih ăn kơ lu kră pơlei păng lu bơngai đe pơyom oei hơdai hăm pơlei Nabôt.

English: She wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and seat Naboth with high honor among the people
Bahnar: Sư chih lăm hla bơar 'noh: “Tơbăt tơtă kơ kon pơlei athei kơ̆m giĕng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa. Athei ăn kơ Nabôt hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei.

English: and seat two men, scoundrels, before him to bear witness against him, saying, “You have blasphemed God and the king.” Then take him out, and stone him, that he may die.
Bahnar: Athei ăn 'bar 'nu bơngai pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anăp sư, 'bar 'nu pơm kơdranh hơlĕnh khan. Nabôt hiap Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hiap pơtao. Đang kơ noh athei dui tơlĕch sư tơ jih pơlei klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo.”

English: So the men of his city, the elders and nobles who were inhabitants of his city, did as Jezebel had sent to them, as it was written in the letters which she had sent to them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lăm pơlei, kră pơlei păng lu bơngai mă đe pơyom lăm pơlei pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Jêsebel pơkă lăm kơthơ chih gơih ăn kơ lu sư.

English: They proclaimed a fast, and seated Naboth with high honor among the people.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơbăt tơdrong kơ̆m giĕng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa păng ăn kơ Nabôt oei 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei.

English: And two men, scoundrels, came in and sat before him; and the scoundrels witnessed against him, against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, “Naboth has blasphemed God and the king!” Then they took him outside the city and stoned him with stones, so that he died.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh ăn 'bar 'nu bơngai hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anăp Nabôt; na jâu sư 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla khan: “Nabôt hiap Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hiap pơtao.” Na lu sư dui Nabôt lĕch tơ jih pơlei klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo.

English: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, “Naboth has been stoned and is dead.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư wơh đe năm roi kơ Jêsebel khan: “Đe klơ̆m bơih Nabôt păng tơmo sư lôch bơih.”

English: And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned and was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab, “Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give you for money; for Naboth is not alive, but dead.”
Bahnar: Lăp Jêsebel kơtơ̆ng đe roi khan đe klơ̆m pơlôch Nabôt păng tơmo bơih, sư iung hloi năm khan kơ Ahap klo sư: “Iung bĕ, năm iŏk mir hơmu Nabôt Pơlei Jêsreel mir mă đêl sư ưh kơ wă tĕch ăn kơ ih 'noh, yua kơ Nabôt lôch bơih.”

English: So it was, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab got up and went down to take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
Bahnar: Lăp Ahap kơtơ̆ng khan Nabôt lôch bơih, sư iung năm hloi tơ mir hơmu Nabôt Pơlei Jêsreel păng iŏk hloi mir 'noh jing mir sư kơdih.

English: Then the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Êli pơlei Tisbit

English: “Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who lives in Samaria. There he is, in the vineyard of Naboth, where he has gone down to take possession of it.
Bahnar: Iung bĕ jur năm tơ'bơ̆p Ahap pơtao đe Isơrael oei tơ pơlei Samari, dang ei sư oei tơ lăm mir hơmu Nabôt, yua kơ sư iŏk mir hơmu 'noh kơ sư kơdih.

English: You shall speak to him, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Have you murdered and also taken possession?” ’ And you shall speak to him, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth, dogs shall lick your blood, even yours.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Ih khan kơ sư: “Kră Yang khan: Hăm trŏ kơ ih pơlôch tơ'ngla sư bơih păng tơgar iŏk mir sư?” Ih kư̆m khan kơ sư: Kră Yang khan: ‘Tơ anih mă kŏ liah bơih pham Nabôt, kŏ kư̆m gô liah pham ih.’ ”

English: So Ahab said to Elijah, “Have you found me, O my enemy?” And he answered, “I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do evil in the sight of the LORD
Bahnar: Ahap khan kơ Êli: “Ơ bơngai ayăt kơ inh, ih rôp tơm măt hă?” Êli tơl: “Inh rôp ih tơm măt boih,” yua kơ ih tĕch akâu ih kơdih wă pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Na Sư khan

English: ‘Behold, I will bring calamity on you. I will take away your posterity, and will cut off from Ahab every male in Israel, both bond and free.
Bahnar: ‘Inh gô ăn tơdrong gleh truh kơ ih. Inh gô tơhiong pơtôch lê̆ ih, păng pơrăm pơđĭ hnam Ahap truh tơ đĭ-đăng đĭch dah bơngai rơngei lăm dêh char Isơrael

English: I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah, because of the provocation with which you have provoked Me to anger, and made Israel sin.’
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ adrĕch hnam ih đei tơdrong răm truh thoi adrĕch hnam Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat păng thoi adrĕch hnam Baasa kon drŏ-nglo Ahija.’ Yua kơ ih pơm tơblĕk wă kơ inh hil păng pơhlŭ bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch.

English: And concerning Jezebel the LORD also spoke, saying, ‘The dogs shall eat Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m khan gah Jêsebel: ‘Kŏ gô sa sĕch Jêsebel tơ lăm pơlei Jêsreel.’

English: The dogs shall eat whoever belongs to Ahab and dies in the city, and the birds of the air shall eat whoever dies in the field.”
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu adrĕch hnam Ahap, tơdah sư lôch lăm pơlei, kŏ gô sa, bơngai bu lôch tơ bri brah sem păr gô choh sa.”

English: But there was no one like Ahab who sold himself to do wickedness in the sight of the LORD, because Jezebel his wife stirred him up.
Bahnar: Tơpă, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu thoi Ahap tĕch akâu sư pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, kiơ̆ kơ Jêsebel akăn sư pơhlŭ.

English: And he behaved very abominably in following idols, according to all that the Amorites had done, whom the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong sư pơm kơ Kră Yang areh dêh, sư kơkuh kơ rup yang thoi lu bơngai Amôrit kơkuh, lu sư noh kon pơlei pơla mă Kră Yang pơpuh tơlĕch bơih lu sư đơ̆ng anăp lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: So it was, when Ahab heard those words, that he tore his clothes and put sackcloth on his body, and fasted and lay in sackcloth, and went about mourning.
Bahnar: Lăp Ahap kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma noh, sư hek ao sư kơdih. Sư iŏk hrŭk ao 'bi păng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa; sư 'bĭch kơpal 'bi păng chu iŏk đon ala.

English: And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Êli Pơlei Tisbit

English: “See how Ahab has humbled himself before Me? Because he has humbled himself before Me, I will not bring the calamity in his days. In the days of his son I will bring the calamity on his house.”
Bahnar: “Ih hăm 'bôh Ahap tơjur akâu iŏk đon ala 'bơ̆t anăp Inh ưh? Yua kơ sư tơjur akâu iŏk đon ala 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, na Inh ưh kơ ăn tơdrong pơmat truh, 'bơ̆t chăl sư 'nâu ôh; mă-lei lăm chăl kon drŏ-nglo sư Inh gô ăn tơdrong gleh truh kơ hnam sư.”

English: Now three years passed without war between Syria and Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng sơnăm Aram păng Isơrael ưh kơ đei tơdrong tơblah.

English: Then it came to pass, in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went down to visit the king of Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm sơnăm mă pêng, Jêhôsaphat pơtao đe Juđa, jur năm ngôi hơpong tơ pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: And the king of Israel said to his servants, “Do you know that Ramoth in Gilead is ours, but we hesitate to take it out of the hand of the king of Syria?”
Bahnar: Pơtao đe Isơrael khan kơ lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ sư. “Lu iĕm hăm băt ưh pơlei Ramôt Gileat 'noh teh lu bơ̆n, mă-lei lu bơ̆n kư̆m oei hreh ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ, wă pơdrâu iŏk sư đơ̆ng tơpang ti pơtao Aram?”

English: So he said to Jehoshaphat, “Will you go with me to fight at Ramoth Gilead?” Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “I am as you are, my people as your people, my horses as your horses.”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ Jêhôsaphat: “Ih hăm wă blah iŏk Pơlei Ramôt Gileat hơdai hăm inh ưh?” Jêhôsaphat tơl pơtao đe Isơrael: Inh kư̆m thoi ih, kon pơlei pơla inh kư̆m thoi kon pơlei pơla ih, aseh inh kư̆m thoi aseh ih mơ̆n.”

English: Also Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, “Please inquire for the word of the LORD today.”
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat khan kơ pơtao đe Isơrael dơ̆ng: “Mă adrol hloh bơ̆n athei krao apinh jet Kră Yang 'mơ̆i.”

English: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said to them, “Shall I go against Ramoth Gilead to fight, or shall I refrain?” So they said, “Go up, for the Lord will deliver it into the hand of the king.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na pơtao đe Isơrael krao akŭm đei puăn-hrĕng 'nu lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, na jet lu sư: “Inh hăm gơh năm blah pơlei Ramôt Gileat ưh dah lê̆ đĕch?” Lu sư khan: “Gơh mơ̆n, năm blah bĕ, yua kơ Kră Yang gô jao pơlei 'noh lăm tơpang ti ih.”

English: And Jehoshaphat said, “Is there not still a prophet of the LORD here, that we may inquire of Him?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jêhôsaphat jet: “Tơ âu hăm pă đei 'bok khan lê̆ adrol nai Kră Yang wă kơ bơ̆n apinh jet sư?”

English: So the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “There is still one man, Micaiah the son of Imlah, by whom we may inquire of the LORD; but I hate him, because he does not prophesy good concerning me, but evil.” And Jehoshaphat said, “Let not the king say such things!”
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael tơl Jêhôsaphat khan: “Đei oei pă minh 'nu anăn sư Mikai kon drŏ-nglo Imla; đơ̆ng sư 'noh bơ̆n gơh krao apinh jet Kră Yang; mă-lei inh areh kơ sư dêh, yua kơ sư ưh kơ khan lê̆ adrol tơdrong 'lơ̆ng gah inh, tă tơdrong kơnê̆ ngăl.” Jêhôsaphat tơl: “Pơtao ih 'nĕ kơ pơma thoi noh.”

English: Then the king of Israel called an officer and said, “Bring Micaiah the son of Imlah quickly!”
Bahnar: Pơtao đe Isơrael krao minh 'nu bơngai yŏng păng khan: “Krao Mikai kon drŏ-nglo Imla năm tơ âu mă tĕnh.”

English: The king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, having put on their robes, sat each on his throne, at a threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao đe Isơrael păng Jêhôsaphat pơtao đe Juđa hrŭk ao pơtao hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao tơ anih đe preh 'ba 'bơ̆t jê̆ 'măng jang Pơlei Samari. Đĭ-đăng 'bok khan lê̆ adrol oei pơma khan lê̆ adrol 'bơ̆t anăp bre sư.

English: Now Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made horns of iron for himself; and he said, “Thus says the LORD: ‘With these you shall gore the Syrians until they are destroyed.’ ”
Bahnar: Sêđekia, kon drŏ-nglo Kênaana hơjơ̆m pơm hơke păng bơsei khan: “'Nâu Kră Yang khan: ‘Hăm hơke 'nâu ih gô tơ̆m pơlôch pơrăm pơđĭ lu bơngai Aram!’ ”

English: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, “Go up to Ramoth Gilead and prosper, for the LORD will deliver it into the king’s hand.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol pơma lei-lăi: “Tŏk blah bĕ pơlei Ramôt Gileat gô jei ih tơpă; “Kră Yang gô pơjao pơlei 'nâu lăm tơpang ti ih.”

English: Then the messenger who had gone to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, “Now listen, the words of the prophets with one accord encourage the king. Please, let your word be like the word of one of them, and speak encouragement.”
Bahnar: Bơngai mă đe wơh năm krao Mikai 'noh, sư khan: “Lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, lu sư pôm jơhngơ̆m hăm nơ̆r pơtao hơpơi rŏ kơ nơ̆r ih kư̆m khan lê̆ adrol trŏ thoi lu sư. Pơma bĕ mă 'lơ̆ng.”

English: And Micaiah said, “As the LORD lives, whatever the LORD says to me, that I will speak.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Mikai khan: “Sĭt tơpă Kră Yang mă arih, inh gơh pơma tơdrong kiơ mă Sư athei inh pơma.”

English: Then he came to the king; and the king said to him, “Micaiah, shall we go to war against Ramoth Gilead, or shall we refrain?” And he answered him, “Go and prosper, for the LORD will deliver it into the hand of the king!”
Bahnar: Lăp Mikai tơ'bơ̆p pơtao, pơtao jet sư: “Ơ Mikai, bơ̆n hăm gơh năm blah Pơlei Ramôt Gileat ưh, dah mă lê̆ kơ năm blah đĕch?” Mikai tơl: “Năm blah bĕ, gô jei bơ̆n; Kră Yang gô pơjao pơlei 'noh lăm tơpang ti ih.”

English: So the king said to him, “How many times shall I make you swear that you tell me nothing but the truth in the name of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao khan: “Dôm wơ̆t bơih inh athei ih pơma mă tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp inh pơkă hăm anăn Kră Yang.”

English: Then he said, “I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. And the LORD said, ‘These have no master. Let each return to his house in peace.’ ”
Bahnar: Mikai khan: “Inh 'bôh đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael tơklah tơklang jơ̆p kơ kông kŏ thoi triu ưh kơ đei bơngai wei; păng Kră Yang khan: ‘Lu sư ưh kơ đei tơ'ngla, rim 'nu kơ lu sư athei brŏk tơ hnam kơdih hăm tơdrong hiôk-hian.’ ”

English: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?”
Bahnar: Pơtao đe Isơrael khan kơ Jêhôsaphat: “Inh đei roi kơ ih bơih sư 'nâu ưh kơ đei khan lê̆ adrol 'lơ̆ng kiơ gah inh, sư ling-lang khan lê̆ adrol kơnê̆ ngăl”

English: Then Micaiah said, “Therefore hear the word of the LORD: I saw the LORD sitting on His throne, and all the host of heaven standing by, on His right hand and on His left.
Bahnar: Mikai tơl: “Thoi noh, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: Inh 'bôh Kră Yang hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao păng đĭ-đăng linh jang 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng awih awăn gah 'ma gah 'ngiĕo kơ Sư.

English: And the LORD said, ‘Who will persuade Ahab to go up, that he may fall at Ramoth Gilead?’ So one spoke in this manner, and another spoke in that manner.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet: ‘Bu gô năm pơhlŭ Ahap, wă kơ sư tŏk tơ Pơlei Ramôt Gileat, na pơ̆k lôch tơ noh?’ Đei mơ'nah tơl khan thoi âu, đei mơ'nah khan thoi noh.

English: Then a spirit came forward and stood before the LORD, and said, ‘I will persuade him.’
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu yang truh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang khan: ‘Lê̆ inh năm pơhlŭ sư.’

English: The LORD said to him, ‘In what way?’ So he said, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.’ And the LORD said, ‘You shall persuade him, and also prevail. Go out and do so.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang jet: ‘Ih pơhlŭ sư thoi yơ?’ Yang 'noh tơl: ‘Inh gô năm pơm yang pơma hơlĕnh lăm 'bơ̆r lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă jang kơ sư.’ Kră Yang khan: “Trŏ bơih, ih gơh năm, pơhlŭ sư lei ih năm bĕ păng pơhlŭ sư thoi nơ̆r ih pơma 'noh.’

English: Therefore look! The LORD has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these prophets of yours, and the LORD has declared disaster against you.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang đei ăn minh 'nu yang pơma hơlĕnh lăm 'bơ̆r lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mă jang kơ ih. Kră Yang wă pơm kơnê̆ truh tơ ih.”

English: Now Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah went near and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and said, “Which way did the spirit from the LORD go from me to speak to you?”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Sêđekia, kon drŏ-nglo Kênaana, năm jê̆ Mikai, tap tơ'bŏk sư, na khan: “Yang bơhngol Kră Yang lĕch đơ̆ng inh trong ayơ, mă năm khan kơ ih?”

English: And Micaiah said, “Indeed, you shall see on that day when you go into an inner chamber to hide!”
Bahnar: Mikai tơl: “Ih gô băt tơdrong noh, lăm năr ih kơdâu ôn tơ anih hrĕp kơnh.”

English: So the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah, and return him to Amon the governor of the city and to Joash the king’s son
Bahnar: Pơtao đe Isơrael athei. “Rôp Mikai pơjao sư tơ Ammôn, kră pơgơ̆r pơlei păng jao kơ Jôas kon pơtao

English: and say, ‘Thus says the king: “Put this fellow in prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and water of affliction, until I come in peace.” ’ ”
Bahnar: khan: “Pơtao khan thoi âu: Rôp chĭt bơngai 'nâu lăm hnam bơnă, iŏk 'bĕng păng đak tŏ sĕt, rong pơmat sư dĭng truh năr inh brŏk hiôk-hian.”

English: But Micaiah said, “If you ever return in peace, the LORD has not spoken by me.” And he said, “Take heed, all you people!”
Bahnar: Mikai tơl: “Tơdah ih brŏk hiôk-hian lei Kră Yang ưh kơ yua nơ̆r inh pơma ôh.” Sư khan dơ̆ng: “Ơ rim 'nu kon pơlei pơla, iĕm athei 'blŏk nơ̆r inh pơma.”

English: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth Gilead.
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao đe Isơrael păng Jêhôsaphat pơtao đe Juđa tŏk tơ pơlei Ramôt Gileat.

English: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into battle; but you put on your robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself and went into battle.
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael khan kơ Jêhôsaphat: “Inh năm tơ anih tơblah hrŭk hơbĕn ao hmă đĕch, mă-lei, ih kư̆ kơ hrŭk hơbĕn ao pơtao.” Thoi noh pơtao đe Isơrael hrŭk hơbĕn ao hmă pơm wă kơ đe ưh kơ băt na năm tơblah.

English: Now the king of Syria had commanded the thirty-two captains of his chariots, saying, “Fight with no one small or great, but only with the king of Israel.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao đe Aram đei krao păng pơkă ăn kơ pêng-jĭt 'bar 'nu yŏng linh đei lu gre aseh: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ blah bu hŏ, lu hơ'lơ̆p dah mă lu bơngai 'lŏ, iĕm athei blah rĕng kơ minh 'nu pơtao đe Isơrael đĕch.”

English: So it was, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, “Surely it is the king of Israel!” Therefore they turned aside to fight against him, and Jehoshaphat cried out.
Bahnar: Lăp lu yŏng linh gre aseh 'bôh Jêhôsaphat, lu sư khan: “To pơtao Isơrael tơ âu boih.” Na lu sư năm blah hloi pơtao mă-lei Jêhôsaphat ôr

English: And it happened, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
Bahnar: lu yŏng linh wei gre aseh băt noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ pơtao đe Isơrael, na lu sư kơdŭn wih tơ rŏng ưh pă druh pơtao dơ̆ng.

English: Now a certain man drew a bow at random, and struck the king of Israel between the joints of his armor. So he said to the driver of his chariot, “Turn around and take me out of the battle, for I am wounded.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei minh 'nu linh lăm lu sư gŭt hră dan 'brơ̆m, na hră sư phanh tă tơ 'bơm hloi pơtao đe Isơrael, 'bơm 'bơ̆t pơtrơp ao mam klĕch tơ kơtơh sư hloi. Pơtao khan kơ bơngai mă chĕp gre aseh sư: “Dui gre aseh wih tơ rŏng ba inh weh đơ̆ng anih tơblah 'nâu, yua kơ inh 'bơm 'brơ̆m bơih.”

English: The battle increased that day; and the king was propped up in his chariot, facing the Syrians, and died at evening. The blood ran out from the wound onto the floor of the chariot.
Bahnar: Lăm năr 'noh đei tơdrong tơblah rai tih; na đei bơngai bơring pơdơ̆ng pơtao lăm gre aseh sư, blah lu kon pơlei Aram. Truh kơsơ̆ sư lôch, pham lĕch 'bĕnh đơ̆ng rơka sư 'bĕnh kơ hơnă gre aseh.

English: Then, as the sun was going down, a shout went throughout the army, saying, “Every man to his city, and every man to his own country!”
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr wă mơ̆t bơih đei nơ̆r pơma rơ̆n đơ̆ng lăm lu linh khan: “Rim 'nu athei brŏk tơ pơlei sư kơdih păng rim 'nu athei weh tơ char sư kơdih!”

English: So the king died, and was brought to Samaria. And they buried the king in Samaria.
Bahnar: Pơtao lôch, na đe chơ ba atâu sư tơ plei Samari 'bŭ sư lăm Pơlei Samari.

English: Then someone washed the chariot at a pool in Samaria, and the dogs licked up his blood while the harlots bathed, according to the word of the LORD which He had spoken.
Bahnar: Đe ôp gre aseh pơtao tơ dơnâu đak Samari, anih mă lu drŏ-kăn đi juăt kơ hum păng kŏ liah pham sư tơ noh, trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan bơih.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that he did, the ivory house which he built and all the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang Ahap, đĭ-đăng tơdrong jang pơtao đei pơm, hnam pơtao sư pơm păng bơla rôih păng đĭ-đăng lu pơlei sư man pơjing, đe đei chih lê̆ bơih lăm hla bơar hơ'mon lu pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: So Ahab rested with his fathers. Then Ahaziah his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Ahap lôch năm oei hơdai lu 'bok kơdră sư; Ahasia kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: Jehoshaphat the son of Asa had become king over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat, kon drŏ-nglo Asa pơm pơtao đe Juđa lăm sơnăm mă puăn lăm chăl Ahap pơm pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat pơm pơtao đe Juđa sư 'nao pêng-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm đĕch; sư pơgơ̆r 'bar-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Mĕ pơtao anăn Asuba, kon drŏ-kăn 'bok Sihli.

English: And he walked in all the ways of his father Asa. He did not turn aside from them, doing what was right in the eyes of the LORD. Nevertheless the high places were not taken away, for the people offered sacrifices and burned incense on the high places.
Bahnar: Sư năm kiơ̆ trong gơlong Asa, 'bă sư ưh kơ weh trong nai, sư pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Also Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao ưh kơ đei yuih lê̆ lu anih kơkuh tơ anih kơjung, na lu kon pơlei oei năm pơm yang păng oei soh 'long pơgang 'bâu phu tơ lu hnam yang tơ anih kơjung noh.

English: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, the might that he showed, and how he made war, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat oei pơgơ̆p hiôk hơiă dih băl hăm pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: And the rest of the perverted persons, who remained in the days of his father Asa, he banished from the land.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong jang nai Jêhôsaphat pơm, tơdrong pran sư kĕ jei, tơdrong sư tơblah, đe đei chih 'măn lê̆ bơih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar hơ'mon gah lu pơtao Juđa?

English: There was then no king in Edom, only a deputy of the king.
Bahnar: Na sư pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai drŏ-nglo đi pơm kư̆ kă đơ̆ng lăm char sư, mă oei đei đơ̆ng chăl Asa, 'bă sư pơgơ̆r.

English: Jehoshaphat made merchant ships to go to Ophir for gold; but they never sailed, for the ships were wrecked at Ezion Geber.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lăm char Eđôm ưh kơ đei pơtao, đei minh 'nu yŏng chă jang tang tơplih pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Then Ahaziah the son of Ahab said to Jehoshaphat, “Let my servants go with your servants in the ships.” But Jehoshaphat would not.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat pơm duk đơ̆ng char Taris wă năm tơ dêh char Ôphir, sư chă maih mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ yĕng kơ năm, yua kơ duk sư pơchah tơ pơlei Êsiôn Gêber.

English: And Jehoshaphat rested with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the City of David his father. Then Jehoram his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Ahasia kon drŏ-nglo Ahap khan kơ Jêhôsaphat: “Apinh ih song đĭch đam inh tŏk duk năm hơdai hăm đĭch đam ih,” mă-lei Jêhôsaphat ưh kơ ăn.

English: Ahaziah the son of Ahab became king over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned two years over Israel.
Bahnar: Jêhôsaphat lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư, đe 'bŭ sư hơdai hăm lu 'bok kơdră sư tơ pơlei Đawit 'bok sư, Jêhôram kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơtrơp đơ̆ng sư.

English: He did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his father and in the way of his mother and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who had made Israel sin
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă mơjĭt-tơpơh lăm chăl Jêhôsaphat pơm pơtao đe Juđa. Ahasia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahap pơm pơtao Isơrael tơ dêh Samari. Sư pơgơ̆r lăp 'bar sơnăm đĕch.

English: for he served Baal and worshiped him, and provoked the LORD God of Israel to anger, according to all that his father had done.
Bahnar: Sư pơm lơ tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, kiơ̆ trong 'bă sư păng mĕ sư păng kiơ̆ trong Jêrôbôam kon drŏ-nglo Nêbat, bơngai mă pơhlŭ lu bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch.

Sư kơkuh păng bơ̆jang kơ yang Baal, pơm lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ tơblĕk Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael hil, pơm kiơ̆ thoi trong 'bă sư pơm bơih. 05-Mar-2008@ 23:17, Backup Description=19-Feb-2008@04:51, UYNH - 11-Nov-2014@18:29, Backup Description=
